stray is a good game that ends too quick imo 8 hour run time is not enough for the price point at the time of my review ($30) hauntingly beautiful soundtrack, environments, and story will keep you engaged and craving more

the game is pretty short, but that’s actually a good thing — it doesn’t get boring. the story is simple and short, but still interesting. you want to see what happens next, even if some parts are predictable. there are also a few side quests, like collecting things or helping someone. there aren’t too many of them, so they don’t get annoying. the atmosphere is amazing — 10 out of 10. the soundtrack is great too. the graphics are nice and pleasant. the gameplay is fun, and it’s especially enjoyable just walking around as a cat in these beautiful locations. the puzzles aren’t hard, but sometimes you can end up stuck somewhere with no easy way **** ending was really sad. this is the first game that actually made me tear up at the end. i definitely recommend trying it, but it’s a good idea to watch a review first — in case puzzles and adventures in an underground neon-lit city full of robots aren’t your thing.(not my translate)
stray is an absolutely beautiful game. i also love the cyberpunk aesthetic.

ill put this game a 10/10 because i loved it. game looks amazing, very beautiful, cute, many interesting and good things about cat. plot in this game is great, atmosphere also. sometimes its scary sometimes its funny, but most of the time it is really interesting and great

a game that knows what it aims to be, and does just that with quality and polish. it doesn't over-promise, and it doesn't overstay its welcome. a neat package, a bite-sized adventure well worth its asking price.
despite its unique premise, the game suffers from shallow gameplay, dull puzzles, and a lackluster story.

stray es un juego con un potencial que no alcanza. la base de todo es la fantasía de jugar como un gato, pero al final más que hacer eso lo que tienes es un walking simulator donde el personaje es un gato pero mucho de lo que haces no es lo que haría un gato. añade al walking simulator algo de diálogo para crear una historia super básica y genérica, algunos puzzles tan sencillos que llamarlos puzzles es una exageración y algunas secciones un poco más ágiles y más o menos tienes el juego. lo que quedaría es la parte de exploración para encontrar objetos ocultos y así pero esa parte en general es floja, siendo las zonas muy pequeñas en su mayoría.gráficamente el juego está bastante bien ejecutado, especialmente el gato está fantástico, pero a mi a nivel estético me acabó cansando mucho. el sonido es más bien flojo, con unos efectos escasos y repetitivos, y una música poco presente y que en general mejor sin ella. y el juego tiene importantes bugs, causando reinicios de ordenador e incluso llegué a un punto en que hay que hablar con un pnj y no quería, siendo imposible avanzar en el juego y me dio demasiada pereza volver a empezarlo (probé a reempezar el capítulo y mismo problema) así que no pude acabarlo y eso que es un juego muy corto (tiene un logro para hacerlo en menos de 2 **** resultado, en mi opinión, es una oportunidad perdida. un 4.

oh qu’il est mignon le minou ! et rare en plus… parce qu’un rouquin tigré comme ça, j’en ai jamais vu… mais le voici perdu dans une ville abandonnée… mais qui peut devenir hostile, car elle n’est pas abandonnée par tout le monde ou plutôt par tous ces bidules ici et là !lesquels vous sautent dessus… et là, c’est le drame ! et du coup, ils ont gâché leur gentil simulateur de promenade, c’est ballot quand même… ils l’ont gâché avec ces saloperies et en même temps des sortes d’énigmes pour s’en sortir, je **** qui somnolais gentiment devant ce truc assez dépaysant, ma foi -et fort joliment fait en plus. la patte artistique est là, servie par une technique pas mal du tout en fait. moi qui somnolais à moitié donc, car le simulateur de promenade est propice à la somnolence, forcément. et voilà qu’ils me font chier avec leurs peluches enragées qui sautent et tuent mon chat !!et là, c’est le drame ! désinstallation immédiate et note-sanction en guise de punition (et inversement). mais j’irai jusqu’à deux quand même, oui deux points, car il ne faut point être trop sévère non plus. quand même. ils ont tout gâché, la promenade est foutue, retour à la maison, mon chaton !

tabletop simulator 2 what is the genre? its less **** and more of physics-engine. are there any similar games or is it a sequel? it's like garys mod or something along those lines. its a not in its self but its a physics engine that allows the users to play any game that they want. how is the gameplay? as i said before, it gives options to allow users or players to play any game. specifically any card, board or tabletop game. tabletop simulator comes with a few basic games but where the application truly excels is in the steam workshop where there are thousands of games. it's a great way to try new games before spending $70-80. how is the offline and online? it includes both, i have yet to play online with other people but i have played locally and it works very well. is there any single player? of course, you can. you can download mods that have single player. you can also create your own games. the nice thing is, its a great way to playtest a new game that you're working on. would i recommend it? absolutely, i keep trying to get my friends to get the game. we used to get together and play tabletop games every sunday but then one of my closest friends moved away. now obviously don't get together to play tabletop games, i keep telling them that this is a fantastic alternative. recap: the good the possibilities with this are endless. the perfect way to create a new tabletop game recap: the bad it's not much **** recap: the okay n/a

bloons td battles 2 is what happens when someone at ninja kiwi said: “what if tower defense… but also ranked anxiety?” you boot it up thinking “haha monkeys vs balloons,” and suddenly you’re sweating over **optimal eco curves** while some guy named “xxblo0ngodxx” sends fortified zomgs on round 28. --- ### pros: * same adorable bloons, now in glorious hd ruining your entire evening. * heroes add “personality” which is nice, because you definitely need quincy saying “i never miss” after you absolutely do. * meta constantly shifting so you can never, ever be happy or comfortable. * every match feels like a job interview for “war criminal, bloon division.” --- ### cons: * you: “i’ll try a fun off-meta strategy.” matchmaking: *puts you against a guy with 4k hours and a spreadsheet open.* * one mis-timed rush and your entire economy folds like a dollar store lawn chair. * “rubber to gold” is also the name of what this game does to your free time. * ranked = climb 100 trophies in 2 hours, lose them all in 10 minutes, go lie down on the floor. --- ### peak battles 2 experience: * both players quietly farming, building defenses, playing it safe. then round 18 hits and suddenly it’s **wwiii with purple and zebra bloons.** * you send a giant, carefully calculated all-in rush. opponent defends with 3 abilities and an emote. you sit there, broke, watching the defeat screen in 4k. * “gg” typed with tears in your eyes and 3 fps left. --- 10/10 turned strategy, math, and psychological warfare into one colorful package. would say “no rush, just chilling” and then full-send fortified bads again.

this game fun occasionally, maybe a game or two a day, but its not the sort of game i could see myself playing for hours on end. would still recommend it to any bloons fans (play btd6 first). overall the game is less of a test of skill, and more of a knowledge check, at least until you get to the top .1% of players. early laddering is basically looking at the opponents board and seeing what they forgot to account for and exploiting it. this works for most ranks, and can be fun if you like stomping newbies. there are a lot of newbies. note that this game looks like microtransaction hell at first glance, and while the game is easily ftp, i could see a more impressionable person throwing money into the in game marketplace.

bloons td battles 2 delivers a solid and engaging multiplayer tower defence game: it has the mechanics, players, and polish you’d want. for players who are committed and understand what they’re getting into, it’s well worth playing. however, the game is not without caveats: the progression system, perceived pay-to-win elements, and pacing may hinder the experience for some. final call: if you’re into strategic duels, enjoy tower defence and are okay with some investment (time or money), go for it. if you prefer anything more casual or loathe grind/unlock systems, you might want to wait or approach cautiously.

a cute retro-style indie platformer, just like many other games in this genre. but oh boy does this game feel different. first, let's begin by what really matters : gameplay. this game is really fluid, with quick but still precise movement. the characters are a masterpiece of design, with their own sense of humour, quite absurd yet very effective. the time travel mechanic, with this completely different 16-bit style is a great game mechanic, that allows for exciting challenges. the metroidvania part where the levels that you got through in a classic left-to-right 2d platformer show much more depth is a great idea, although some may find it a bit repetitive. and finally, the ost. probably one of my favorites ost, with this 8-bit style music that where most songs ended up on my playlist. the newgame+ mechanic also allows for some replayability if you really enjoy the game. in conclusion, the messenger is definitely a great game, and itreally is worth your time.

the messenger é um jogo que cativa por sua premissa bem simples, gameplay e mecânicas precisas, ótima história e personagens, trilha sonora acima da média e gráficos lindos, aliados a belíssima direção de arte.tudo isso culmina em um jogo divertido, em que o elemento de plataforma se destaca, surpreendendo o jogador com novos desafios a cada área que é liberada. aliado a isso temos excelentes boss fights e mobs estrategicamente posicionados para dificultar nossa aventura o suficiente. isso torna a gameplay bem dinâmica e instigante pois ela é bem fluida e tem a dose certa de desafio, sendo assim um jogo quase que perfeitamente balanceado.

the messenger es un juegazo sin ningún tipo de dudas. de los creadores de sea of stars, este juego empieza siendo un juego de acción y plataformas y termina siendo un metroidvania exquisito. una música excelente así como un escenarios llenos de trampas para sacar lo mejor de nosotros. la experiencia puede durarte 10-15 horas pero tiene una gran cantidad de tareas secundarias y retos desafiantes.

the gameplay in this game is super good and feels great and greater, with well-designed stages rhythm the continuous gameplay fun and skill progression keep you engaged. surviving and solving interactive areas lead to boss fights. the pixel-art design is top-notch, and the story is captivating sinful witty and humorous dialogue. much content n playtime. 《 original 》

fantastic 2d platformer/action game. it's not quite the level of polish and perfection that celeste and katana zero are, but it's still an incredible game, with very satisfying gameplay and abilities. one thing with many lesser 2d platformers i see is that they tend to increase difficulty by added cheap tactics and unfair elements to the obstacles. i loved how messenger was pretty straightforward, and you'd know what to expect with everything just by briefly observing it. every success was earned, and every failure was my fault. if i knew how to clear something, and timed it correctly, i could do it every time without fail.

a game that manages to make slow zombies a threat. decisions have weight and are mostly locked with timers which brings on the extra surge of urgency. beautifully told story with heartfelt moments and memorable characters. difficult to tell the effect of good decisions over bad ones for the overall group with how characters often react, making it a puzzle game of fixing the right pieces to make for a better ending than losing people to preventable catastrophes and everything else that ain't teeth. one of the best choice-based games i've ever played. the kind to experience if you want to watch a movie you have a say in. 9.5/10. the joys of missing quick time events and getting rocked.

2012 what a year it was

when decision-based, cinematic games first started taking off, twd came out of nowhere and set the bar pretty high. the plot and decisions presented to the player are top-notch offerings, with each episode being full of memorable encounters and exiting (or depressing) moments. it had somewhat of an advantage of being the first "big" telltale-style game, but make no mistake: the hype for this one is pretty real. there's some age on it at this point and the game's engine in particular was never that great, but it's still an easy [b]5 out of 5 game[/b]. other attempts in this genre may come and go, but lee and clementine are forever.

«the walking dead» by robert kirkman was originally not a story about those who rose from the dead in the mould of our beloved george a. romero, but about those who remained in this world to enforce laws according to their own, often twisted moral compass. in turn, the phrase «the walking dead» refers to the unconverted people who have ceased to be human. in the first and most heart‑wrenching part, playing as lee everett, we have to do quite a lot to ultimately achieve true catharsis.

i thoroughly enjoyed the game... and very rarely does a single player game grab my attention. i have played through the walking dead: survival instinct about 5 times now in attempts to save all the necessary survivors. every time i have played through the game.. i have experienced different content (locations) i was not exposed to before... i felt the ai was aptly responsive and worked very well. this is not the left 4 dead series... getting hit means soemthing... stealth is somewhat required. sure, there could be more graphics tweaks, or coop, or pvp... but the game was just released... who knows what they may have in store later. until then i found the game stimulating and entertaining all around. i also experienced no glitches or bugs. at the end of the day.. this game was created for hardcore walking dead fans... which i am and i love the game. the game could be salvaged from a "marketing" standpoint quickly by releasing more meaty content for the game.. and not charging the players for it.

the walking dead: survival instinct is an enjoyable game that combines the claustrofobic feeling of being chased by walkers and the need to scavenge in a good way, but the graphics are very dated and some issues keep the experience from its prime.

review_text: there is a lot of nostalgia tied with this game, for sure. i will always love when this was just gmod tower, and even with it becoming its own thing, which i will say was a grand thing for it to be able to do, for sure, i will also admit that it did sort of, in a way, make it that much harder to get into it in its own right. i do feel like i've gotten a good time out of it, for sure, but i can also see how some people might not think that way about it with how it is now. i will say that, even with the last time i touched it being a good while ago, i have gotten a good time out of it, and i hope that if anyone else gets it, they have a grand ol' time with it as well.

review_text: this game is soulless. the magic of "gmod tower" is gone and dead; nonetheless, a soulless shell persists on its grave. and that game is tower unite. throughout the years, the game has been slowly dying and losing interest to those who had hoped it would be a golden frontier for gmod tower. but sadly, they failed to deliver. with the slow updates and repetitive gameplay, most players succumbed to boredom and deleted the game right after. the updates don't include a lot of material for players to work with. being forced to be stuck with a limited gameplay loop of: a. a very small player base that plays mini-games, which may consist of 3 to 5 players, or, if unlucky, none of the mini-games have any active player base. b. oversimplified mini-games. because of how simple the game is, it becomes boring very fast due to its very repetitive nature. of course, i can go for hours talking about the flaws and issues with the game. but that wouldn't solve anything, nor be necessary. i'm overall disappointed with how this game turned out. sure, there's gambling and great detail with all these games and how they look and function. it doesn't feel rewarding after a certain point. it feels bland. of course, this is my opinion and feeling about the game, and others feel different, but overall, this is what i've noticed.
genres: Adventure, Action, Casual, Indie, Massively Multiplayer

review_text: unfortunately even after 1.0 release this game is so laggy, both in terms of performance and networking, that the experience of even something as basic as walking around in the lobby is deeply unpleasant, let alone playing a minigame. i really wish i could recommend this game but it's so hard to look past the fact that, despite some interesting and fun aspects, the core gameplay experience is still disorientingly laggy and unstable despite years of updates. if i wasn't always rubber banding around the lobby and experiencing big frame hitches just walking around, i'd probably give the game more consideration, but unfortunately the game feels *very* janky and uncomfortable to play.
genres: Adventure, Action, Casual, Indie, Massively Multiplayer

review_text: it's a good game. there's a lot to do. and this review would normally be positive, but: it is incredibly buggy. alone in half a week of playing again, there have not just been simple overlookable bugs but outright game-breaking ones, including full hard crashes. and in addition to that, the servers themselves also have massive lagspikes spanning 15 seconds, if not longer. this was sort of excusable in early access, but the game has been released since then. from a gamedev perspective there have also been really odd choices regarding ui/ux among other things. i want to reiterate that it is a ton of fun with all the things you can do, but i cannot recommend it currently due to the above issues at the asked price at all.

review_text: vrchat is a platform of many extremes, and that is something that has to be accepted when playing, especially in public lobbies. i've personally had some of the most enjoyable times, enlightening conversations, and the closest connections i could've ever imagined. i've also seen some of the most vial, gross and downright reprehensible content spread here. it's a polarizing tugging of both ends of the spectrum. vile language and frequent inappropriate content are frequent in public lobbies due to the lack of moderation. a good strategy is to get some close friends or a tightknit community to hang out with in private lobbies, and avoid public lobbies aside from most games. you should be fine then, but be prepared if something else should arise. the block button is a wonderful feature, and you should not be afraid to use it if someone is being offensive or reprehensible. if you're a parent looking at reviews to get a gauge on if this game is okay for your kids, wait until they turn 18 for their own sake. if you're a child thinking you're mature enough, you are not. wait until your 18 for your own safety, and thank me later. if you're over 18, you're an adult. go in with an open mind, and you'll be surprised at some of the pleasant folk that wander some of the quieter corners of the community.

review_text: i can't say for playing with strangers, but i always have fun playing this with my friends and partners, and i love that there's always new worlds to explore, there's so many different worlds that even playing by myself is fun and how i often play, i have no experience with uploading worlds, but i've had decent luck uploading avatars using vroid, blender, unity, and vrchat's offical helper add-on/ app (i can't remember what it's called but it's on their website) though i definitely recommend watching some youtube videos for guides and extra help, all in all, i think vrchat is fun, i know many people have bad experiences playing online with strangers, unfortunately, in a lot of cases, you have to do your own moderating and make sure you block, and if necessary, report, people that are causing issues or harassing you or others, vrchat is a huge platform with countless players and the moderators can only keep up so well if people aren't actually using the in game reporting system

review_text: vrchat is a social platform for everyone, provided "everyone" is a subset of people who own a full-body tracking suit and have decided their spirit animal is a neon-blue fox. the ratio is approximately 80% fluff to 20% existential crisis. if you stand still for too long, you will be adopted by a pack of digitally enhanced canine avatars. it's less a game and more an accidental, full-scale ecosystem designed to test the limits of your pc's shader capacity and your own tolerance for ear-splitting squeals. if you are looking for a reminder that society is actively degrading and that technology merely provides us with new, more efficient ways to be miserable together, vrchat is perfect. it is a necessary, awful, and deeply honest reflection of who we are when there are no consequences.

review_text: a good concept, but.... i ended up giving up. you have nothing to do there unless you're already with your private friends. people are asocial, it just doesn't make me wanting to return there. struggling to develop my review as all of my experiences have been bad there since the first time i tried, so i guess i will just give pros and cons. [h3]pros[/h3] • be what you want as long as you have your model to import. • if you don't have your own model, many are available to get in game. • playable on pc and vr. • various worlds with many purposes, such as games, exploration, or a simple home to relax in. • customization is almost limitless, but... [h3]cons[/h3] • ... extremely complexe to create and to setup, especially compared to competitors • community is very closed. don't join hoping meeting people. join with your own friends. • steamlink terribly unstable depending on setups. • subscription options too much highlighted. it almost jumps to your eyes on the menu, and happens to appear on loading screens. [h3]subjective points[/h3] • none comes in mind, feels like experience is black or white (but mostly black) [h3]final note[/h3] since it's free, you can always give it a try and potentially spend time with your friends in there, but that's it.

back in 2022 vampire survivors did not invent its genre but it did give it a major boost in popularity, now there are numerous survivor-likes everywhere. but back thern its content was pretty damn anemic. a big part of the major content that has been introduced since then can be found in the dlcs, but there were also plenty of updates to the base game. the result of this is that there is at least something to do in this game unlike many lesser titles. there is a sizable number of unlocks, a clear progression path of what to do and unlock next, many different stages with some unique gimmicks and plenty of hidden secrets. if you go for full completion you will be busy for a while and even if you arent then the variety can be entertaining for a while. that said, this is still the game that survivor-likes come from and therefor does not innovate upon the genre. for the most part it really is just the same eternal loop of pickung up a few weapons and upgrading them until the entire screen explodes and the game becomes hard to look at. you can do this with many different characters and weapons now but the result and gameplay will always be the same. but there is a reason this genre got popular and its 5 bucks without a sale, just give it a try, you will at least get a few hours out of it.

poncle, i love your game, i bought it for 3 of my friends and we have all your dlc. while we all understand the new online mode is exactly what it is; new. there are many a problem we face. opening chests during late games will cause all of us in the game to be hung up and nobody can open the chest forcing one or all of us to altf4 and reboot the game. this has been an ongoing thing for the past 4 days as i post this comment so it's not a one time thing to complain about. three times just on the night i am sending this, our game has frozen during online play and while all our survivors could move. we could not interact with floor drops, pause or see the other players move at all, all while being immune to damage and dealing none to the enemies. once again, i love your game and understand that the function is new so i can't bitch too much, i just want to inform you and others reading that this is a problem we are facing at the moment. thank you very much for readin

i wanted to like this. i can't play more than a few matches in a row because it feels very unrewarding and... i dunno, unfun. it sucks the joy of playing video games out of me as i try to play it. i have no idea what i'm supposed to do to progress. knowing who to use or what stage to complete for the next unlock you need to continue in the game itself is completely unclear. you can unlock stages well before you have the upgrades to beat them. exclamation points draw you to stages that have seemingly no objective left to complete. and worst of all, every match either feels too easy or is frustratingly impossible. you can either walk the map with impunity, as if there were no mobs spawning around you, or you're being hopelessly overwhelmed and were doomed from the start, regardless of choice and skill. i had such high hopes for this, but i've been sorely disappointed.

after the latest update, the max item slots in couch coop were reduced from 4 to 2 per player. this completely breaks the balance and progression for duo play. how are we even supposed to reach the grim reaper (30-minute mark) with only 2 upgrades? some weapons (like peachone and ebony wings) are already useless early on without evolving, and now evolution is basically impossible because you can’t hold both needed weapons. (maybe with exdash but do i need cheatcodes to progress?) i started playing this game with another person, and we wanted to unlock everything only by playing duos. we put around 10 hours in - having fun, progressing steadily - then suddenly there’s an update, and this massive change hits without any mention in the patch notes. no explanation, no reasoning. our progress didn’t just slow down - it pretty much died. i’m not interested in using cheat codes or having one player sit out just so the other can unlock things. why even make coop mode if you’re going to cripple it like this? i saw people saying online that you can “unlock party mode” from the west wood map by gambling with someone \ but what even is west wood? where do you unlock it? can i even reach that point playing duo with only 2 item slots each? also a bit separate matter but the wiki is zero help with anything regarding couch coop. to make it worse, the game now crashes around the 25-minute mark since this same update. what even changed in the base game if the update was only supposed to add online coop? all in all, this update feels rushed, untested, and uncommunicated. vampire survivors used to be a so fun in couch coop but now it's just unplayable.

the new online update sucks. you can't help each other unlock stuff; you are essentially just a helper in battle. if you want to unlock a weapon or character, you essentially have to do it twice for both of you, but on couch co-op it works like it's supposed to. when i did that, i could unlock multiple things at once and only needed to do it one time.

well i did not know that i enjoyed deck building games. perhaps you have not played one? it (the enjoyment above) started with many friends saying that i should check out slay the spire (ss from now on) and that game hooked me in. then i decided to check out some twitch streamers of ss and gravitated towards one of them. this streamer then was playing monster train (mt) and i asked him what his opinion of it was. he said "he enjoys it more than ss and thinks it is the better game". i pretty much wholeheartedly agree with him on this sentiment. gobs of replayability due to the two faction team choices and then the three champion choices within the main faction. 100 hours later and it is one of the few games (less than ten) that i have bought on mobile. lots of love have gone in to this game and i would recommend it to anyone!

[b]score: 8/10[/b] [list] [*][b]art style:[/b] the art direction is solid and cohesive, with detailed card designs and distinctive unit visuals. while the overall aesthetic might not appeal to everyone, it fits the game’s theme effectively and maintains visual clarity even during the most hectic battles. [*][b]music:[/b] the soundtrack is quite good. there are memorable and entertaining themes that enhance the experience, even if they don’t all stand out individually for extended listening. [*][b]story:[/b] very basic story. the narrative serves as a light framing device rather than a deep or meaningful journey. [*][b]gameplay:[/b] strong variety of characters (clans) and deck-building options. the core idea is original and fun. that said, some combinations aren’t very well balanced, which can affect fairness and replayability. [/list]

the first around 3-4 hours are really fun learning the game, once you know what to look out for the game plays itself most of the times. even after trying out other gimmicks, clans and whole different ways to make my deck, i realized the game is way to easy. each time you win, the games makes it a little bit "harder" for you to win, however every addition is so minor even after those add up you can counteract them pretty easily as well. for example when starting a run at higher "difficulty" a lot of trash cards get added to your deck, the simplest way it to mark the unwanted cards with freeze, or simply remove them, there are such solutions for most things in the game like this, knowing what abilites the bosses have before facing them makes this more strategic but also yet again easier.

in the moment of writing slay the spire has 97/100 and this has 96/100, in that one percent there is a lot of quality. monster train plays (and looks) like a generic mobile game. monster train is one of the easier card games and is probably great if you have little or no experience with this kind of game but it will offer a veteran player nothing but dull disappointment.

[h1]it has less agency during fights than sts[/h1] once you play a unit on a certain floor, that's it, you can't play the unit again this fight (except if you upgrade that card with a special rune) and you can't move the unit to other floors (except with spells). the only other choices you get regarding that unit is whether you play other units in front or behind and whether you play spells on it. after all the units have been played, you're cycling through the cheap spells, waiting for the better spells to draw. [h1]waiting out bossfights is wasting the your time[/h1] when all waves are cleared and the boss enters the first floor, units will repeatedly take turns hitting each other, until either your units are dead or the boss is dead. there is nothing you can do, besides watch. this is so stupidly boring, that the game teaches you to use the fast forward button during the tutorial. there's no point in watching, since you can't influence it in any way. these two designpoints render everything else the game does well, irrelevant. music is good, boss gimmicks are neat, challenges are good, menu animations are quick, gameplay mechanics are reasonably readable. but i don't recommend it.

amazing game, maybe 7 or 8/10 for new players, but definitely a 10/10 if you spend the time to really learn the game. no game i have ever played goes as in depth for so many different systems and mechanics that all intersect beautifully. the movement is top-notch, the melee combat smooth and satisfying, the gunplay is very fun and responsive, the wide array of different warframes to play as are individually unique and in-depth, and the upgrades systems for each are also very in-depth and compliment eachother well. the story and lore of warframe, while it may seem very minimal in the earlier hours of the game, is a major part of my personal enjoyment of the game. the biggest downside of the game, however, is the earliest hours of the game. the game itself does not do a very good job at teaching new players how the upgrades and damage systems work, and will require a lot of time either researching on the wiki, or being taught by veteran players. that being said, digital extremes have been including ways to streamline the path of the new player with their recent updates to the game such as adding a new quest that teaches new players about how to mod their weapons to deal specific damage types. warframe also has the most positive and new-player friendly community i have ever been a part of. veterans of the game (myself included) are very eager and happy to teach new players how to do everything that the game itself struggles to teach. but also be aware, there is a toxic side of the community, while it is small, they have become a little louder since people from the destiny 2 community are migrating to the warframe community.

warframe — rise of the tenno across the stars warframe throws you into a breathtaking galaxy teeming with conflict, mystery, and opportunity. every mission, from stealthy infiltrations to high-octane battles, challenges players to master movement, timing, and strategy while navigating ever-changing environments. combat is exhilarating and precise. each warframe offers a distinct playstyle, and chaining abilities, acrobatics, and weapon combos turns even standard encounters into thrilling spectacles. elite missions and boss fights push players to think creatively and execute flawlessly, rewarding skill and adaptability. exploration is expansive and engaging. open-world hubs, hidden corridors, and procedurally generated events encourage curiosity and experimentation. frequent updates, limited-time events, and new missions ensure the experience remains fresh for both newcomers and veterans alike. progression is rich and satisfying. upgrading weapons, unlocking warframes, and customizing builds provides meaningful growth. cooperative multiplayer adds depth, allowing squads to combine powers and strategies for devastating effect, while solo players can also tackle challenges with careful planning and mastery. visually, warframe captivates with detailed sci-fi landscapes, fluid animations, and spectacular particle effects. the soundtrack and immersive sound design enhance the intensity of every mission, making exploration and combat feel cinematic and alive. final verdict: warframe is a thrilling, ever-evolving adventure that blends speed, strategy, and skillful combat. with endless customization, deep progression, and dynamic multiplayer, it offers a galaxy of challenges for any player willing to master its systems. "a fast, fluid, and endlessly exciting journey through a galaxy of combat and discovery." overall rating: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ 10/10

игра "i love you, colonel sanders! a finger lickin’ good dating simulator" — это, пожалуй, самое неожиданное и абсурдное творение, которое только можно себе представить. вы играете за студента кулинарного техникума, который должен выбрать свой путь, а именно – стать партнером легендарного полковника сандерса. графика в стиле ретро, простая, но очаровательная, создает атмосферу чего-то наивного и слегка безумного. диалоги полны юмора, зачастую довольно специфического, и отсылок к kfc. сами свидания с полковником – это отдельная история, полная неловких моментов, кулинарных вызовов и неожиданных поворотов. механика проста: выбирай ответы, развивай навыки и старайся понравиться полковнику. игра не претендует на глубину, но дарит массу смеха и позитивных эмоций. это идеальный выбор, если хочется чего-то легкого, забавного и совершенно несерьезного.

i love you, colonel sanders! a finger lickin’ good dating simulator is not a game, it's an e-book that's been dumped on steam masquerading as a game. as a visual/interactive novel, this doesn't feature any notable gameplay, it's just a lot of clicking through badly written dialogue that would never have been accepted or published in print, which poses the question, "how did something this badly written end up on steam?". when someone hoping to become an author is unable to get published in print, they spend $100 and dump their high school fan-fiction onto steam, under the guise of a game. i was wondering when this rather infamous marketing campaign from kfc would hit my queue. and here it is. it's not a game, first and foremost, it's a cyoa dating sim featuring col. harlan sanders, the bane of all chickens. this e-book was fronted on steam by kfc's marketing department, and unsurprisingly went slightly viral. so this is a parody of other e-books and the purpose is to sell fried chicken. e-books aren't games, and this fast food advertisement also isn't a game. even the noid game from dominos had gameplay. and, ultimately, this needs to be judged by the value it provides to pc gamers here on steam, and that is none. while this fast food advertisement e-book is "free", your gaming rig is not a kindle, and we deserve better than having steam be used as a tool of the marketing arms of global corporations. it's impossible for me to recommend things to pc gamers that aren't really games.

tower unite is everything i loved about the old gmod community experience, modernized and expanded into its own vibrant world. as someone with several hours in gmod, i truly appreciate the culture this game has built on and evolved. it captures that same sense of creativity, fun, and community but with its own unique personality. the variety of mini-games is a blast, and there’s always something new to jump into. whether you’re competing, exploring, or just hanging out, there’s a strong social aspect that brings players together in a way few games manage these days. i enjoy all the activities tower unite offers, and it’s clear the game has plenty of room to grow. the dedicated dev team is constantly improving things and seems genuinely passionate about the project. it’s refreshing to see developers so involved and committed. overall, tower unite is an awesome experience with tons of potential. i’m excited to keep playing and can’t wait to see where the devs take it next.

jugué la primera entrega de insurgency y me encantó por completo. sus modos de juego, el ritmo, ese equilibrio entre arcade y realismo me parecieron una experiencia única dentro de los shooters en primera persona. insurgency: sandstorm mantiene ese mismo espíritu, pero elevando todo a otro nivel. gráficamente es muy superior, el sonido es espectacular cada disparo, cada explosión se sienten intensamente reales y la jugabilidad sigue siendo su punto más fuerte.este no es un shooter para cualquiera. tiene un enfoque más táctico y realista que call of duty, pero no llega a los extremos de simulación de arma, quedando justo en ese punto medio que lo hace tan especial. su gunplay es excelente, el arsenal está muy bien trabajado, y los mapas y modos están diseñados para ofrecer combates intensos, inmersivos y llenos de tensión. si encajas con este estilo de juego, es muy probable que te quedes por decenas o incluso cientos de horas. y aunque no seas ese jugador “ideal”, sandstorm sigue ofreciendo razones de sobra para jugarlo, sobre todo si tienes amigos con quienes compartir la **** definitiva, lo recomiendo sin dudar por su jugabilidad, por el realismo bien medido, por sus gráficos mejorados y por su sonido impresionante. un multijugador diferente que merece más atención de la que tiene.

just like my favorite game of all time l4d2 this game is extremely replayable the community might be toxic to certain people yes i can see that but i love them i interact with some of the same people here and there and they give me a good laugh. the game gets updates pretty frequently for things like cosmetics, maps, double xp (for account level) it doesn't let the game hang out to dry like what rockstar games did to red dead redemption 2 mp. the reason i put it as a 9/10 instead of a 10/10 is phasing issues when i shoot someone sometimes the bullet goes through them and hits behind them and there's a weird bug recently i've recently got in the pass few days of ground texture being black but it stops when the game is done, none the less if i had 30 bucks and trying to get an fps that will last me a long time, if im looking for a game that isn't cod, rainbow 6, and im not looking for a game like ready or not/arma/squad, this is the game!!!

review_text: proud ameri̇cans!! pros: intense atmosphere - realistic gunplay - teamwork is crucialcons: steep learning curve - outdated visuals - not newbie-friendly rising storm 2: vietnam stands out among war games with its emphasis on realism and tactical depth. it’s not the most accessible title, but once mastered, it offers a deeply satisfying and immersive experience. the game captures the chaos of the vietnam war with great authenticity—from the crack of gunfire to the intensity of large-scale firefights. teamwork is absolutely crucial, as success depends more on coordination than individual skill. while its dated visuals and steep difficulty may deter newcomers, players who enjoy a strategic and realistic fps will find rs2 vietnam to be a uniquely rewarding experience.
genres: Action, Strategy, Simulation, Indie, Massively Multiplayer

review_text: this game is really fantastic. it's the game battlefield wants to be. it's tough and will kick your ass, but it's such a blast to play. it's not perfect. the game never feels "stable," and stuff like ping is constantly all over the place across the board. but it doesn't really detract from the experience too much. it's really a good time. there are some aspects that aren't ideal. the community is pretty toxic at times, but it's not something that plagues the entire player base. there are also a lot of classes where you will not be able to play 99% of the time. a lot of the classes can only have a certain amount of people select it at once, and it's based on a mostly first come, first serve basis around how quickly you load into the game. if you don't have the best ssd & setup, prepare to play rifleman and whatnot most of the time. even then, it's still great fun.
genres: Action, Strategy, Simulation, Indie, Massively Multiplayer

review_text: this is hands down the best fps game released since battlefield 2142 (maybe battlefield 3 at a push). a game for the proper gamer, where a modern call of duty approach of 'spray & pray' will be met with a swift bullet to the head at 50meters! if you are considering purchasing and are exacerbated by the ever reducing quality and dumbing down of games (cod, battlefield 4, v etc..) then please give this a shot! the realism is top notch and the mechanics are very balanced. yes it is challenging, but it makes it all more the satisfying when you manage to get a kill on the other team! those that have been negative about this game i would lump with the idiots that ruin modern mainstream games these days :(
genres: Action, Strategy, Simulation, Indie, Massively Multiplayer

review_text: solid all around shooter, very fun to play online in large scale battles. a great representation of the vietnam war. team work is key, had a blast playing online with friends several hours of fun and frustration. great online shooter with a multiplayer campaign mode, large selection of classes, weapons, and tools. pretty solid graphics and mechanics, def a must buy fr anyone that like large scale open battles with multiple objectives.
genres: Action, Strategy, Simulation, Indie, Massively Multiplayer

review_text: pretty fun shooter to just pop in and play for an hour or so. fairly cheap, too. good if you're looking for something slightly more tactical than cod or just a vietnam game
genres: Action, Strategy, Simulation, Indie, Massively Multiplayer

review_text: the gameplay itself is not that bad... but the developers made very dumb choices regarding the game. for example the cartoonish style of the characters (yet it's supposed to be a game where it feels like real war) , only few maps are actually good and therefore played by the users while the other maps are basically never voted (at the end of the match the players must vote for a map). for some reason, the developers implemented the possibility to chat with the enemy team... without being able to mute users tho, so far too often you will encounter toxic users on the enemy team who spams insults ruining the game experience. shame as it could have been far better.
genres: Action, Strategy, Simulation, Indie, Massively Multiplayer

review_text: imagine vietnam war but you have severe cerebral palsy and a russian guy shoves **** at your face.
genres: Action, Strategy, Simulation, Indie, Massively Multiplayer

review_text: good idea, but trash execution. buggy and clunky gameplay, **** audio design and really bad class system.
genres: Action, Strategy, Simulation, Indie, Massively Multiplayer

review_text: no single player mode in the f***ot game. i'm glad i didn't pay for this crap.
genres: Action, Strategy, Simulation, Indie, Massively Multiplayer

review_text: rising storm 2 is one of the best, while one of the worst multiplayer games i've ever played! combat, gameplay, pace, maps, guns, sound, and community are awsome. servers, graphics, and animation ****! gameplay- its just divine, you feel like you are really in the war, and you can't just run for the objective, you need to be careful, cooperate with your teammates. the shots feel real, and every decision you make will have an impact (good or bad). the community always tries to help and is respectful. now the bad points: graphics and animations- they look kinda bad and outdated, even for a 2017 game, i mean, its unreal engine 3 and there are a lot of visual bugs. servers- now, this is the big problem: the worst servers i've seen in my entire life (including mw)... the game is free right now, and 20k people are playing the game, but it cant handle such amount of people! my question is: if they cant handle 20k players, why is it free? i mean, it is just a dumb move, and no one will want to return to the game, and it will die again... i can't find servers and the servers that are not full have 200 ping. everyone complaining about how poorly made the game is... and the **** menu and settings littrelay broke i can't make sound lower and the browser sistem just stops working sometimes (2000 games problems) 3/10 (i hope all of this gets better after everyone stops playing)
genres: Action, Strategy, Simulation, Indie, Massively Multiplayer

review_text: изначально брал в стиме с последующим рефандом т.к. система "на ключевых ролях пусть играют отборные тупицы" мне не зашла. сейчас получил в эпике нахаляву и не опленился зайти в надежде что чето поменялось. не поменялось - как была год назад фуфлом так и осталась. хотя система отсеивания нубья с ролей прям сама напрашивается - если ты за простого пехотинца покажешь результат - допускаешься к очереди на роль. но видимо эта простейшая концепция противоречит веселому духу игры для отбросов на главных ролях.
genres: Action, Strategy, Simulation, Indie, Massively Multiplayer

review_text: had some pretty bad first time experience. this game is almost unplayable for me. i7 and a 1080ti and yet finding servers to hold a framerate is a major problem...
genres: Action, Strategy, Simulation, Indie, Massively Multiplayer

review_text: awful, probably the worst shooter i've ever played. the whole experience - get killed over and over in one shot when you have no idea where the fire is coming from as everything looks like a blobby green mess.
genres: Action, Strategy, Simulation, Indie, Massively Multiplayer

review_text: i've got no problem with unforgiving games, but this game gives you literally nothing. there's a really steep learning curve, and really no reason to do it. the gameplay isn't unique. the maps are boring and straight up poorly designed, and the hitboxes and general controls just feel sloppy. if you like it, you like it, but there are many objectively better shooters out. it's just not fun.
genres: Action, Strategy, Simulation, Indie, Massively Multiplayer

review_text: critical bugs are killing the game: 'connection to the server has been lost' unranked bug, and when dying the dshk weapons disappear. needs another big patch from the devs.
genres: Action, Strategy, Simulation, Indie, Massively Multiplayer

review_text: very generic, mediocre shooter that is saved by its green army man mode. otherwise avoid this. it's buggy, the community of this game is toxic (not in just a gameplay either.. ran into so many bigots in this game... [is the game even being moderated at all????!?!??]), and the regular mp/campaign modes really just ****. --got this with my humble monthly subscription--
genres: Action, Strategy, Simulation, Indie, Massively Multiplayer

review_text: post void is a very very fun, very fast-paced fps arcade ish game. short but really fun and gets intense on the later levels. now is one of my games that i love to pick up and blast through some deranged looking enemies with an uzi that bounces off the wall and explodes in impact, what a game. i love pew pew shoot things 7.7/10
for only being about $3 this game is great! very fast paced and really cool visuals. my favourite thing about this game is the art style. it's a very short game but priced accordingly.

awesome and game!!! super adrenaline, lysergic and pulp with an exceptional art style and gunplay and a really raw, dirty rock&roll soundtrack... to be accompanied by some guitar wolf listening...love it!!!
the time is post void the place is post void and this game its pretty insane

the game is extremely fun and addictive with great replayability and a clear goal in mind but even with this in mind i do wish there was more diversity between runs being more types of upgrades between levels and different weapons. even so this game is great with out them and is one of the best things you can do with $5 (australian)
post void succeeds in being one of the most pulse pounding and hectic games i've ever played. good
probably the best way to spent your 2 dollars( dont eat that twix bar you pig buy this game instead) fast paced shooting with some grotesque enemies and hard as **** gameplay awww yeaah
[post void] is a fantastic yet ultimately too short fps experience. i would highly recommend [post void] yet it will definitely leave you wanting more.

gritty, raw, and unforgiving. post void is a perfect example of art direction and gameplay meeting abrasively (in the best way) to create a unique and whole experience. better move at a break-neck speed and hit shots with pinpoint accuracy or you'll never reach the end. this was the most fun i've had playing a game in a long time, can't recommend enough.
this is a very addictive fast pace game and the art style looks like you just took acid

turbo overkill is an excellent game that doesn't shy away from sending dopamine directly to your brain, i surprised myself playing the game over and over again without really thinking about it. the weapon roaster is extremely enjoyable to shoot and gibbing the enemies is music to my ears. overall it's a more than competent game and civvie should play part 2.

good side -comfortable character control and fast fighting system. -a story that does not take itself seriously is an aspect that makes me happy. -boss battles are good. -level design diversifies and develops in later sections. -you can shape your play style with the new cybernetic and weapon modes that open. -beautiful music. bad side -level design is shallow at the beginning. -the feeling of hitting is weak. -some weapons are both weak and meaningless. -the visuals sometimes hurt your eyes. according to 2025
this game is like low budget doom. i liked it but after a while it gets repetitive and boring.

hits hard, with killer gameplay and legit boomer shooter gunplay that reminds me of what the genre is all about. i don't play these games for the story or the visuals - i play them for the fun factor, and turbo overkill (for the most part...) excels. episode 1: 10/10 episode 2: 7/10 episode 3: 3/10 might just be an example of too much being a bad thing, but by the time i hit ep3 i was kinda over it. levels are all a bit long and my god these final boss fights are rough, with punishing lack of checkpoints etc. still i'd say the fights are fun as hell, with all the movement tech the game provides coupled with furious guns blazing. worth a play. just be prepared to wonder how long the ride is going to last. oh and why the fk is there a sniper in a retro shooter? and why in the fk are there multiple segments dedicated to it?

uff, es un juego increíble.tiene una historia minimalista, pero llena de personajes y de humor. el combate es extremadamente satisfactorio, tienes una serie de diversas armas para diferentes situaciones y con distintas habilidades que mejoras mientras juegas. también obtienes distintos elementos de tu equipo que te ayuda en la movilidad, así como en el **** diseño de niveles es excelente en su mayoría, hay uno que otro nivel que puede durar un poco más tiempo del que uno quiere y despúes hay otros que intentan diversificar las cosas añadiendo vehiculos y cosas así; algunos de estos ultimos funcionan bien, otros -en mi opinión-, no **** grafícas son bastante particulares, mezclan entre sprites, así como arte en tercera dimensión, eso sin contar lo bueno que es la banda sonora.además, el juego tiene muchos secretos, modos de juegos extra, distintos trucos que uno puede desbloquear por medio de secretos, así como la habilidad de siempre poder volver a jugar cualquier nivel manteniendo su progreso; tiene un sistema universal de desbloqueo, entonces uno puede jugar el primer nivel con todas las armas y mejoras del ultimo, por ejemplo. si no te gusta esto, siempre puedes empezar desde cero borrando tu **** general, es un juego de los mejores del género de disparos que han salido en epocas recientes.

i have not finished this game but i just really felt i had to say a few things about it.this is one of the greatest examples of what a small new studio with a brand new ip and a very limited budget can do when time and opportunity is given to people with incredible talent and video game design understanding. i have played so many shooters from huge aaa titles to aa to indies and truly very few can come even close to how this game is managing to capture the old school boomer shooter aesthetic while at the same time looking super modern and have amazing graphics. the combat is just so fast, so satisfying with some of the most spot on sound design and fps mechanics i've ever experienced.
it is the most fun i've had in a very long time plain and simple nothing more to it.

really fun boomer shooter, where every weapon is fun to shoot, the enemies are varied enough to be interesting and the arena levels are okay. level design is very poor, sadly, with unclear directions and it' frequently difficult to understand what the game wants from you. the ammo and health distribution is also an issue, there is no reliable way to get these from the enemies, unless they are fodder enemies. so it's not quite doom eternal level combat and some opponents fall into the bullet sponge category, but that's a small issue, since the game provides really fun weapons to engage with them.
amazing retro style fps. hadn't had a fill of adrenaline like this since i finished doom eternal. super recommended game!
turbo overkill aka chainsaw man the game 10/10.

haven't had this much fun since ultrakill and doom eternal. the game looks amazing despite it's pixelated models, and the gunplay feels amazingly fun. when people say "chainsaw man", the first thing that comes to mind is turbo overkill.

great world-building. fantastic music. creative level design. they nailed the feel of bouncing around in games like quake, and built a genuinely creepy and fun game around it. my main complaint is that some weapons are objectively much better than others, so as things get harder you pretty quickly get forced into using the same couple of weapons while ignoring the rest. the games of this genre that i've enjoyed the most have revolved around switching between well-balanced weapons to take advantage of their various strengths, but that aspect just isn't here. still a great game.
one of the best boomer shooters of nowadays. some levels have pretty meh level design, but that's it!

after a little over 3 hours on dusk, with having finished the first episode; i could confirm this game is incredible. the presentation is on point! the sound design, the soundtrack, the colour grading and general art style sells you the game's rural horror lovecraftian-ish **** combat design too are amazing. it took everything that made quake worked and made it it's own thing! from the non-linear level design as well as the enemy boss fight **** easy 10/10 from me. an amazing addition to my gaming library, and a must-play for any fan of boomer shooters.
good boomer shooter. a little simple gameplay wise but it has a really cool horror flavor
the atmosphere, gameplay, soundtrack, level design, sound design, visuals, and everything else is top-tier. i'd argue it's the second best game of all time, right behind elden ring.
having grown up on some of the og fps' like duke nukem and unreal, this is a blast to play.

it's a cool game. pros.: - old-school vibe and aesthetics. - references to quake (first one) and blood. - creative levels. especially in episode 3. - plenty of secrets. cons.: - idk. most of the things are cool. music is fine. probably, sounds are too primitive sometimes.
really good retro movment shooter the soundtrack is great

great boomer shooter. big variety of weapons, memorable enemies and levels. this is clearly a work of passion and talent, everything pieces together perfectly. if you feel like you might like it from the trailer you will most definitely love it, it's pretty straight forward. i had to cut one point because there are parts of the game that didn't click for me. sometimes i got lost in the level and wasn't sure how to progress, but not for long fortunately. the flipping mechanic is very confusing with the perspective change on the camera. there were also certain spots where the enemies would get stuck, but not too many. these are all just nitpicks. this game is absolutely gorgeous.

incredible indie game, it has a high resemblance to doom, even the keys, red, yellow and blue are present. i love the originality of this game! engaging and haunting soundtrack, horror/horror game is only really good when it has these 90s graphics, i also love the amount of bodies that are on the ground, the violence, an almost perfect game!
retro fps style is nice, but clunky controls, repetitive combat, and lack of innovation make it feel outdated and dull

boring and bland. got passed ep 1, and the only thing i got out of that was mild motion sickness. it's suppose to be a doom shooter but i don't see what the fuss is about with this game. it's a hard pass for me.
très bon fps, je l'ai trouvé très fun et coloré. les niveaux sont franchement très beau et bien réalisés. la difficulté est bien dosée. jouez-y !

overall a very fun, unique and interesting experience. the world of s#*t city is pungent, and fits exceptionally well with its art style (both in game and within the intro cutscene and accompanying art), atmosphere, tone and, best of all, the soundtrack. gameplay is engaging. as you progress and complete challenges within missions, you acquire a new pair of trainers which give you modifiers which range from a second life, explosions when you kick doors, giving enemies big heads, etc. it bodes well for replayability. the game at its core isn’t so challenging, but when going for the challenge stars, it makes the game a lot more difficult. the thing i like the most about this game is the artstyle, music, atmosphere and setting, i think it all fits together exceptionally well, and gives a breath of fresh air to the genre. a unique experience, and something that will stay in my mind for a while. highly recommend if you enjoy underground counterculture, pungent violence, somewhat challenging gameplay, and rave music
gayet saran bir oyun hikayesi de güzel hızlı akan bir oyun 5 saat lik bir deneyim bence deneyin ort 7.8 veririm

this game reminds me a lot of the ghostrunner series where it's definitely a first person shooter/melee game but it's less about just shooting your way through levels and more about being precise. feels more like a puzzle game to an extent than just a straightforward shooter. definitely a game where it's all about trial and error and you will absolutely have to play a level multiple times to get your run down perfect. a little frustrating because of this and because it feels like a grind and i constantly feel like even if i am doing well i could get killed going through a new doorway and have to restart the whole level all over again. the music is great and it is kind of a ridiculous concept of the world run by gangs and you being the one guy who's not in a gang. gameplay is super solid though which is bringing me back into it for sure. the random driving mechanics they threw in to the last two levels of the game totally threw me off and they were not intuitively controlled at all and that dropped the score for me because a solid shooter became a janky drive fest in the very last stretch of the game.
very fun game. very punishing and hard as well, but still very unique. can recommend!!!!

(my score : 7.9 /10) fast-paced action game that is exciting and quite challenging! combat in this game, apart from shooters using pistols or guns with limited ammunition, we can also rely on kicks with feet which we can wear with shoes or sandals, which we can unlock with the number of stars we get in each stage. there are 5 areas that must be passed on the **** city map to complete this game, including: the violence gang (15 stage + boss), the pollution gang (13 stage + boss), the business gang (15 stage + boss), the debauchery gang (13 stages + boss), crime tower (4 stages + boss). list of boss i faced: goocopkopter / goocopbomber / 1997 lucida. the sludge baron / the unflushable / the filth mind. the ceo / mega ceo / mecha ceo. pizza pig / unholy corpulence / spider pig. the crime minister. there are 2 endings in this game, namely bad and true ending. bad ending if we choose to accept the crime minister's offer to join and enjoy nice city by kicking premium sneakers into the fire. or choose premium sneakers and kick the crime minister! (true ending).

one of the best game i played this year, strongly recommended if you are a hotline miami fan. soundtrack complement the chaotic gameplay and design and different sneakers acts like game modifier giving you more re-playability.

anger foot" is a frenetic, adrenaline-packed first-person shooter that excels in delivering pure, unadulterated fun. with its dynamic combat, vibrant world, and engaging soundtrack, it's a must-play for fans of high-energy shooters. despite its over-the-top style and challenging gameplay, the game offers high replayability and endless thrills. - read the full review @ digitalcritiq dot com

like the first hotline miami, but 3d. better movement, gameplay and control that most of the doom/quake-like out there. the music its great, like in hotline, without the music this game wouldn`t be half of what it is. good art style, coherent with its setting and story. can replay the levels multiples times to get all stars and not feel discouraged in failure. however, once completed in full, there`s nothing that makes you try again. what`s the problem about this? the game is short already, and the full levels don`t add much time of play to the pool. the game is short. i want more, and i wish they have added a map editor.

fast-paced combat action that never gets dull, a great supportive soundtrack and overall sound design, hilarious writing in a super fun setting, great art style, and crazy good replayability. there are some performance nitpicks, but the good far, far outweighs the nitpicks. most fun game of 2024 so far.
excellent moment to moment gameplay, humor and art. needs performance improvements in some areas.
while its chaotic action has moments of fun, poor controls, lack of depth, and repetitive levels ruin the experience.
trash performance, refund. it's ridicolous that a game like this is running bad on a 7800x3d +4070.
20/10 y good el mejor juego de la historia es como doom pero mas frenético y con setso
this game has everything that makes a first-person shooter fun. its like dmc and quake combined absolute 10/10 would recommend.

the best single player shooter i have ever played. has amazing in-depth weapons that actually have variety, and there are creative ways to combine the weapons (literally marksman gun). the ost absolutely slaps, and i love the art style. this game is early access and yet it is better than 90 percent of modern aaa games.

i'm gonna begin with a question. do you like doom or doom eternal ? yes ? then stop reading and buy that game i m m e d i a t e l y. ultrakill is an awesome game that will ask all of your focus to be fun, you will need to not be interrupted to get the best experience. i won't spoil the game here, however, after playing it and playing another game, even doom, you feel what i call the "ultrakill syndrome". what's the ultrakill syndrome ? well it makes you feel like you're slow as hell everywhere, in every games. because ultrakill is the fastest game i've ever played, while doom eternal can be considered as a fast fps, ultrakill is an ultrafast fps.

while dusk looks like the first doom this ultrakill looks like doom 2016. if you have a pc that doesn't run doom 2016 you can buy ultrakill because it is the closest game that exists to the most modern doom. i'm only giving it a 9 because it's a hard game to master even on easy
10/10. best fps shooter of this decade. movements, guns, enemies, locations, bosses. all perfect.
this is the end, machine. you cannot defeat the power of an angel. prepare... to be ultrakilled!

ultrakill is best fps game on the world. you must olay this masterpice.....

walmart-brand doom eternal. you play with a lot of various abilities and weapons, but there's no motivation to try anything unique aside from flying around in circles and hold the trigger. at best it's a quake clone, and even then i've had more fun playing quake.

i am rating this 0 out of 10... just so you know exactly what ultrakill is. this is the 1st game in which i can the epilepsy warning should be taken seriously. it is the best adhd simulation of all time! and a passion project made on a shoe string budget, with a combat system that is so artisanally tuned that you can compare this to a rolex. the devs are meme lords, and the publisher loves puppies. the game know what its best parts are and leans in it, and the parts that are bad, it openly mocks. the game is 99% amazing. the 1% ruins it. what is that 1%... its not finished... and playing it on the hardest difficulty will leave you physically tired.
satisfying gameplay with great sound effects of weapons. the soundtrack is amazing, which changes to fit the frenetic action shooter it is.
очень крутой и бодрый шутер, от которого вообще не хочется спать. сложно остановится и единственный минус для меня, это не достаточно запоминающийся ost
tldr: the best boomer shooter on the market. pros: + satisfying gunplay + original level design + interesting enemies + beautiful explosions cons: – i just want more!

this game is soooo good! really one of the best single-player shooters i've played.beautiful mix between old graphics and new. i've become a big fan of the franchise. buy it an play it. it's worth every penny.
great game! very fun i really like it! great experience! one of the best boomer shooters!
peak doom shooter. not a moment went by where i didn't feel like a complete badass. highly reccomend.
that's by far the most entertaining first person shooter on the nintendo switch. graphic style is great, musics are matching the action and level design is just awesome. it's a must have !
excellent graphics, flawless gameplay, and a good variety. i eagerly look forward to new games from the studio.
very fun game with fun elements. might be outdated for some, but i think it's a great time!
very fun boomer game! very simple though, if you don't like doom you won't like this one.
awesome boomer shooter! i really like this one, plays like the og, not the newfanged doom! really gun!
peak singleplayer looter shooter. excellent story and insane amount of content. one of the best indie games out there.

just awesome. one of my favorite shooters of the past decade. very old school as for it's core shooter mechanics with of twist of rng diablo-esque looting. the leveling tree is also very unique, requiring various mini-game campaigns mirroring actual games. such as mario, galaga, and even pokemon! with as long as this game is, i cannot recommend it enough. if you are a fan of old school shooters with a twist, this is definitely for you. 10/10 would play over and over again.
esta bastante guapo, es divertido y no esperé ciertos giros que hay en el juego

un juego simple con una mecánica innovadora y una historia también simple pero que te **** hubiera gustado que agregaran mas mecánicas o mas cosas en general pero este juego no necesita ser tan grande, de hecho su simpleza es lo que lo hace brillar aparte de que puedes jugar el sh:mcd y el vr, el juego base en si no es que lo jugaría por horas (para eso prefiero severed steel) en realidad lo que me gusta de superhot es su historia mas que el gameplay en si, además de que algunos niveles se me hacian un poco injustos poniendo muchos enemigos que te disparan por todos lados al mismo tiempo y te dejan sin muchas opciones, además de que no puedes mirar a tu alrededor ya que esto supondría que el tiempo avance y por ende mueras, sin embargo es muy satisfactorio cuando completas el nivel y lo ves todo en velocidad normal. un juego con una historia muy original y el shooter mas innovador que he jugado en años.

maneirinho pra passar o tempo. não tive vontade de zerar agora, mas antes de deixar pra depois, tudo que vi até aqui me agradou bastante. a gameplay é o grande uau do jogo. o lance de tudo ficar em câmera lenta e só se mover quando você se move dá um tempero a mais nos desafios, que vão aumentando e te mantendo instigado, às vezes até parecendo injusto. acho massa como o jogo brinca com a ideia de computador e sistema, trazendo uma imersão diferenciada, principalmente nas partes em que ele realmente executa ações no seu pc, tipo avisar que vai fechar e de fato fechar. curti demais, espero finalizar em breve. 0 likes 0open review
so no spoliers only to say is a must play the gameplay is good no fps have ever done this type is short but there is a good storyline
this is the most innovative shooter i've played for years this is the most innovative shooter i've played for years this is the most innovative shooter i've played for years
evet gerçekten yani biraz zor bu yüzden hikaye sığdıralacak bir oyun da değil
o jogo é muito divertido e a mecânica é inovadora, eu achei muito divertido jogar no playstation e espero que possa jogar no vr um dia. recomendo muito.

superhot — это необычный шутер, который выделяется своим уникальным игровым процессом. идея того, что время движется только тогда, когда двигаешься ты, заставляет продумывать каждый шаг и делает игру похожей на своеобразную стратегию в реальном времени. атмосфера минимализма и яркий визуальный стиль тоже играют свою роль: красные враги на фоне белого окружения смотрятся стильно и придают всему происходящему особый шарм.но, несмотря на оригинальность, есть моменты, которые могут надоесть. кампания довольно короткая, а после прохождения основного сюжета остается не так много причин возвращаться. кроме того, сама концепция замедления времени интересна, но в какой-то момент она перестает быть чем-то необычным и превращается в рутину.в итоге superhot — это отличная игра для пары вечеров, но ее идеи не раскрываются в полной мере. если вам интересен необычный взгляд на жанр шутеров, то она стоит внимания, но не ждите слишком глубокого опыта. 7 из 10.
difícil a ratos, mucho contenido y una historia muy bien contada pero difícil de encontrar

i can't believe i wasted my time on this. superhot is a total letdown. the "time moves when you move" mechanic gets old so fast, and the gameplay becomes a repetitive slog. the story is non-existent, the graphics are painfully dull, and there’s nothing here to keep you engaged for more than an hour. this game is overrated, and i can’t understand why anyone would recommend it. if you’re thinking about buying it, save yourself the frustration and look elsewhere. 2/10.

first off, let me just say that this game is a ******* nightmare. the whole concept of time only moving when you do sounds intriguing on paper, but in execution, it's just a headache-inducing mess. trying to strategize and plan your moves while everything is frozen in place is enough to make anyone want to pull their hair out. and don't even get me started on those damn red men. they pop up out of nowhere, relentless in their pursuit to take you down. it felt like no matter what i did, they were always one step ahead, ready to dish out another frustrating defeat. in conclusion, "superhot" is a frustrating, infuriating mess **** that i would not recommend to my worst enemy. save yourself the headache and the rage-inducing moments, and spend your time playing something actually enjoyable. trust me, you'll thank me later.

legends of runeterra is a brilliantly designed online trading card game. most importantly, lor innovates game mechanics with a back-and-forth format that objectively make this game more tactical (but maybe less beginner-friendly) than its peers (like hearthstone). with most actions that a player takes, the opponent has an option to respond, which often results in chains of actions with sometimes incredible comebacks/upsets. the artwork and animations are stellar, and the universe the game takes place in is advantaged by a rich legacy lore due to the producer's other products like league of legends and arcane. the game offers an incredible and near-endless pve experience in addition to pvp: in fact, pvp has sadly taken a back-seat in the last couple years but is by no means dead as matches only take minutes to find. the future is difficult to predict and i hope that pvp will grow more as my heart will always be in pvp gameplay. perhaps the most admirable quality of this game is its refusal to be "pay-to-win" as free cards and resources are given generously and consistently so that any player looking to play competitively can do so free of financial cost if they desire, at least for pvp. and that is something hearthstone cannot boast.

a big problem i had was the card picking. depending on your starting hand, and how you play it, will the computer "choose" the cards you pick up in your deck, i find in most cases. so at that point, it's only strategic for like, the first 25% of the round, and the next 5 - 7 mins is just the computer stalling to make the game longer, regardless of whether you are winning or losing. i felt this isn't an actual card game because you don't get your cards by chance, but the cards you pick up are heavily influenced by the (winning/losing) stance you are in (losing = **** cards each round, winning = stronger cards each round), the probability of getting certain cards is sealed depending on whether you are winning or losing, unlike real card games, the chance of getting any card is always 1 / total number of cards.

i would love the game, but the exclamation marks have no description. so i need to have this page open all the time to search what they do: "**** my game is german, so i even need to find them by picture. very annoying!!! and so easy to fix put the necessary info, a description of the exclamation mark, into the game to stop to annoy your players!!!

it's a brilliant game. top 3 tcg. it has a fun game play, complex meta game, and it is very accessible resource-wise. the only con i can think of for this game is that it is not at all beginner friendly, and learning the game overall or all of its intricacies is very time consuming and i understand why it would push a lot of new players away, but it is very well worth it if you are a card game fan who is looking to spend a lot of time and little to no money on a tcg.

hikayesiyle, oynanışıyla, sanat tasarımıyla, şarkılarıyla, ses tasarımıyla çok güzel tam paket bir oyun. oynanış jrpg tarzına parry ekleyerek çok güzel bir tat katıyor. jrpg kısmının derinliği aşırı değil ama gayet yeterli ve oyun boyunca sizi tutabiliyor. parry sistemi de jrpg'lerin kaçınılmaz olarak düştüğü tekrardan kurtarıyor. normalde jrpg'lerde bir yerden sonra ekrana bile bakmadan oynarsınız. i̇sterse persona olsun ister sea of stars olsun, en iyisi bile bir yerden sonra eksik kalır. ancak bu oyun o sınıra çarpsa da parry sistemi sürekli odaklı kalmanızı sağlıyor. oynanış kısmında tek sıkıntı diyebileceğim kısım level scaling olmaması. yan görevlere falan giderseniz çok güçleniyorsunuz ve ana hikayede her şeye tek atar hale geliyorsunuz. yan içeriklerde gücünüze uygun düşmanlar var ancak ana hikaye seviyenizin çok gerisinde kalıyor. oynayacaksanız önce ana hikayeyi bitirip sonra yan görevlere gitmeyi düşünebilirsiniz. hikayesi çok güzel, hiç spoiler vermeyeyim ilk kez oynarken deneyimleyin. sadece şunu söyleyeyim hikaye olay örgüsü olarak bence süper değil ancak karakterler asıl lezzeti veren şey. sanat tasarımı, ses tasarımı zaten harika. oyuna başladığınız andan itibaren sizde fark edersiniz. çok güzel oyun, oynayın oynattırın. ancak sıra tabanlı hiç çekemem ben diyorsanız tavsiye etmem.

clair obscur: expedition 33 is a stunning masterpiece. its painterly aesthetic feels alive, with animations that flow like brushstrokes in motion. the voice acting is exceptional, giving every moment emotional weight. but the real highlight is the innovative combat system—fluid, strategic, and refreshingly original. a rare blend of beauty and brilliance.
