c'est l'été, c'est la saison des étrons indés ! cependant, il n'y a point de véritable saison en ce qui con-cerne les étrons indés, seulement des périodes éventuelles de recrudescence parce que la saison des étrons indés, c'est toute l'année ! ainsi, ce "don't starve" (ne crève pas de faim...) est un très indigne représentant de l'indignité des étrons indés dans son genre, lui et ses graphismes innommables en 16 couleurs... ou 50 nuances de marron ! marron clair, marron foncé, marron moyen, marron médian, marron plus clair... c'est pour repeindre les chiottes, je suppose ?. ou serait-ce parce que le petit personnage gogolo a la chiasse à force de bouffer de la merde ? d'ailleurs, à propos de bouffer, il faut vraiment crever la dalle pour jouer à un tel sous-produit, bête, très con et très répétitif dans ses mécaniques recyclées de survie à la mords-moi-le-noeud. aussitôt commencé, on veut déjà le quitter parce qu'il nous fait déjà chier. bref, don't play this pile of **** !

hollow knight isn't just a game: it's an emotional experience disguised as entomological torture. it makes you suffer, frustrates you, humiliates you... and yet, when it's over, all you can say is, "should i start another playthrough?" that is its power: converting pain into art.everything in hallownest (its silence, its difficulty, its withered beauty) is designed to make you feel something real. every fall teaches, every victory thrills, and every note reminds you why this metroidvania remains the gold standard of the genre. so yes: thank you, team cherry, for ruining my nerves... but also for healing my soul.

i have just finished hollow knight up to 105%. this game is probably the best game i have played in a long time, it has just enough difficulty to make it fun while still being possible for the average person to play. definitely worth 20 bucks.

this is genuinanly one of the best games i have ever played, if it wasn't for the beginning. you have no idea where to go so you just wander around for several hours. i feel like it would be way better,if you would have something like the wayward compass from the beginning. if there were no youtube tutorials for where to go, i wouldnt have played this game for100%

hollow knight was my first metroidvania, and i absolutely loved it. the animations are incredibly smooth, and the art style is beautiful and iconic. at first it might look like a cozy little game, but you quickly realize it’s not—it’s challenging, but never unfair. the more you play, the more satisfying it becomes, especially during the amazing boss fights. beating them feels great every time. my favorite boss fight was the mantis lords one, which almost feels like a rhythm game because of how perfectly timed everything is. the developers created a deep and fascinating lore, full of mysteries waiting to be uncovered, even though the narrative itself can be a bit unclear at times—it’s not always easy to fully understand what happened in hallownest. the map is huge and packed with secrets, and every single area is memorable. after spending several hours in the game, you start to know your way around instinctively. all the characters are wonderfully designed, each one iconic in their own way. hollow knight is a masterpiece of atmosphere, challenge, and exploration—an unforgettable experience.

this game changed everything. hollow knight was a random exploding success, a genre definer, something every subsequent metroidvania is held up to and compared with. the gameplay loop is sleek and sharp, the map and currency systems solid, the charm builds customisable. exploration is rewarded and there is no right way to play. the sense of wonder and dread as we explore the buried kingdom, the challenge of the bosses and the platforming, the utterly stunning world and character design, and christopher larkin's generational soundtrack, all come together into what i dare call the prime metroidvania. this game has held strong, the lore and horrifically tragic story keeping audiences engaged for more than half a decade, and is a prime example of how love for the craft always beats the love of cash. gaming changed with hollow knight. it wasn't obvious at first, but the release of silksong makes it all the more clear.

one of the best games out there — maybe even the best ****’t be fooled by my low playtime. when the game first came out, my expectations were low, so i played a pirated copy — and i deeply regret it. it’s the kind of game that any fan of the ori series will instantly fall in love with, and even those who aren’t into the genre might get ****’s a game that truly makes you feel your character’s growth and turns item collecting into something genuinely fun. it’s challenging, but hey — isn’t overcoming challenges what makes it fun?

this game is a masterpiece! one of the best metroidvanias ever! it's a must play for every serious gamer

one of the best written games i've encountered in decades that tells you in the first hour, what awaits you. with handdrawn animations and an amazing ost in the same league as undertales.

all i want to say is that this game changed my life, in a good way, it made me feel better when i was down, the music, the storytelling, all, is just beautiful, of course not anyone would enjoy it, but it's really a great game, and finally, thank you omori for what you did for me

let’s cut through the pastel-colored fog: omori is a confused, clunky mess that tries to be everything and ends up being nothing. it’s a frankenstein’s monster of mismatched genres—psychological horror, quirky comedy, slice-of-life drama—all stitched together with the subtlety of a tumblr meme dump. the tonal whiplash is real: one moment you're navigating trauma, the next you're watching a talking toaster crack jokes. it’s not clever—it’s **** controls are stiff and outdated, a relic of rpg maker’s limitations. movement feels sluggish, menus are unintuitive, and the interface design is more aesthetic than functional. it’s like the developers prioritized mood boards over playability.combat? a snoozefest. the emotion system is a neat idea on paper, but in practice it’s shallow and repetitive. battles drag on with little strategic depth, and the pacing is glacial. you’ll spend more time mashing attack than actually thinking. compared to other indie rpgs with tactical nuance, omori feels like a **** characters are painfully flat. sunny, basil, aubrey—none of them evolve meaningfully beyond their archetypes. they exist to serve the plot’s emotional beats, not to feel like real people. dialogue is often stilted, and the attempts at humor land with the grace of a brick. it’s the kind of writing that might resonate with someone deep in a tumblr echo chamber, but outside of that bubble, it’s hard to take **** let’s talk about the reviews. the praise surrounding omori is almost cult-like, centered almost exclusively on its “sad story.” but that’s the bait. the game leans heavily on trauma and tragedy to mask its mechanical shortcomings. it’s emotional manipulation dressed up as profundity. critics and fans alike seem so enamored with the ending’s gut punch that they ignore the slog it takes to get there.
this game is a masterpiece. it moved me like only a few games ever could. it's such a clever way of utilizing technology to tell a beautiful story.

before your eyes is a pretty good game, with a simple but powerful story. however, for me, before your eyes was just a tad anti-climactic for me, and that's the main reason i gave before your eyes a 7/10.

i played this game on my phone on a flight from greece to ny. i just wanted to pass time as it’s a lengthy flight (10 hours)— there had never been a game that has hit as hard as this one. it’s probably the shortest story game i have played but is the most beautiful story i have ever seen in gaming (and by far the most sad) everyone should play this game fr(free on netflix gaming on your phone) -when i played the game i really appreciated the artwork and choices you make. the plot twist near the end of the game hits so hard and it’s so tragic-don’t wanna spoil the last scene of the game is one of the most gut wrenching and beautiful moments i’ve ever encountered in a video game this is perf storytelling

joguei no android. a questão de piscar é muito interessante mas me fez passar rapido por cenas que eu queria vivenciar mais, e isso tirou um pouco do meu envolvimento com a historia.a narrativa e a historia sao muito bem feitas e emocioantes, personagens cativantes e dublagem muito boa. tempo bom para um jogo de celular.

i never expected before your eyes to be so immersive and profound. the game is truly surprising, the blinking mechanic is very well used, and the story is so emotional, so deep. in short, the game is truly incredible!!!
unfathomably introspective and emotional singlehandedly the most beautiful experience i have had in a video game. brings out the feelings and emotions similar to music.

petit jeu mais un chef-d'œuvre qui mérite le détour. fait ressentir beaucoup d'émotions et système qui aide à se plonger dans l'histoire. très bonnes musiques et style graphique assumé qui va très bien dans l'esprit du jeu. à faire une fois !

before you eyes is a beautiful game and i love the concept of it which is so different from anything we have. only reason i gave a 7 is because even though the story is cute and breaks hearts, i didn't feel attached to the characters.

a unique experience.a unique experience. i really like this game. it really makes you feel the game the story and the experience. the use of closing and opening your eyes is very interesting and it’s the first time for me, and it looks like they’re really using this mechanic throughout the story to help. you understand the story and to get more connected to the characters into the plot. the 3-d graphics is nice and will add to the atmosphere. also, the elements of storytelling and art throughout the story is very nice. the music. the music also adding to the game into its uniqueness. i would totally recommend this game to anyone. i played this on an ipad using my netflix account.
the blinking mechanics did not work for me, probably because of weird camera positioning, so that ruined that. as for the story, i would call it good, not great

un titolo da non perdere per gli amanti degli fps ad alta velocità, movimento e sparatorie si sposano come non mai in neon white, persino le sezioni dating sim diventano qualcosa di interessante visto che ogni 2/3 regali c'è un livello bonus, con leaderboard e corse contro il tempo simili a seum questo titolo diventa una fabbrica di endorfina, non per niente le musiche di machine girl sono la scelta perfetta per questo stile di gioco

what a surprise this game has been for me. this is the first speedrunning game i've ever played, and it was a great experience. i enjoy fast-paced fps games like doom, and now i can say i enjoy games like neon white, even though it's not a **** is a puzzle game—a puzzle game with story and shooting elements injected—and it works like a charm. i typically don't like the japanese aesthetic in games, but this one didn't bother me in that sense. the characters, though, are simply put: "lame." they have weird reactions, and their personalities are too simple. the story is also super **** could have been better if they had included more boss fights. but this is definitely worth trying because, from the start, you'll know that you are playing something original.

it's amazing gameplay-wise but one thing made me so mad i can't go higher than 7. the fact that menuing is so slow, you can't quickly reset, you can't skip dialogues, cutscenes, that giving out presents takes ages is mind boggling. the characters and story are very cringe and you really don't want to listen to anything they have to say, but it seems the creators were so proud of this cringefest they force players to bear through it. there's a lot style over substance here, which i could let slide if the substance was noteworthy, but unfortunately it's nauseating.

neon white, hızlı aksiyon ve parkur mekaniğini birleştiren bir shooter oyunu. yüksek temposuyla başta gerçekten içine çekiyor, özellikle ilk birkaç saat çok keyif veriyor. ancak bir süre sonra hep aynı şeyleri yapma hissi oyundan soğutuyor. ayrıca hikâyesi de oyuncuyu içine çekmekte pek başarılı değil.

+ high fast-paced gameplay every level is a speedrunning puzzle. level design is wel done & really leans into it. + forces you to strive for excellence if your like me you'll play most stages multiple times to improve your run and shave of seconds of your time. title music f●●●ing slaps – characters are cringy (on purpose?) expect anime tropes, edge-lord banter and some painful dialogue. sometimes it works most of the time it's cringy. ~ story is serviceable it's better than the cringy characters and dialouge. and it's not a super long game and the story moves allong.
incredibly mechanically fun with a story which, while is no revolutionary tale, does grow on you throughout the game

absolutely one of my favorite games ever. i love the character dynamics and i love the aspect of the devs making it more of a speed game by adding dev times that you can get and the speedrun community is super nice and you can turn a 20 hour game into a 100+ game.
entretenido, adictivo, muy buena música, gran gameplay. recomiendo mucho este juego de unas 11-13h. le faltaría una buena trama pero mucho no se le puede pedir a un juego con esta temática.

very good game, love the movement and the addicting aim of the game of to be good at every single one. before, i aimed for top 10k for each, now aiming for top 5k. story's a little eh, but still enjoyable at parts.

great game, the gameplay is completely solid and the art does its job. music by machine girl is great, and the story is so so at best and cringeworthy at worst, but at the end of the day, game is fun, interesting, rewarding and unique. easy recommendation.
insanely addictive. flawless gameplay mechanics, original core and phenomenal music. it has some nice replayability.

by far one of the most cringe games i have ever tried. the game is basically an obby with some ability elements like roguelikes which made it a bit more unique, however, its not like there arent other games that do this already. you can find games that also do this on **** for example. and though everything is opinionated, i hated almost everything about this game. the music was horrible, limited, and very repetitive. the cutscenes, scene building, story writing, and animations were all very bad and cringe. the levels are all extremely short and small to really feel anything, literally 20secs each, at this point the game is more of a loading screen and horrible constant cut scenes. the voice acting was also really bad other than the protagonist. every other character had horrible voice actors, those you commonly see in dub anime. i also hate the western furry aesthetics used in all the designs. so much more for me to rant on such a tiny game but i'll stop here cause no1 is even gonna read this but me t=t
there's no such thing as a neon white you **** how do people like this ml

most underrated game ı ever played. story is boring, side character are bad, mechanics are a disagrece. map desing is awful and making a single mistake means you have to play the level all over again. i can't believe some people are calling this the "best indie game" its just normal game with garbage content.
absolutely perfect no glaze but this was perfection at its finest story is on par with rdr2 , its criminally under rated , just trust me bro play it .

hard choices.... i love it. this game is a soulbreaker stuff. the graphics is awesome, the story is aaaaaaaaa loved it, the characters were unforgottable... and this interactive adventure gameplay is one of my favourite ones. i'm empty.....

life is strange is a game about what happens when you give supernatural powers to a teenager who still has a childish mindset and who must face all the difficulties of life. this game is almost perfect, the plot is incredibly engaging, i was constantly walking around and talking to people, so it's really interesting. i didn't notice much of a difference in the remastered version, so i downgraded it due to the huge overpayment. overall, both the original and the remastered version are the best games in their genre. i recommend it to everyone, and it's best to buy the remastered version when it's on sale :)

cosa sei disposto/a a fare per salvare qualcuno? lis è stato amore a prima vista. giocato in età adulta, si comprendono meglio tante cose. da amante delle avventure grafiche, non potevo farmelo sfuggire e, devo dire, sono rimasta rapita da questo gioco. non il migliore tecnicamente e con qualche errore di sceneggiatura ma la storia è incalzante, i **** son tutti ben scritti e il mistero si mixa perfettamente col resto. hai subito voglia di capire cosa succederà e come andrà a finire. le musiche poi sono bellissime e, oramai, iconiche, i colori e gli effetti pittorici davvero ispirati ed enigmi carini e divertenti. amerete chloe e max. in ultimo, un plauso ai ragazzi di dontnod per le scelte richieste nel gioco. alcune anche molto difficili ma tanto apprezzate. un ottimo gioco, davvero. da giocare per arricchirsi un bel po'.
beautiful story… and i love how every choice impacts how things proceed in the game, truly a masterpiece with great music.
a must-play if you are interested in the theme of time travel and a journey focused on narrative and choices that affect your gameplay, great game

it truly changed my life. i don't even know why i gave it a try, i was only playing multiplayer games at the time and had just downloaded it because i got it for free. but it turned out to be one of, if not my favorite game. its only downside is that sometimes you could theoretically use your power but the game doesn't let you do that, just for the sake of not solving everything with your powers and for the story to be able to happen. everything else is perfect: the lovable and hateable characters, the intriguing story, surprising plot twists, amazing soundtrack, and awesome art style. this game won't leave you indifferent for better or worse.

genialna historia, przy wyborach nieraz siedzialam i zastanawialam sie dobra chwile jaka podjac decyzje, co mi sie generalnie nie zdarza. ciekawe postacie, ktore wzbudzaja emocje, a nie sa tylko nudnymi npc. chloe <3333
_good game _
changed my life, i'll never make big choices again without thinking about this game.

life is strange es un título que siempre había querido jugar, pero que terminó siendo una experiencia completamente olvidable. debo reconocer que la historia está muy bien construida en la mayor parte del juego… hasta llegar a los finales. y, por dios, ¿qué son esos finales en comparación con todo lo anterior? se sienten apresurados, dejan demasiados cabos sueltos y dan la impresión de que lo único importante es lo que ocurre entre las dos protagonistas, mientras que el resto de los personajes simplemente no importan.esto me lleva a otro punto: hay demasiadas interacciones con secundarios que, al final, no tienen peso en la trama. en cada capítulo apenas reaparecen con una interacción mínima, y honestamente, para eso mejor no haberlos incluido y evitar hacernos perder tiempo en diálogos que no aportan nada.a lo anterior se suma la música, que deja bastante que desear, y los escenarios, que resultan decepcionantes. juegos de principios de los 2000 parecen haber puesto más cariño en sus paisajes y fondos que lo que aquí se muestra.
bad acting, cheap story, terrible graphic and very boring. typical game for manga-kidz who came only for cartoon/anime graphic, nothing else.

another narrative game or with a lot of dialogue / cinematic but whose available dubbing is only english. the other communities such as the french, germans, russians, etc... are neglected. my money will be better at other studios.

me encantó la historia principal, el poder ver las emociones de las personas es increíble pero ciertas escenas y/o finales no cumplen por completo mis expectativas, pudo haber sido más detallado. algunos personajes no captaban mi atención pero la ciudad, los minijuegos, el arte del juego en general y entre otras cosas lo hace destacable. recomiendo darle una oportunidad.

the game was generally fine, with the first four chapters playing well. unfortunately, the fifth chapter showed surprising laziness from the developers. overall, though, it was an enjoyable experience.
great game. the story is decent. the scoring is great, visual is really amazing, the voice & sound is also amazing

amazing storytelling game. please produce more games like this!! i only wish there was an options setting to make the interactive objects less noticable (i.e. make those white borders disappear) so that the world looks more natural and discovering those items would be more rewarding.
as someone who has played and liked all of the life is strange series, i really liked this game, and it is one of the best games for me in the series.

dieser teil zerreißt einen emotional leider nicht so extrem bzw. überhaupt als in life is strange und life is strange before the storm. auch die "holy ****" momente, die es zumindest noch in life is strange 2 gab, gibt es nicht mehr. man hat leider auch das gefühl, dass jede entscheidung recht egal ist, da es in normalen dialogen kaum was ausmacht und die eine "große entscheidung" der episode ist jetzt auch nichts weltbewegendes, die story geht trotzdem ihren weg, man kann dadurch nichts verhindern. wenn man sich die entscheidungen, wie üblich am ende einer jeden episode durchließt, merkt man das. man hat lediglich die wahl einer person was zu erzählen oder nicht. das juckt die story aber nicht die bohne, bis auf an einer stelle, die aber auch total optional ist, danach setz die feste, unabänderbare story wieder ein. es ist kein klassisches lis, wie wir es gewohnt sind. die schockierenden momente, in denen man sich denkt, oh nein, das darf doch nicht wahr sein gibt es nicht, man wird emotional nur sehr gering mitgenommen und die zwei stellen mit einer, ich sag mal offenbarung von der story des spiels her, kann man sich sogar denken. hier wurde sich darauf fokussiert mehr gameplay einzubauen, anstatt eine extreme story zu schreiben. die story ist trotzdem schön und da ich das spiel ein wochenende lang genießen konnte, vor allem durch die klassische life is strange musik, die immer sehr gut zur atmosphäre gepasst hat, kann ich dem spiel einfach keinen daumen runter geben und freuen mich schon auf das steph-dlc, in die ich mich auch wieder direkt verliebt habe.
personally i liked true colors more than the second game while the original game stay my favourite. good story overall combinened with legit gameplay and graphics.

boring and slow, old games was soooo better !
an innocuous and empty story that appeals to the cheap sentimentality that can be found in any short motivational video on the internet, at least acceptable.
the game was pretty average and boring most of the time. the music was good and the ending was very well acted but other than that it had little to no gameplay.

персонажи мёртвые, безликие. им совсем не сопереживаешь. графика дерьмовая. игра полностью нагружает мою видеокарту. в самом начале была нереально тупая катсцена, в которой нужно было 5 минут пялиться на то, как по 100 раз показывают одну и ту же сцену.

pretty boring game where super power is empathy... like lack of empathy is unhuman. strange :) it is difficult to stay alert and keep playing after flood of boring dialogs. at times it feels like simulator or experiment. there a re plenty of great games out there. you may skip this one.

played 40 minutes. hated the whole thing. sluggish pace. binary decision-making. dull characters. if you didn't grab my attention after 40 minutes, what are you doing? dull. dull. dull. on the plus side, it's pretty. also, why can't i select a screen resolution in fullscreen? i had to switch between the dx11 and dx12 versions to escape 720p hell. asked for a refund.

everybody hates life is strange 2 and i dont know why, unlike this game, it has a great story, great plot that is not a copy of life is strange 1 and it´s actually interesting, i cant believe that the critic thinks true colors is a better game than life is strange 2, this game has boring characters, boring story and superficial decisions, nothing matters at all, they did dirty to life is strange 2 and a lot of people who say is trash never touched the game. this game gets a point because you can change alex´s outfit.

a step up in quality in most aspects - except for where it really matters. it looks a lot more polished, but the tame story and alex's "power" really doesn't make for a immersive experience. the story is very weak and short compared to the first game. i tried really hard to give this game a chance, but ultimately—it did not deliver.

this game failed to deliver similar lis game experience previous games did bring me. the story looks rushed, some places i even think it was deliberately rushed. in the other lis games you usually are given with options and choices that will affect your future, or the world around. even though there are choices to make in this game, they don't seem too different one from another. it's like picking between two apples - one is green and the other is red: at the end of the day, it's still an apple you choose. so when you've finished the game and you're looking at the charts of other players' decisions you kinda think to yourself: so that is all there was? i almost never felt it for the characters, even during their hardest times. i suppose i didn't have enough time and opportunity to get to know them better. then, when playing particular parts of the game, it suddenly feels like the character is a naive 12 y.o. girl. but seriously, when making some decision, alex is being way too naive and for some reason over-simplifies some important events and decisions. the superpower itself is very interesting and is worth exploring, but we don't particularly see any development on this throughout the whole game.

this game isn't a sequel to life is strange 1. it's a perfectly told new story. those who aren't open to that will struggle. if you're open to it, the story is emotional, heartbreaking, and captivating. a very successful second part.

(i have already written a review. this is a rate for its pc version.) my previous review; fortitude, understanding, patience. slow-paced, yet incredibly touching. all over the place, to oregon, then nevada, to arizona. constantly changing characters, as it is a story of running away in a hurry, yet still succeeds in helping building meaningful connections with the game, maybe with its atmosphere. it is not a game to be finished at one sitting, maybe this is its drawback, it is designed to be understood in scrutiny.
masterpiece!!! i just love this game. amazing story. great characters. absolutely perfect soundtrack.

es mi juego favorito de life is strange, mis decisiones sí afectaron al transcurso de la aventura de los 2 hermanos y sin duda la elección más difícil al final y la intriga de qué pasará cierra con un broche de oro la historia. disfruté cada episodio de este juego, unos más que otros. mi única queja es que es complicado elegir qué debe decir sean, no quedan claras las opciones de diálogo.

it's actually unfair for me to compare the mechanics and story of this game with the first one and conclude that "it was better in the first game" for reasons like "it's not the protagonist who has the powers" or "they don't stay still in a same place, they are always changing" because this is how the game goes. it was meant to be different from the first one, and the plot of "you are not who has the powers this time, it's your litte brother, who you have to educate through the whole game" it's actually really interesting for me. this game deserves an open-minded experience.

ithink its the best lis.a new world a new rise the brothers relation is special and **** fav episode has to be 3 it gave a great vibe.

juegazo, la única razón por la cual es odiado es por no ser una continuación directa del primer juego. como juego independiente funciona mil veces mejor que el primero mejor historia, personajes, voces, narrativa, incluso música. en todo es mejor, deberían darle una oportunidad.

bir çok insan pek sevmiyor olsa da bana göre serinin en iyi oyunudur. hissettirdiği duygular ve yaşattıkları, deneyim ettirdikleri ve iyi-kötü tüm hisleriyle bana göre kendi kategorisindeki top-3 oyundan birisi. kesinlikle bir heavy rain veya detroit değil. ki bir yerde iddiaları da farklı oyunlar. seçimlerin oyunun geneline katkısı tartışmalı bir durum. fakat oyunu oynarken yaşattıkları o kadar geniş bir perspektif üzerinden puan vermeme kesinlikle bir engel.
el mejor de la saga, inentendible como fue tan mal recibido. una vez que lo completas te das cuenta de lo superior que es a sus antecesores.
muy lineal, horrible en general

nice graphics, great music again. but the story... i will short: if you love the star wars, and you want to play as a kid padawan who use his power on everything and on everyone you will totally love this game! :d boring and star wars force **** shame...

this is essentially a far left propaganda piece, the story only exists to bash the other side of the political isle by creating fantasy stories that are in no way realistic and trying to say people on the right are bad and people on the left good. you honestly either have to be a far left sjw to like this game or you are afraid to dislike as a critic because you would lose your job. *in short it is sjw propaganda and not even well made.
эта игра буквально во всем хуже оригинальной lis. ну разве что графон подтянули, но первую часть люди полюбили явно не за графику, так что смысла от такого апгрейда на фоне всего остального ноль.

terrible game. very anti american and anti white. blatant racism against white people and traditional western american values. the amount of woke propaganda in the game is overbearing. would not recommend. put your money elsewhere because the developers of this game hate you.

well... it's bad, like weak story, weak characters, weak gameplay bad. first of all, i did play only 1 third of the game but believe me when i say that every time, i see my play time on this game i wonder if steam crashed and forgot to count 50 more hours. first story and characters, i won't spoil anything but let's just say that you will need to strap your suspension of disbelief to a f-ing falcon 9 rocket for them to make sense. i know they’re young but when i was as young as them, i would also call most of their choices stupid, unconscious, and well... very stupid, and i i'm not that far from their age anyway. which is even more infuriating with the game severe lack of nuance and subtility the game will always force you to choose between 2 extreme of the same solution something like "explode in rage" and "be extremely ungrateful and disrespectful" which will for all intent and purposes will have the same result. and when you couple that with the fact that the game make act the characters stupidly and think you're too drunk to notice it becomes just borderline insulting. the gameplay is weak, but in another game like this i wouldn't even mention it because it should be carried by its writing... i don't know what happened to the smartly written characters and charm of arcadia bay, if you wanted to get this one, just continue walking...

this is a very nasty game. there is no spirit of the past parts in it. very boring main characters, minor characters, and even more interesting than the main characters. it is very common to see the same house assets in different episodes. there is a lot of political overtones, hatred for believers, hatred for white people, hatred for everything. this is not life is strange. it's very funny to see how dontnod talks about injustice towards different people, but at the same time, they themselves deceived and ignored the protests of the voice actors of life is strange 2015. many young children liked the game and they put 10, just because it is called the same as and the last part and for a bright picture. don't be fooled. little music, even less good music. elections practically do not affect anything. the game has no decent morality. you may like the first and second episodes, but the next episodes are made very poorly, apparently the developers themselves were bored with creating the game. if you are white, a believer, be prepared for the game to hate and despise you.

review_text: a big step back in almost every aspect from the original game. for the most part i am angry at those writers, who are due to their stupidity does not now what a harsh season winter is for human beings. my face is still bleeding from all the facepalms i had to endure while playing the game. characters. i f****** hated most of them. instead of being hardcore survivalists, they behave like stupid selfish american teenagers. for real, the stupidest thing is - the escape plan. what kind of an idiot proposes to flee from their prison without considering to gather at least some medicine and food? and trying to get past those walkers, when there is a f****** working vehicle right next to the whole group. wtf? there is so much stupidity in the whole story, i could go on for hours... but i am trying to forget, like it was a bad dream.

review_text: the wolf among us really pulled me in from the start. i loved the gritty atmosphere and the way it mixed fairy tale characters with a dark, detective story. playing as bigby wolf felt intense—every choice i made actually mattered and had real consequences. the art style was amazing, and the voice acting brought everything to life. honestly, it’s one of those games that stays with you. if you like strong stories, you should definitely try it.
genres: Graphic Adventure, Adventure, Interactive Film, Action

review_text: while closer to a tv show or similar experience than an actual "video game," the wolf among us has a rich and enthralling story with fantastic characters throughout. enjoyable throughout its entire runtime, and leaves the player always wanting to find out more. can't wait for the sequel.
genres: Graphic Adventure, Adventure, Interactive Film, Action

review_text: best telltale games after twdg. what a masterpiece and can't wait for the sequel. bigby is such an amazing character and his development is good and can be great if they do it right in the sequel. the plot twists in this game are so great and unexpected too

review_text: god, i love this game. as tired as the concept may be for some, the idea of taking fairytale/fantasy characters and putting them into modern cities and realistic situations has always been something i dug, and it was done wonderfully here. the setting is vivid and easy to immerse yourself in, the characters are varied, likeable, and charming, the mystery is suspenseful and gripping, the choices and consequences are satisfying, and the soundtrack is brilliant. the ending has one of the cliffhangers that have haunted me most through my time in gaming, and i am both excited for and terrified of the sequel. hopefully it lives up to the first game's quality and ties up the loose ends it needs to. (sidenote i include with all telltale reviews: telltale's games often get a bad rap for having your choices not influence the story, but to me this misses the point of what they do. variant endings are a nice bonus in games, and i enjoy them when they do pop up in telltale's stories, but for the most part your choices aren't here to change where you go. they're there to change how you get there, who you are when you get there, and often who you get there with. they influence and change your relationships with the characters around you. the joy of replaying these games is to experience the different dialogue, the different reactions to you, the different routes you can take on the way, the different bonds you can evolve with people - not to have a wildly different ending. i think this aspect is overhated and sadly misunderstood by a lot of players, so if huge, game-changing differences are what you're looking for, i'd temper your expectations.)
genres: Graphic Adventure, Adventure, Interactive Film, Action

review_text: beautifully written, beautifully presented. and for telltale the most dynamic in experience, and if anything its not about branching paths with these games its about how you yourself engage with everything that will depend on what you get. and for me, the inability to not change some things is actually in the games favor, because i would much rather have crucial points, and a focus be uncompromising. the empathetic thoughtful and even emotion and intense writing have kept this game as the only rival to the walking dead. i just oddly wish the aggroget was higher then 80 but equally as so i see it as just, well its a perception on what is actually important in a game. for the type of game this is, its about the experience of seeing the world, seeing the position of bigby and what happens to him, some things that you believe is more important, which again will not change everything but more or less, will change how you view everything in each subsequent play through. your aggression and your softness, your approach to each character, it often change me, and made me feel a roller coaster depending on what i said, when i didn't keep track of what i said and whether or not this guy was gonna say the same thing anyways, i was feel the very grounded, tight and honestly intricate story that pulls no punches and containing bold plot twists. immersive, and emotional to its absolute core, i just wish it was longer. not so short, only going 10 hours but it has no filler, just opting for you as a player to just feel everything and take your time, and feel the vibe. brilliant game. side by side for the walking dead honestly.
genres: Graphic Adventure, Adventure, Interactive Film, Action

while solo play has been pretty solid multiplayer is significantly buggy in comparison. every time i have tried to play multiplayer its been a game to see how many bugs we can rack up. its to a point where you ask if the dev has even played their own game in multiplayer because its so easy to find a bug in 10 minutes. solo is good just don't expect much from multiplayer because it will involve a lot of failed invites and the game breaking causing you to quit your run and then attempt to get a working invite.

i gave this game an 8, but that's an advance. i really liked the game for its atmosphere, music, and of course the story itself. lovecraft would have definitely liked this game: a short story about otherworldly horror. maybe cosmic, maybe afterlife. just the way he liked it. but for me personally, this game was on the verge of a 7 because walking around this island was very tiring, and because the dialogues required you to react quickly. i hate timed quests, timed traps, and timed dialogues, so for me it spoiled the feeling of the game a little. and the tedious walking could have been easily fixed with at least small fast-travel, like 4 benches in different corners of the island. and that's it. because of this, i didn't really like running and looking for red frequencies first, and then running around the island again looking for these damn notes... and also hunting for different endings. overall, it's an 8, but on a very-very fine line with a 7.
an excellent little game with a very interesting story. definitely would recommend.

i was playing the games that epic gave us for free and i knew a lot of people like this game so i took a shot and that was a good shot. storytelling is so good and it's actually like "inception" it blows your mind and while playing the game you don't have to do so many things just look at the map and listen radio while walking. besides our story(because i don't want to give whoever reads(btw i am glad you're reading this) any clue about the story) game has a good radio mechanic which is our literally only playable mechanic other than choosing our words which is at the very beginning i did not realize we can be quiet or we can choose to not talking. in the end, the game is all about the story and i literally started to play it and then finished it(yeah sometimes took a bathroom break as normal). you definitely should play it too and guys please make a good ending for us. see ya!!

oh, to be a teenager sneaking into a secluded island to party. if only that island wasn't haunted... i first played this game 6 years ago — i now reached an ending i hadn't found. oxenfree is a uniquely dynamic enigmatic narrative game that is as complex as the player's willingness to engage. it introduces characters begging to be understood despite their confounded pasts. the game challenges players to look beyond the surface, reminding us that all carry a history that shapes their present. oxenfree prompts players to reflect on the control we have over our lives. it's a journey through acceptance, illustrating that acknowledging the past allows for moving forward. i love how deeply one can dig for lore in this game, even extending to an arg. playing today, i was able to reach an ending i was satisfied with as i could find the confidence in myself to be proud of the choices i made, embracing the consequences: a reflection of my growth.
прошёл дважды, отличный ost, игруля ненапряжная прям каеф. и за сюжетом следить интересно, и за персонажами. и крипате очень удивился, визульный стиль игры ни капли не намекает. жду вторую часть

oxenfree is a supernatural mystery/horror graphic adventure game developed and published by night school studio. in oxenfree, players assume the role of the teenage girl alex on a weekend trip to a local island. after seemingly supernatural events occur, alex and her friends must unravel the secrets of the island.

ok so i was lucky to have been able to download the pc version of oxenfree for free on an offer from epic games this year. i finished the game in two days, and i enjoyed this a whole lot. the storyline was good and emotional. i like how they put everything in place and i honestly loved how the characters got flashbacks from happy moments in the past. the background music was good and it created the typical atmosphere which fitted in the game. i really liked the genre of the game, it was spooky but at the same time pretty emotional, and the best part was that everything was unexpected. not once could i guess what would happen next, and that's what made this game more exciting. the characters were greatly designed as well and the graphics of the game was just amazing. here and there there were a few glitches or the game froze, but that's usually normal. for people who are suffering from loss like i have, i would definitely recommend this to you. it actually helps you deal with the pain. i would rate this game 98/100. there were some things which were hard to figure out and there could've been some guides through the game to make it easier. the map could've also tracked the characters at the exact spot in the location so that you know where you are going and if you are taking the right paths. other than that, i am satisfied with the gameplay experience! :)

little misfortune è un gioco dalla trama accattivante che tratta temi importanti, ad esempio la depressione e di come questa venga affogata nel "succo magico", si parla del padre violento della protagonista, di speranze, delusioni, insomma un arco emotivo molto ampio e ben costruito ed il tutto accompagnato da un black humor che sarebbe molto divertente se non fosse che nel gioco mancano la lingua ed il doppiaggio italiano. reputo ciò il punto debole del gioco perché non permette al videogiocatore di immergersi al 100% all'interno di quella che potrebbe essere una bella esperienza videoludica e dunque gran parte dell'esperienza di gioco non viene valorizzata. il mio voto cambierà nel caso in cui la lingua ed il doppiaggio italiano verranno aggiunti

balatro: почему эта игра — полный провалпервое впечатлениес первого взгляда balatro кажется многообещающей карточной игрой. однако за привлекательным фасадом скрывается настоящая катастрофа для любого игрока, который ищет качественный игровой опыт.геймплей, от которого хочется плакатьмеханика игры построена на крайне примитивных принципах. комбинации карт настолько предсказуемы, что уже через пару часов игра превращается в унылое повторение одних и тех же действий. никакого разнообразия или инноваций — просто бесконечное перетасовывание одних и тех же карт.графика и звуквизуальная составляющая оставляет желать лучшего. скудные, однообразные визуальные эффекты и унылая цветовая палитра создают атмосферу, в которой невозможно долго находиться. звуковое сопровождение не лучше — набор примитивных звуков, которые быстро начинают раздражать.проблемы с балансомсложность игры распределена крайне неравномерно. первые уровни настолько просты, что вызывают зевоту, а последующие — настолько сложны, что кажутся практически непроходимыми без использования специфических комбинаций. это создаёт ощущение искусственности и несправедливости.отсутствие глубиныпрокачка и развитие в balatro реализованы на уровне казуальной мобильной игры. никаких глубоких стратегий или продуманных механик развития персонажа. всё сводится к банальному накоплению очков и открытию новых карт, которые мало что меняют в игровом процессе.итогbalatro — это яркий пример того, как не нужно делать карточные игры. отсутствие инноваций, примитивный геймплей, скучные визуальные эффекты и несбалансированная сложность делают эту игру настоящим разочарованием. лучше потратить своё время на что-то действительно стоящее.если вы цените качественный игровой опыт — обходите balatro стороной. это игра, которая не заслуживает ни вашего времени, ни ваших денег.

jeu atypique de deck-building, un peu roguelite. les règles sont assez faciles à prendre en main, et la difficulté est bien dosée. gardez en tête que le but du jeu est de vous échapper de cette cabane sombre où votre terrifiant adversaire vous force à jouer avec lui. le gros point fort du jeu, c'est que quand on pense enfin arriver au bout, il y a un nouveau défi à relever. ce jeu a été une très bonne surprise et surprenant d'un bout à l'autre de l'aventure.

i would describe this as a very immersive card game that's quite different from the usual bunch. the game is divided into multiple main chunks, which are all very different from each other, i won't go into details here to not spoil anyone, but when you think you've beaten the game you just really haven't. generally speaking, you'll get surprisingly attached to the characters and really immersed into whatever is going on. the card game itself is also good, once you beat the game you'll get access to ridiculously difficult challenges, whatever you prefer, this game really just has it all. complaints? not that many really, just the amount of back and forth you have to do with it, but that's not really a big issue

inscryption, her yönüyle harika bir deneyim. atmosferi, ses efektleri ve karakterleriyle gerçekten çok etkileyici. hatta kart oyunlarını sevmeyen birine bile bu türü sevdirebilecek bir oyun. kartların konuşması, ilginç karakterler ve boss savaşları, sanki biri bize masaüstü frp oynatıyormuş gibi hissettiriyor.

inscryption is more than a card game — it’s an experience that toys with your expectations at every turn. it lures you in with accessible mechanics, then drags you through layers of unsettling, genre-defying brilliance. for fans of rogue-likes, puzzles, and games that dare to experiment, inscryption is a must-play. geeksace . com

although the art style is a little rudimentary, slay the spire's dynamic gameplay is just so addictive that you will find yourself losing copious amounts of time to run after run after run.
biggest issue is the lack of balance between characters and the rng at time completely ruining runs

i... finished slay the spire? at least, i beat the game once in a run with one of the playable characters. it was only 4 hours long (including my previous attempts), and honestly? despite being such a short experience, i liked it a lot! it was a quality game! the combat system is by far the main player in this game's package. the diversity of cards, the amount of abilities you could stack up, this game's mechanics has so much depth (i don't think i've seen everything the game offers). that is on top of the amazing soundtrack and pretty art direction. very easy 10/10 for me, absolutely flawless experience. i'd definitely blow multiple hours into this game in the future!

un vicio infernal, llevo casi 100 horas y no me canso. siempre estoy echándole partidas. siempre aprendes algo nuevo, todas las partidas son diferentes en cuanto a estrategias y combos con las cartas. estoy deseando ver que son capaces de hacer con the slay spire 2.

a near-perfect blend of strategy and replayability. slay the spire is one of those rare games that hooks you in with a simple concept and keeps you coming back with endless depth. the mix of deck-building, roguelike progression, and turn-based combat is executed with near-flawless precision. every run feels different, and the synergy between cards, relics, and enemies keeps strategy at the heart of every decision. what really sets it apart is how well-balanced and rewarding the gameplay loop is. whether you’re a newcomer experimenting with basic card combos or a seasoned player chasing ascension levels, there's always something new to discover. the four unique characters add even more variety, each offering radically different playstyles that keep the game **** art style is charming and distinct, and while the visuals may not blow you away, they suit the game perfectly. the soundtrack quietly enhances the atmosphere without ever getting in the **** you love strategic thinking, risk-reward decisions, and games that respect your intelligence and time, all in all, slay the spire is an absolute must-play. it’s one of the most satisfying and replayable indie titles of the last decade.

sıra tabanlı kart oyunlarını seviyorsanız bu oyun sizin için biçilmiş kaftan. oyunun bu kadar iyi bir oyun olmasının ana nedenlerinden ilki düşmanların oyuna uygun tasarlanmış olması ikinci olaraktan (oyunu oynadığınızda bu dediğimi daha iyi anlayacaksınız) oyunun size verdiği kartların ustaca hazırlanmış olması.

never have i seen a more fun and unique concept. the deckbuilding is impeccably strategic, the mobs and bosses are enticingly challenging, and the game is also rather luck-dependent, which makes in more thrilling to play.
играй тысячи забегов пока не наролишь имбу, конченая игра для конченых терпил

roguelikes are, in some ways, comparable to shuffling a deck of cards: all the parts are there, they just need to be rearranged to make a random order. you would think, in this way, that a roguelite with the central gimmick of a deck of cards used for almost every action would be a match made in heaven, but slay the spire needed only one swing at it to prove to me that the idea should have stayed nought more than a concept for all of time. it's problem is, simply put, that it isn't an enjoyable system, and adding the two ideas together only makes for double the number of ways that you can be unfairly executed. along with this, i just personally don't like the sense of "you will eventually just have to take damage", because it feels like if i get damaged or not is entirely out of control. commit to dealing damage, or allow me to influence it directly. to sit in the middle just feels like poor design, and forcing that to then rely on rng? that just makes no sense to me.
처음으로 풀 구현된 공식 온라인 게임이라는 점에서 큰 의미가 있다. 유희왕 재밌어!ㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤ

so, this is essentialy best f2p gamei've ever played. i've been around since the launch of master duel, and i've never spent a dime, and yet, i have multiple meta deck, i partecipated in multiple events, and the presentation of the game is just top notch. it's the best ygo simulator we ever had. i just wish they'd update the solo mode more often.

gambling simulator with miserable game play. you genuinely will waste money and time for a game that us unbalanced on purpose and people will defend it to death youtubers will attack you for speaking the truth because they have some loyalty to the developers of this game. no one seems to care that its actually gambling marketed to kids. spend money to gamble and not get what you want! they advertise something but you get something completely different.
the best yugioh game in a **** time great for those that want to try the most recent decks kind of like dueling nexus!

this game is as good as any yugioh game that is focused on multiplayer can get, the gameplay is fast, precise and noob-friendly. it also has nice scenarios/missions that work as a single player experience and lore expansion that are pretty fun and add to the value of the game. the crafting system seems fair enough and its not pay to win, which is already a good thing in today's industry. it also has good graphics and an epic soundtrack that never looks or sounds dull. they also have done a lot of events to shake things up, though maybe they could have had some different modes, like a legacy one for those that are a little tired of the current meta, but that maybe is asking a little too much. but yeah, obviously a must play for those that like the franchise.
bello ma non perfetto, sarebbe da modificare il combat system e il tempo e davvero poco per alcuni mazzi con combo complesse
made me a yu gi oh addict let’s go marincess nation we must prove that we are superior to tearlaments.

it's pretty good. the game's balancing is for sure out of whack but you'll still have fun duels. any complaints i have would be toward yu-gi-oh itself rather than master duel. overall, this game is a great medium for playing yu-gi-oh so i'd recommend it.

pros - unlike other tcgs (duel links etc), master duel is f2p. with minimal daily grind anyone can make one meta deck per month. - smooth yu-gi-oh simulator with great visuals. -this game managed to bring back to yu-gi-oh, players that haven’t touched a single card since 10-15 years ago. also the replay feature is a great learning tool for not top tier players. cons -the game feels empty. there’s only the ranked ladder mode and the occasional event for a few days every month. -it can be very cruel for beginners, especially those that don’t even have knowledge of the tcg. one last note this game has a different card pool (not up-to-date) and different ban list from the tcg. many players find that a huge minus. but i feel that this is more a plus. this way there can be more diversity in the meta (for example mathmecks) and also avoid bad metas (tearlament tier 0 meta)

this is what brought me back into yu-gi-oh!, and convinced me to but my own deck (speedroids) in real life for the first time ever. thinking about getting floo for tournaments and such, and ancient warriors for fun.
total meta nightmare. banlist is terrible. events awful. new content is terrible and the meta is just pay to win

worst rng ever, ban list stupid, regular crash server, i test it on pc, p and switch and all version are ****

pretty bad gameplay.just meta gameplay, always the same builds and you literally wait multiple min until your enemy finished his move after 10 combos in the first draw, summoning 7 cards and all the stuff. if you're looking for a no brain game where you just copy a build from the internet it is the perfect game for you. if you are looking for real yu-gi-oh gameplay where you build your own setup and it works ok and you have still a chance if you don't play a meta build, well then this is the wrong game.

yu-gi-oh in general, but especially master duel, are a masterclass in why the developers of games of this nature need to guard closely against power creep. the majority of duels are won before they begin based on the initial coin flip, because cards are so insanely powerful, special summoning and searching mechanics are incredibly unbiqutious and deck consistency is near perfect. win conditions these days involve going first, and special summoning a field of heavy hitting monsters with various effects that negate anything your opponent plays. the player going second, loses before they even get to play a card. the game makes no concessions for new players, you will be dumped in with very little explanation, no ability to pause the game, and a 300 second timer to understand what your opponent is doing, make your plays and complete your turn. it's not uncommon for your opponent to pull out a 20 card combo on turn 1 to set their field up and you'll be given zero opportunity to digest this information overload. the game is broken, the community is toxic, there are many better alternatives out there, there's absolutely no reason to download this game.

i left this card game because of how broken it was and this application seemed like a good time to return to find that it is more broken than ever, there is not a single turn that you can summon a monster with 10001 indestructible effects and win in one departure. it's not enough to ban cards, this game needs a complete makeover.

yu-gi-oh master duel is an amazing introduction to yugioh, and for returning players it's also fun with it's strange mix of the tcg and ocg banlist. the mates are very cute and/or fun and the fact that you can just have a car as a mate is very funny. the events, while they can be hit-or-miss, are overall pretty fun and unique ways to play the game. overall, a fun yugioh experience that i would recommend.

[h2] briefly [/h2] this is a dynamic horror roguelike with an unusual plot. [table] [tr] [th]+[/th] [th]-[/th] [/tr] [tr] [td]visual[/td] [td]long transitions[/td] [/tr] [tr] [td]storyline[/td] [td]-[/td] [/tr] [tr] [td]gameplay dynamics[/td] [td]-[/td] [/tr] [/table] total 8/10 [h2] full review [/h2] this is a very unusual game that combines the horror and roguelike genres. every item in the game has hidden properties that you discover by eating it. all items can be eaten, including ordinary consumables and weapons. many notes are scattered around the locations, some of which reveal the properties of items or plot details. the lobby is also highly interactive. you can find items in it that will help you navigate the locations. fans of both genres will enjoy this game. i recommend checking it out!

this game gave me so much fun with my friends. absolutely terrifying at times and the procedurally generated dungeons can result in extremely difficult and strategic runs. i have had my heart legitimately drop in some scenarios in this game, especially when every monster on the map rushes you as you attempt to escape. my only gripe: co-op was removed for a while, and i heard it was added back but it was truly a bummer having to drop this game.

i beat the game on epic games and i can say the game is still amazing. i only got it on steam seeing the multiplayer is now available but it is very buggy when trying to get in a coop game. but when you're in one it is recommended that both players are familiar with the game before playing as trying to revive your teammate leaves you very vulnerable while making you walk as slow as a ant.
a unique fps with a deceptively deep story. surrealism body horror blending cronenberg and lynch. grotesque hellscapes and janky sounds. highly recommended

honestly, not a fan of this game, i got it as part of a bundle and i don't even thing it was worth the short amount of time i put into it. the controls are mid, the gameplay loop is boring. i don't have much positive to say except it looks cool. 3/10

you get over the weirdness in five minutes. every level is exactly the same. spawn in, wander tiny cramped dark halls looking for randomly spawned keys, leave. each level starts with an unskippable "stand there doing nothing" section. each level contains unavoidable traps and gas, randomly spawned around you in such density as to be unavoidable, all serving just to pluck away at your health and money while you wander the pitch blackness looking for keys. each enemy respawns infinitely and acts the same, walking up to you and hitting you. fighting them is pointless and there are hardly any weapons, all of which break in two swings. guns too, despite being weaker to the point of uselessness and also requiring randomly spawned bullets to be found to even use them. once you get past how hard this game is trying to be weird you find it's gameplay loop is tedious, terrible, and lasts the entire game.
too weird, too hard, and you get cucked at the end

the gameplay loop would be good except it will bug out and wipe all progress when playing in coop. coop is fun until you desync every 10 minutes and then one player can't interact with anything. the ridiculous items, weapons, and tone are fun, but i can't recommend the game at this state.
fun game, extremely broken co-op tho

a really nice rogue lite/ deck builder which will require you to master its mechanics to overcome its 3 campaigns. the speed options are welcome regarding the number of retries necessary. the story is quite flat but the choice mechanics makes it a nice slice of life somehow and attenuates the repetitivity of the whole. for a 1€ sale on steam, a little banger given you like the genre
very fun game. not as challenging as slay the spire but still will scratch the itch.

it's a great deck builder that introduces a completely different mechanic to the traditional combat. diplomacy might sound like it's just combat, but with a different name, but it is not so. combat works as you'd expect from other games in the genre. diplomacy, however, functions fundamentally different and has potentially multiple arguments you need to deal with, while also potentially dealing with or ignoring the "side objectives". it's a refreshing mode and you often get to choose between combat or diplomacy. this also features more choices than usual for this genre. usually these choices end up making someone love or hate you, which can provide different benefits.

deck building gem visual (8/10) i like general sci fy design and drawing characters, but card design a bit average, for example in battle deck you can find a lot of card with same dagger, also after upgrading cards they will have same picture and same design, so you need to double check description, for card game is a minus. also music is average and almost don't change in different locations. interface is very important in card games. so my first impression was - emm another one messy over headed interface, but after some games i can say that it's very helpful, you just need to get used yo it. gameplay (8/10) gameplay is very addictive because you constantly upgrade your perks, cards, get new one and you can check different playstyles through one party. great idea to have more playable characters with different styles and story missions. on the other hand not so many perks are really unique and main strategy is pretty straightforward. story (7/10) story is pretty average, but i really like characters. and the fact that to know full picture you need to play this game more than one time. i think that all sci-fi lovers can fnd some references to different universes. so all in all, i like this game and still have it installed on my pc, so i can play it time to time. i definitely can recommend this game to everyone, neither you are big fan of card game, or just want to start your journey.
phenomenal art style and world building combined with great deckbuilding and roguelight mechanics. here is hoping for future dlc

dumb players give low votes because they can't understand the rules of the game. as if one could blame chess because he isn't able to play properly... this is silly as in pure klei tradition (don't starve & oxygen not included) this game griftland is a shining gem. even if i am not a fan of deck games, this one was able to entrap me within its innovative and deep mechanics the part of negotiaion is completely refreshing for me and the flavour of the game is really nice, as the story background, very nice. i also love the graphics, but this is of secondary importance. recommended!

this game is amazing! i recently discovered it through a friend and i've been playing it almost everyday since. i've put so much time into slay the spire (sts) which is a giveaway for how much i love rogue-like deckbuilding games and this one is exactly that, but then times two, because you are actually building 2 decks in this game. different, or lets say more than in sts, you really get the feeling that you take your character through a story in this game, which makes winning or losing that much better or worse in my opinion, because you've actually spend way more time on a run. i would definitely recommend to check this one out!
best deck building game i played so far ! the replayability is there. there is only 3 characters/stories but i keep cycling through them and its really enjoyable

very good deckbuilder roguelite with just enough intriguing gameplay to make you feel you playing one more run. story had trouble with pacing but not requiring understanding to advance. can try out different builds each equally viable with each run

griftlands is a great deckbuilder with an interesting setting, entertaining story, and innovative way of handling the "combat vs social encounter" dilemma most rpg fans find themselves in. for those people who enjoy "slay the spire" but are looking for more plot in their games.
awesome unique card builder with heaps of character development. i'm not a fan of card builders but i love this game.

"negotiation battled" are a neat concept, but it kinda falls flat. the main problem is that actual battles are what really matter in the end, and by negotiating you skip battles, and thus don't get to improve your battle cards. so you'll be playing a diplomatic playthrough, get into an unavoidable battle, and get curbstomped by ultra overpowered enemies with no chance to retry and lose hours of work.

it was okay. the fight system was very unique. but the enemies were way too overpowered making the game extremely unfair. the story was okay. the main plotline made sense. the rest of it did not. the graphics were okay. overall, skip it unless you're really into the genre of visual novels and dark-souls kind of tough fights but in a different mechanic with turn-based manner.

appalling experience and very overrated game defines griftlands for me. the stories are rather uninspiring, short to enjoy them and too long for the type of gameplay. the game is repetitive and very slow. the cards offer no enjoyable synergies nor mechanics, poorly explained and unnecessarily complicated. all classes do pretty much the same things just cards are reworded. negotiation battles are original but don´t add that much value to the overall experience and it´s hard to fully understand what is going on. these just drag the gameplay. variety of monsters and graphics are about right. unfortunately, this game looks good but all the mechanics feel very bland, it lacks depth.
not impressive... another deck builder game. maybe the visual can be some highlight

my most played game of 2024. it's flawed, but still extremely fun. fast paced combat, customizable skill grids, many party combinations, and tons of deck possibilities. but the best part: it actually has a campaign, which is rare for these kinds of games.

deep, varied turn-based deckbuilding rpg with accessability options to switch off permadeath. i like the non-grim style and the perfectly polished ui works great with remote play on tablets. story mode with 2d maps and quests is a great addition to the linear and repetitive structure of slay the spire, which playstyle is covered with "realm mode". it's hard to put the game down. however, the many (many!) mechanics are not perfectly balanced yet, a lot of the options thrown at you are not properly introduced and kind of overwhelming, as it is very easy to **** up your build while progressing, at least the first time you play. has a steep difficulty curve too, the first two acts are easy-peasy but then it may start to become really difficult.
schöner deckbuilder, der gute motivation erzeugt und sehr stimmig ist. 9 von 10

gordian quest sin duda es un juego excelente, uno de los mejores juegos de cartas para un jugador que he jugado y ya van unos cuantos. la campaña no tiene una historia memorable, es cierto, pero cumple bien. y fuera de eso, todo lo que es la jugabilidad, la diferencia entre los distintos personajes, la mejora de los mismos y las barajas, etc. todo ello es simplemente inmejorable, y además tiene básicamente contenido infinito, siempre puedes ir haciendo más cosas, subiendo más niveles, haciendo dungeons y cosas así aleatorias y más difíciles. los enemigos también están muy bien diseñados, con variedad de estilos y ataques. y, finalmente, creo que es de los pocos juegos de cartas que consiguen hacer que el posicionamiento en el mapa de combate realmente sea muy significativo, interesante y divertido. gráficamente el juego peca un poco en el sector de las animaciones, pero las ilustraciones de personajes y escenarios están muy bien. el sonido también cumple bien, con una música que acompaña bien a los eventos y efectos de sonido apropiados. y, al menos en mi experiencia, no me he encontrado con ningún bug. por todo ello, sin duda gordian quest es muy recomendable. un 9.
not a simple game with lot of mechanism in it.however, its learning curve is not so slope,once you understand the fundamental, it's very interesting to explore.
an addictive mix of card collection and village builder that gradually unveils its hidden depths and provides a good 15+ hours of entertainment at a bargain price.

fun game with a relaxing feel, but with a general sense of urgency which is something you rarely see in "card games". in truth, this isnt a card game, its a strategy/explore/grind/colonymanagement game. lots of stuff but only a little from each. it all gives it a depth thats reachable and intriguing, but due to low action and the format, it makes it rather boring to play over 2 hours at a time, so it also secretly promotes healthy gaming

[ptbr] stacklands proporciona uma experiência singular de sobrevivência, administração de recursos e estratégia, em um card game com mecânicas simples de roguelite. demorei pouco mais de 10h para conquistar todos os achievements do jogo base, no entanto, ainda existem armas, locais e receitas a serem descobertas. visando qualidade, custo e proposta do jogo, stacklands é nota 10.
it is pretty simple but yet addictive game, with good mechanics and enjoyable gameplay.
very cool and chill roguelike-management game. the progression is well designed, the game has an equilibred difficulty

this game does so much for how remarkably simple it is. the management of building up extremely tall, the stress of having to micro multiple things at once, its extremely engaging, however can get quite repetitive. still, for the price, it is replayable enough to make it easily worth it.
this is a good game. it gets a little old after a bit, but still is fun, and recommend for anyone who thinks it looks fun.
stacklands offers a remarkable quantity and quality of plate-spinning fun in a remarkably small package.

celeste kesinlikle bir başyapıt. platform oyunu denince akla ilk gelecek yapımlardan biri. gerek grafikleri, gerek oynanışı, gerekse müzikleriyle her şeyi o kadar iyi yapıyor ki; oyuna hayran kalmamak elde değil. oyunun zorluk seviyesi tam tadında. kaybetmek veya sürekli ölmek sizi soğutmuyor, aksine 'öldükçe oynayasınız' geliyor. aynı durum çilek toplamak için de geçerli; o meydan okuma ve rekabet hissini size çok iyi veriyor. hikaye ilk bakışta çok ön planda gibi durmasa da, arka planda insanın iç dünyası ve psikolojisiyle ilgili derin bir anlatım var. kısacası; eğer bir platform oyununa başlamak istiyorsanız, bu kesinlikle celeste olmalı.
this goddamn game is way too good for this world. made me cry like a 5yo who dropped their ice cream. one of the best games i’ve ever played in my life.

this is l the greatest platformer game i have ever played. the controls are extraordinarily tight and responsive, and the level design constantly provides interesting and fun new gameplay. the game gets a bit tricky at points, but is consistently very forgiving. the game also looks and sounds quite nice, and the story is a good edition. the platforming is based in a few simple actions, but the tech can get incredibly deep. i have played 300+ hours across multiple consoles and would gladly play 300 more. cannot recommend this game enough to any platformer fans.

uno dei migliori platformer nel mercato, la curva di difficoltà eccellente per i livelli base e un po' sfasata per i lati b, lo stile del gioco è a dir poco adorabile e la storia riesce a rappresentare tanti fattori della ****, ansia ed esplorazione di se stesse, ogni signolo livello riesce a portare qualcosa di nuovo in tavola così da non entrare mai in uno stato di monotonia e in fine le musiche, scritte, composte e masterizzate dalla ultra talentuosa lena raine sono probabilmente le migliori per descrivere la salute mentale senza alcuna parola (eccezione fatta per in the mirror credo). un titolo da giocare assolutamente

all a and b sides finished and holy **** masterpiece it's so infuriating but so fair and intuitive at the same time and poses an incredible experience in terms of challenge each place is unique and beautiful memorable characters and dang that story is just perfect each level gimmick is so refined, clean and balanced and also suits the theme of each one the movement and animations are smooth and extremely satisfying and responsive and the music also slaps love it only complaint is 8b is just agonising

jogo ótimo, possui uma jogabilidade ótima com cada sala e cada fase sendo um estimulante para o jogador melhorar cada vez mais, apresentando novas mecânicas para não ficar enjoativo, gráficos impecáveis cada cenário é muito bem detalhado e muito divertido de se explorar, as músicas são ótimas também, jogo incrível muito bom

a really good game. at its core it is just a platformer, but it has some really advanced and interseting mechanics, introduced gradually meanning you are never confused about it. the difficulty is just right, and there are plenty of ways to make it easier/harder. the story is really good, and the music and art are both fantastic. if you like platformers, play this game. if you have never tried a platformer, play this game. if you like good games, play this game. the only real criticism i have is that diagonal inputs are a bit finicky with a controller, which can get a bit frustrating. however it is a relativly minor issue.

simply a fantastic experience, especially in co-op. the game is extremely challenging, but that only makes the rewards feel greater. at the start of each boss or level, you think defeating them is impossible - but as you learn the patterns, eventually you get the upper hand, and that feeling of triumph never gets old. and we don’t have to talk about the graphics and sound: unique and absolutely stunning.

le jeu nous propose un jeu de plateforme qui nous change des mario très redondants avec une d.a sublime et des boss très réussis qui ont tous leur particularité. ce côté cartoon rend sa complétion très satisfaisante d'autant plus que l'on peut y jouer à deux. certains boss peuvent paraitre insurmontable mais comme un jeu fromsoftware il suffit de s'accrocher pour y arriver. je recommande d'y jouer à deux la frustration y est moins présente même si les boss ont évidemment plus de vie. en point négatif on peut tout de même noter une trop grosse différence de la puissance des améliorations disponibles et les niveaux run&gun qui sont bien en dessous des boss (même si ces niveaux ne sont pas obligatoires au final). en bref cuphead est un excellent jeu indépendant que je vous conseille de faire d'autant plus qu'il n'est pas cher et pas trop long pour ceux qui ont peur des jeux longs.

the gameplay is more comparable to sonic than wario land as there is a huge emphasis on speed and momentum especially if you aim to 100% which requires getting every collectable and secret in each level while keeping a combo. each level introduces new mechanics including transformations which are very reminiscent of wario's transformations in wario land, there are also some difficult but fair bosses that are also similar to bosses in wario land. the art style is simple but charming and the soundtrack is extremely energetic. the level design is perfect for speedrunning and the move set has lots of depth which made replaying levels over and over again for 100% incredibly fun. all of this stuff may be overwhelming at first but mastering it made me feel like a speedrunner and gave me so much adrenaline, this is a game i could never get bored of.
not sure if the best platformer i ever played but certainly the funniest. originality is over the roof and despite being frustrating at times the fun of try again makes you keep going.
it's so fun it's a bit wonky at times but the movement, music, aesthetic and vibes are just so goofily awesome, and dripping with humour and passion fast psychotic italian man.
very fun game, very silly and well made animations, smooth platforming. great little indie.

the best indie 2d platformer of all time and best 2d platformer in general. or at least my favourite platformer of all time... it's a collage of fun, funny moments, funny characters, funny animations and more expressive than you. pure frenetism combined with one of the best soundtracks ever (that is not debatible) and this cartoony visual style!

there's a huge difference between being vague and being completely incomprehensible. this game is the latter. golden light is the first game in my life that actively did not want me to play it. every part of the gameplay is intentionally obscure. sure, there is a need for a learning curve in most games, but the basics need to be simple and clear, at least. i drew the line at being stuck in the hub world for 30 minutes, looking for a way to continue the game. i managed to find a way to clip out of bounds before i found an exit. after spending an hour with this game i got absolutely nothing out of it, except for a wasted hour.
