the game is truly beautiful and stands as one of the best souls-like experiences, very close to bloodborne. the bosses are powerful and beautifully designed, and the world is exactly as it should be. there’s only one real issue: the shortcut system. at first, it was well done, but later on, the placement felt completely wrong. however, this doesn’t kill the fun at all, since the save points are perfectly distributed, making it not too bothersome. as for the story, it was good at first but became excellent with the addition. that’s why i highly recommend it!️️ one more thing for those who say the game is extremely difficult: it’s a souls-like, what did you expect? the game actually becomes relatively easier once you master perfect parries. that’s why i think those who criticize it for being hard are simply not the target **** thank you ️

lies of p stands out as one of the most impressive soulslikes in recent years. i'd describe it as a story-driven soulslike, thanks to its focus on narrative, the inclusion of multiple difficulty modes, and the fluidity of both gameplay and storytelling.combat-wise, it holds its own against fromsoftware's best. the parry system, while challenging to master, offers incredibly satisfying feedback once you get the hang of it. it rewards precision and timing in a way that feels genuinely rewarding. the soundtrack deserves special praise—it's phenomenal. every track complements the story and the atmospheric setting beautifully. that said, i would have liked to see more engaging and less linear level design. while the ambiance does a great job setting the tone, a more interconnected world could have added another layer of depth to **** area that could be improved is the pacing of difficulty. the game begins in a fairly approachable way, making it welcoming for newcomers, but later boss fights—despite their excellent design—feature abrupt difficulty spikes that might feel discouraging to those new to the genre. a smoother difficulty curve would have made the experience more consistently rewarding. 8/10
one of my favorite games of the decade. great combat, art style, level design.

beatiful, lore is amazing, the dlc had strong and hard challenges. this is a good souls like for anyone who like the real style. had a good perfomance on pc. nice game play weapons are good and in future will be more accessible for anyone with difficult modifier.
impressively executes everything it sets out to do, with refined soulslike mechanics, strong atmosphere, and tightly designed encounters that rival its inspirations.
great souls-like but it could be a bit harder. very nice atmosphere, graphics and cool background story

it's a good soulslike, but it's a bit overrated. the exploration is much too linear and easy. the boss are very challenging, so this feels a bit like a boss run. it has a decent storyline, great visuals and soundtrack. and the quality of life features that make this game accessible (like difficulty settings) are amazing.

it has awesome combat mechanics and great level design. the bosses fell short for me, but some of them really stood out. this game was short and sweet and didn’t overstay its welcome. i had a blast playing it

the game is a disgrace,stupid and frustrating. the gameplay is terrible. you're walking on a plank barely wide enough for your foot, and the slightest touch makes you fall and lose half your health or more. make games that are actually fun, not just difficult for the sake of dragging out the time it takes to finish them. it's not our fault if you've run out of imagination and creativity and you can't make games be fun anymore. that's why we won't be buying the garbage you make and call 'games' anymore.

devs really know how to waste your time and piss you off with these stupid bots its almost unplayable and you cant progress the game without getting rage baited and im sure not putting the game on easy mode, its like they purposely make things un enjoyable i stopped playing after the 6th chapter before i called it quits.
i hope there are fewer games in this world that increase the difficulty of games by making the protagonist suffer from polio.

se você está pensando em jogar "lies of p", recomendo reconsiderar. o jogo pode até brilhar em alguns aspectos, como seus gráficos dhr e uma trilha sonora envolvente, mas o restante é um desastre completo.o combate é incrivelmente frustrante, com mecânicas mal desenvolvidas que tornam qualquer tentativa de jogabilidade fluida um verdadeiro desafio. não no bom sentido, como se espera de um souls-like, mas por pura falta de polimento. os caminhos no jogo são estreitos e mal desenhados, muitas vezes levando a lugar nenhum, como se tivessem sido feitos apenas para desperdiçar seu **** monstros são totalmente aleatórios e parecem jogados no jogo sem o menor cuidado. mal configurados, eles não apresentam desafios inteligentes, apenas se tornam obstáculos irritantes e desconexos. sério, não consigo entender como esse jogo ganhou prêmios. a ideia de alguém achar que isso é bom me deixa perplexo, a não ser que você seja um dos poucos que aguenta qualquer coisa só por ser fã de souls-like.e, além de tudo isso, o jogo é absurdamente caro. não vale, nem de longe, o preço que estão pedindo. se essa empresa lançar mais jogos, eu vou lembrar bem do nome, pra não comprar.
a great game overall, but it has some flaws like the bad camera in combat or some unfair deaths throughout the game because of bugs
i was very suprised that this gamewas very good soulslike. it was not hard as others but still i had fun playing it.

overall, the game has nice graphics and the combat system is not bad, but the game is quite simple (one attempt is enough to learn all the mechanics of each boss) and the item learning system could work better, but i still liked the game and will probably play it again
mi primer souls. y si bien tiene defectos como un mapa confuso y una historia inentendible; eso no significa que no sea un buen juego con mecánicas interesantes.
this masterpiece . this is a legend a truly perfect legend the first game i was really obsessed with it

the scorn of dark souls clones. it's a 7 from me but a high 7 (green rather than the default yellow colour). the aesthetics are oppressive and beautiful. the slow methodical exploration and figuring out what to do is way more obtuse than dark souls but has a similar feeling of reward. i'd argue that the mechanics are a little too obtuse and that as a result i didn't commit to any other playstyle rather than my starting one, but the sense of being lost in an aggressive dream-like world is very strong. the combat for me was repetitive and sluggish and the bosses aren't the best i've seen. for me the game shines in it's 3 main 'dungeons', and the genuinely scary 'run-backs' to base camp after killing the bosses. as others have said the long animations and clunkyness are what hold it back, despite it clearly being intended to give the impression of heft - it does but at a cost.

the game is skeletal and not very fleshed out but still is fun. don't expect to want to play all the time but is a really good first-time playthrough and should last 6-10 hours. it is fun to revisit and is worth it if you're ok with not playing a ton. the game is a bit of a maze if you just wander so use the visions or you might want to look up a quick playthrough. the biomes are great and are designed so that you don't spend too much time in them so they don't get repetitive too quickly. everything that isn't a boss isn't as fun to fight though. mechanics are fun but i try to avoid using the hardening ability to make it feel less choppy. the lore is interesting but there isn't a lot to it when playing through unless you dig for it. if you want lore, playthrough, and level as solomon. music is good enough and sets the tone of the game.
é um bom jogo para iniciar em jogos estilo souls, as batalhas contra chefes não são tão desafiadoras...

soulslike oyunlara getirdiği bazı yenilikler olsa da combat'taki tekrar eden yapısı, düşman çeşitliliğindeki eksiklik, boss'ların çok az hareketinin olması, combat keskinliğinin düşük olması gibi nedenlerle o kadar da beğenmedim. dar alanlarda üzerine çok sayıda gönderilen düşmanlar bence oyunun ritmine ve hızına uygun olmamış. sertleşme muhabbeti ilginç. kalkan gibi ama tekrar kullanmak için bir kaç saniye beklemek gerekiyor. kabuk denilen cesetleri bulup artık o karakter olarak oynama fikri de ilginç olmuş. i̇stediğiniz zaman oyun stiliniz tamamen değiştirebiliyorsunuz. ama bir ritim tutturduktan sonra her düşmanı ve hatta her boss'u aynı taktikle kesiyorsun zaten. başta alışması zor oldu ama sonunda oynadığım en kolay soulslike oyundu. item'ları bir kez kullanmadan ne işe yaradığını bilemiyorsunuz. i̇lk kullanış genelde boşa gidiyor yani, beğenmedim. bir de item'lıar belli bir sayıda kullanınca aşinalık kazanıp daha çok verim alıyorsunuz, iyi bir özellik. haritası bu kadar karmaşık bir oyun görmedim. bir de ana boss'ları kesip bir item alınca aynı yolu siste ve karanlıkta dönme fikri çok saçma olmuş. neticede iyi veya kötü olmayan ortalama bir iş. souls açlığı çekenler faydasını görür ama beklenti düşük olmalı.

desde la perspectiva de un soulslike, es excelente su gameplay y ambientacion, tanto como sus mecanicas originales y unicas, tambien es un juego muy versatil a la hora de tu poder cambier de estrategia para un boss o alguna zona en concreto. pero donde pierde es en la variedad de sus bosses y enemigos, algo aceptable teniendo en cuenta que no es un juego triple a, pero donde no me gusto para nada y por lo cual no le doy mas punto es en su jefe final, es realmente decepcionante.

theres barely anything redeemable about the game this is one of, if not the worst, souls like i have played in my life. this game doesnt feel like it was tested or examined by people other than the devs. do no waste your time on it, i have died to jank more often than my own lack of skill. the enemy placement is not clever, it is annoying, dark souls 2 sotfs levels of annoying. the bosses are uninspired, or worse, buggy, i have been killed multiple times by lingering hitboxes after an attack has clearly, visibly and obviously stopped. theres is no level ups or character builds, you simply unlocks "abilities" for your current armor that has a probability of procing. this game is nothing like a fair souls like game, this game is either untested, unfinished or the developpers are incompetent
this game is just not good. the combat and world building and atmosphere is very lacking and subpar to other soulslike.

i had high hopes for this one, but unfortunately, it was completely unplayable, so i deleted it. the combat feels too clunky - so after playing ds, bloodborne and sekiro, it was way too frustraing. obvicouly, my opinion is biased based on playing otger much faster paced games with smoother combat style, so if you have not played any of those titles and are going straight fromthe first genre of comsoles, you might have a better time...

a failed soulslike i dont recommand for a lot of reason im not going to write here since it was free on epic just download it or ask a friend who have it try it for 30 minutes you'll understandi its sad though this game had a lot of potentiel and good ideas.
bu türde fazla oyun oynamadım ama sanırım bu türü sevmediğimi anladım. belki daha iyi bir oyun olsa türe karşı bakış açım değişebilirdi.
it's very bad and not funny at all it has bad bosses bad ideas i can't call it souls game

wasted potential. there is no enemy variety, the map is monotonous, checkpoints are insufficient, fast travel should have been accessible from the very beginning of the game. we shouldn't have to collect health replenishing items over and over again.

years have passed since this game and the dlc on switch still cannot be played, you should say that in the analyzes that it has two bugs that cannot be done, it directly gives you an error message when entering a temple. you should say it. on switch that is and only the dlc

the atmosphere was definitely done correctly but my god is there a lot of jank in this game. bosses disappearing mid fight so you have to reset. hardening not working. mobs not spawning in until they have already shot their arrows at you. mobs not spawning in until you walk past the spot where they usually are and then spawning in behind you. the list goes on. and what do playstack do? they introduce patches that only patch out the speedrunner strats. why? it wouldnt be so bad if the boss fights were at least fun after the slog of going through the janky world. but no. two of the four main bosses have about 3 moves only and the other 2 are gimmick fights. not worth checking out unless you are really into the souls-like genre, if even then.

salt and sanctuary is a weird experience, and it's the best i can describe it. it is all a metroadvania game should not be. it has an interesting gameplay, a bit sloppy controls, ok sound design and overall has tough as nails boss fights and a over-simplistic story. its souls-like elements feel unfinished. all of the classes - even the rogue - feel slow to control, this feels like a huge step-down from its competitors such as hollow knight. this game has too much gore, it remains a mystery as to what the developer was smoking. the game's sinister atmosphere creates unease. my verdict is 7/10: it has good character customization and an ok gameplay.

прошел я salt and sanctuary, игра неожиданно оказалось очень крутой. игры серии souls изначально по сути своей были переносом жанра метроидвания на рельсы 3d, очень уникальным и своеобразным но все же. salt and sanctuary еще раз перевернула ситуацию, она перенесла dark souls на рельсы 2d. с самого начала игра дает понять на что она опирается и вообще этого не скрывает, скорее прямо заявляет, что вот мы - фанаты dark souls и сделали игру под копирку, так как ее обожаем. изначально я скептически отнесся, но когда влился оказалось что это нереально круто, жанр метроидвания идеально сочетается с dark souls, как атмосферой, так и боевкой. тут присутствует почти все элементы присущие souls - ковенанты, души, множество разного оружия и брони, боссы и т.д. ты как будто реально играешь в dark souls но в 2d. боссы очень простые, проходятся с 1-2 раз, последнего босса убил с первого раза, но возможно я собрался как имба, играл фулл хэви билдом с двуручником и щитом. основная проблема игра - отсутствие карты, насколько вы можете знать - в дарск соулс карты нет, но дарк соулс это не метроидвания, а тут огромный 2д мир и без карты! скорее всего большинство людей сошли бы с ума из-за отсутствия карты и дропнули игру еще на середине или даже раньше, но поскольку я топографический гигант, то я выдержал, люди не готовые перманентно держать карту в голове не перенесут такого напряжения. однако, если вы любите дарк соулс и метроидвании, то бегите играть срочно игра имба! 8 из 10

recomendo à todos. joguei em minhas férias de trabalho por um bom tempo, e tenho que dizer que o jogo só me impressionou de acordo com o tempo. ele me lembra os antigos jogos de plataforma e também me lembra os jogos com características de soulslike, sua ambientação é muito boa e sua história é ótima de acompanhar. para quem está acostumado com dark souls, esse jogo é mais fácil e rápido, porém muito divertido. notas: se você foca em diversão o jogo é: 10/10 se você procura dificuldade e tenta se provar:7/10 dito isso, 9/10
for metroidvania fans. pros.: story; locations, map, upgrades. cons.: no minimap and map access; overall difficulty and forcing into grinding.

good souls-like metroidvania side scroller. despite being among the first in this genre, it still holds up well. the character creator looks weird and almost makes it feel light-hearted, but once in game, everything is a lot darker and looks much nicer.

recomendadísimo me he pasado 95 juegos en mi vida(sí, llevo la cuenta con una lista, soy un friki), y he jugado a muchísimos más. quiero dar ese dato para demostrar que soy un gamer empedernido y darle el valor que este juego se merece al decir que lo situaría en el top 5 de los juegos que más he disfrutado en mi vida. y escribo esto 6 años después de haberlo jugado, (no es la calentada de según te terminas un juego, lo digo con la mente fría). la música de los combates contra jefes, que sigo recordando aún a día de hoy, la atmósfera oscura, un diseño artístico fabuloso, los mil escondites y secretos que hay por el mundo, los combates tan difíciles y desafiantes que tiene, las infinitas posibilidades de personalización y enfoque del personaje para el combate...y pensar que esta obra maestra fue creada tan solo por 2 personas... lo último que quiero decir es que tiene una "secuela" que se llama "salt and sacrifice" y que pongo secuela entre comillas porque no sigue la trama del primero y porque es una absoluta basura, que no le llega ni a los pies a esta primera entrega original y no exagero al decir que lo empeora absolutamente todo. en mi vida he visto una decadencia tan bestia de una segunda parte de un juego(a la altura del bajón de dragon age ii). pero lo dicho, salt and sanctuary es dios.

oh well, this one was lit! i received salt and sanctuary as a free epic store game at christmas, and i couldnt stop playing it during the whole holidays. as a dark souls and metroidvania fan, i couldnt be more surprised, how this synergy of genre works in this game. the art style is just perfect, gameplay and combat is just as punishing as in souls games. the exploration element, skill gaining and backtracking - things that are defining metroivania works here more then well. as for the combat itself, maybe it could be more "complex", but the difficulty is ramping up with few bosses. overall it keeps the metroidvania's combat style and feel. if you like metroidvanias and/or dark souls, this is a game for you as even if you will get bullied over and over, you won't be able to stop playing until you finish it.

as many other have described this is a mix of ds / castlevania. overall i loved it and considering the team behind this i have to give it a 10 / 10. i dont know if theres a lot of replayability because at the end of the day its pretty linear. my mage playtrhough was very fun and challenging altough the end of the game got way easier. + graphics, music, atmospehre, builds, mechanics / - replayability, navigation

сначала игра не понравилась совсем, убивали через каждые пару минут...разобраться было сложно ...какое оружие и броню выбрать...во что вкачивать левел апы...что за религия...что за "соль"...куда идти...карты нет...но потом более менее разобравшись затянуло...даже пройдя игру так и не разобрался во всём :) после посмотрел прохождения на youtube, понял чуть больше...про религии, про бафы на оружие...оказалось что не убил 2 босса...просто потому что запутался где я был, а где я ещё не был :) игра не без минусов, но достойная :)

единственный недостаток этой игры является отсутствие карты, с возможностью оставлять метки. ведь просто нереально в метроидвании запомнить карту всего мира.(( очень бы хотелось вернуться в неисследованные места после получения способностей, но я, как игрок, просто забываю о таких местах, и без подсказок просто невозможно их вспомнить.

una absoluta basura. estoy reseñando la ultima versión de agosto del 2024, donde se ha introducido un modo ramdomicer. el resultado es terrible, carece de cualquier lógica el desequilibrio del juego, lo que te lleva a repetir la "run" hasta que mínimamente es accesible. este juego nunca estuvo inteligentemente equilibrado, es profundamente injusto y desbalanceado desde el principio, pero el modo random es ya un insulto. ni un céntimo a estos vagos incapaces de corregir los problemas que lleva arrastrando el juego 8 años.

pomysł nie jest zły. stylistyka ładna i to koniec plusów. sterowanie jest nieintuicyjne a hit-box'y są zrobione gorzej niż te w ds2. kombinacje ataków raz działają raz nie. na ekranie strasznie się wszystko zlewa z tłem. fajny eksperyment jednak nie polecam.

update: as it seems that the developers have made the regrettable choice to commit to egs exclusivity (even if it only ends up being temporary) i can't stand by my previous score of 10/10 and have updated it accordingly. original review as follows: with 200+ hours in s&s and 600+ across all 3 dark souls games, this is about as close to it as you can get without actually playing dark souls. beautiful art, music is meh with a few exceptions, and fun gameplay.

да какого хрена у противников не прерываются атаки и каст спеллов, а мувсеты у боссов начинаются практически одинаково? и кто-то всерьёз ставит этому шлаку что-то больше ноля не видя, что даже основная механика сломана к чертям!
souls-like платформер, который по началу интересен, но к середине как то поднаскучил.
bored, no funny, not interesting and very colourless. why am i playing this game? for only boss fight or something?

una auténtica lástima. desearía que me gustara este juego, pero no va a ser posible. salt and sanctuary solo se ha dedicado a matarme injustamente y a robarme mis merecidas almas; pero el mayor pecado de sas es, sin duda, el olvidar que sas es otro juego, no un remake de dark souls en 2d. había jugado en el pasado un remake de ds para spectrum, un pequeño juego hecho en coña parodiando el original. ese remake para spectrum, aún siendo una parodia hecha por un fan, aportó elementos en su jugabilidad que no se habían visto en el ds original, no muchos, pero algo nuevo metió. esto no lo ha hecho sas, se ha olvidado de su propia identidad, y se ha limitado a calcarlo todo de ds, solo dejando sin copiar los elementos imposibles en un entorno 2d. además, ha fallado al entender porqué ds funciona, lo que tampoco le ayudó a copiarlo bien. es una auténtica lástima, insisto, llevo siguiendo este juego durante años y lo he jugado ahora solo para llevarme un batacazo y una decepción, con todo lo que prometía. tal vez, no sé, los developers ahora hagan un dlc arreglando el juego básico y añadiendo más contenido, copiando lo que ocurrió con ds 2, pero algo me dice que no va a ser así, y que este juego llamado sas que parece un prototipo, seguirá siendo un prototipo toda la eternidad. insisto, una verdadera lástima.
i love the lore of the fallen kingdom and should 100% be continued, it distracts me all day and it is one of the best games ive played in a while

kurzweiliges action-rpg/soulslike welches gut 10 stunden unterhält. man merkt dem spiel an, dass es ein indie titel ist. mit mehr zeit und geld hätte daraus noch ein viel größeres und besseres spiel werden können. story und gameplay hätten weiter ausgebaut werden können. so zum glück haben die entwickler aber ein ende gefunden und in dem moment wo das spiel dröge wird es auch zu ende gebracht.

good part - battles flow with dynamic and fast mechanics. - plague weapon fights are diversified because each attack leaves almost a different effect. - great boss fights. - the system used to fight enemies is very enjoyable. - the talent system is not bad. bad part - there are a few shortcomings because they have no money (sound, animations, map...) - the story does not explain itself. - smoke varieties are few. according to 2024

très difficile, très exigent, nécessite un apprentissage long et fastidieux. mais bon gameplay et ambiance ok. j'espère que s'il y a une suite, le studio aura plus de moyen pour étoffer un peu le jeu et créer un monde/environnement plus complet..

combat system is great and creative while feeling punishing but fair. the plague weapons are amazing and fun to use. the story and level design is good. i would have wished for a little bit more enemy variety though. most bosses are great, but some of them could use more attacks.
i like the combat system. its hard but not unfair. cool musik and the story is ok!
this is an ok soulslike game, the story and setting is nothing much, combat is enjoyable, bosses are good also. i had drive to play and finish it, try out different plague weapons.

my first souls like game, it was enjoyable after the first boss, it was hard to get used to at first, but overall it didn't cause a huge problem to my surprise. nice game, the story didn't excite me so much.
short souls with one excellent memorable boss. other than it's not what expected with all that hype. also what i will also remember is the good awful running animation.
short and nice, one of the better soulslike

fine small game if not for its technical issues. fighting system works more often not then it does. thats annoying because fights could be fun if it did. i dont understand why the industry doesnt spend more money for real developers who know computers. instead employ wanna be script kiddies who dont even know how to handle game engines. nice little game you can play thru in an afternoon. buy only if you dont mind annoying technical issues. otherwise look for some quailty software. dont spend more than 5 bucks on it. its not worth it.

luckily, going into this one i didn't expect much. thisview would not change while playing. the game is jank, and horribly low effort. hitboxes are awful, animation and movement feels robotic, and the cutscenes are powerpoints. the game increbidly low budget, and it's an area team 17 isn't experienced in. if you were going to play this, play any other soulslike instead.

tried it from psplus. after 10 hours, i unistalled it. nothing special imo. a good combat system but not with much depth. enemy and level design are atrocious. and this bloody fog all over the place damaged my eyes. aa product at best.
not worth the time.... a lot of the level design is confusing as hell......

que no os engañen las criticas compradas, este juego es: corto, lineal y aburrido. con unas mecanicas de parri obsoletas y sin rejugabilidad. faltan armas, armaduras y cualquier cosa que pueda dar variedad. los escenarios son horribles y vacios, los enemigos se repiten, en 30 minutos te has aburrido.

una maravilla lo recomiendo me encanto, es un juego chiquito desarrollado por un estudio pequeño, un juego con fallas y aciertos, unos combates de jefes geniales menos 1 que no me gusto, el escenario la verdad a mi me gusto y la variedad de enemigos me parece aceptable solo que el patron de ataques de ellos no varia, en cuestion de armas y eso pues no hay mucho jaja perooo pero lo compensa con un arbol de habilidades genial que permite personalizar al personaje a tu forma de jugar, la historia como en casi todo soulslike vale pepino c:, solo se me hizo en falta que los personajes tuvieran voces y talvez cinematicas pero meh, lo recomiendo denle la oportunidad a ver si tenemos un thymesia 2 c:

many do not understand what is the attraction of souls like games. for me, this is not the complexity of the enemies or the mystery of the plot. for me, the main thing is the spirit of adventure and exploration of unknown terrain. this game has it all. the game reminded hellpoint, but a little worse. still, i enjoyed the game. the design of some levels is ambiguous. but + 1 point, because the game is budget and some nuances can be forgiven.
good game. excelent and unique craft system. a little bit hard for me but not boring at all.
dolmen is an amazing game, action, suspense and exotic and dynamic scenarios.

the game has several strengths and some that can be improved, overall it delivers what it promises. i recommend it to anyone looking for some casual fun and a high difficulty.
dolmen is a game that delivers what it promises. fun game, beautiful graphics.

the best indie soulslike i've ever played! the crafting system gives you even more meaning to the grinding in the genre, make it more meaningful and make you want to defy the most types of enemies to craft the mostly diverse gears possible.

this game is terrible. not much needs to be said. now i have never left a review before, ever, but after looking at this one i decided to make a comment. specifically because it should be pointed out that certain negative user reviews of this game appear to be disappearing. also, if you look at the reviewers who feel that this is a perfect 10 out of 10 (which is ridiculous) almost all of them have never reviewed a game before, with the exception of dolmen, and have left perfect 10/10 reviews on every platform. glad to see massive works marketing dollars are being spent well.

soulslike oyun açlığı çekenlerin şifa niyetine tüketmeleri gereken bir iş. büyük çaplı değil, basit ve kısa bir oyun. ama yaptığı işi çok iyi yapıyor. karakter ve silah gelişimi olsa da rpg elementleri çok az. bir tane silahınız var. ancak özel yeteneğiniz sayesinde düşmanlarınızın silahlarını bir defaya mahsus çalıp kullanabiliyorsunuz. böylelikle ondan fazla silahı kullanmış oluyorsunuz. bu da oyuna souls oyunlarında olmayan bir element eklemiş. bir diğer şey düşmanlarınıza vurduğunuzda canlarının azalması ancak pençe ile vurmadığınızda yaralarının iyileşip geri dolması. bu yüzden normal saldırılarınızı yaptıktan kısa bir süre sonra bir kaç kez de pençe saldırısı yapmanız gerekiyor. bu da yavaş ve defansif değil agresif oynamak zorunda olmanız demek. ki oyunun oynanışı da bunu destekliyor. epey hızlı bir karakterimiz var. ne kadar hızlı olduğumuzu oyunun son boss'u olarak kendimiz gibi birisi karşımıza çıktığında anlıyoruz. beni bir kaç saat uğraştırdı açıkçası. oyun atmosferi ve görselliği güzel. müzik yok gibi bir şey. harita dizaynı fena değil. bir bölüme sondaki boss'u kesip gidiyorsunuz. ama o bölümde keşfedecek küçük yerler falan var. üst katlar vesaire. öyle dümdüz koridorda ilerlemiyorsunuz. neticede iş görür derecede bir oyun. çok beklenti olmadan oynanabilir. türe eklediği bir kaç yaratıcı fikir de cabası.

in my opinion the perfect soulslike. the combination of new ideas (white and green bar, weapons, talent tree) and good old mechanics (deflect and dodge) make it really fun. it‘s fast pace, it‘s extremely hard. bosses are designed nicely, graphics are great. hope there will come more!

would highly recommend. the game is in a better spot than helldivers 2 is. for a 2015 top down shooter, it's pretty fun. it's difficult but i appreciate the challenge. though would say this is definitely more of a "fun with friends" sort of game, as well multiplayer is pretty sparse nowadays for this game, but regardless it's pretty awesome, recommended for sure. especially if you don't have a decent computer that can run the second game, yet still want to get in on the action.

might be the best coop game i've played, scratches that itch for me of requiring teamwork and being highly cooperative. have yet to find a game like it, the sequel does not do it for me. if you have friends to play with its a ton of fun, if you don't, i'd recommend making some. gameplay is chaotic and full of very funny moments. long and relatively fleshed out progression system and good degrees of difficulty to match, quite grindy though but gives you things to work towards for a long time. playerbase nowadays is quite small however. 3 factions with plenty of enemy variety and good build options to adapt to them. there's a high degree of skill expression but its still goofy and casual which is perfect for me. still wishing for an iteration on this type of twin stick shooter in love with melee dodging... hmu if you wanna play :)

among us is truly one of the best games to enjoy with **** developers have done an excellent job in making it accessible on both mobile and pc platforms.with the right people, the game never feels boring, offering endless moments of fun and strategy. when playing solo, the only downside is encountering the occasional cheater — though fortunately, that doesn’t happen often.overall, the game is nearly perfect: it’s well-optimized, free of major bugs, and delivers a smooth and enjoyable experience built around a creative and engaging concept.

it's hard to get a full, active lobby going online with strangers in 2025 -- the game's popularity has definitely died a lot. however, if you can get a group of friends going (a full lobby of 10+ is best) this is so much fun. always worth playing a bit regardless because of how memetically impactful this game was (not many games have fundamentally changed language and slang like this one has), but otherwise it probably won't be engaging for long if you're just playing alone with strangers via the in-game chat. i always end up going back to this whenever i find people willing to play it with me - it's funny, addictive, and charming.
i loved this game years ago and still do. i wish it was more popular. such a great concept and simple for anyone to play and have a ton of fun with friends.

what a great game to play forever when bored. you do missions around the map and you find who's the imposter, find dead bodies and probably get killed. impostors also can sabotage the ship (1st map), and make things bit difficult so an imposter can do easily a little kill, and you do that, repeditively, with your friends, on discord. i recommand that game completely. the fact that the game is getting a bit too "advanced" for me. they added recently new roles as a bean (player), and that is a bit too much for me. the maps are enough for me. -1 point so many players leaves the game when the game starts, and that makes the game shorter to play. -1 point innersloth made a great game for now 6 years. great job, would recommand.

quite literally the worst game i've ever played and may be one of the worst of all time. there is absolutely nothing charming about the game. it's hideous, and the characters have the visual appeal of road kill. the control to actually move your player character make e.t. the extra terrestrial for the atari 2600 seem smooth in comparison. ride to hell: retribution is a better social deduction game and it's not even one. it's in a completely different genre. online play is stupidly laggy, even with a cable internet connection it feels like you're playing on a server that's basically two cans connected by a string. the tasks are mindless crap and garbage. as far as the community goes, might be the single most toxic fandom in the history of fandoms. poisonous to the nth degree, society was made worse by the existence of this game. i guess covid really did rot everyone's brains because people think this is a good game. stay away, for the love of god.

je ne conseille pas le jeu aux casuals players. il n'y a aucun endroit où vous ne pouvez pas vous faire tuer dans ce monde en pvp, et lorsque vous perdez un combat, vous allez juste vous faire spawnkill en boucle jusqu'a ce que le jeu comprenne que vous avez perdu pour vous faire respawn ailleurs. (oui oui c'est un choix des developpeurs)du coup, le jeu a l'air de plutôt de s'adresser aux hardcores gamers ? tout le coté navigation, visée au canon, et le pvp y a du challenge c'est vrai. sinon bof, y a pas énormément de contenu, mais y en a un peu plus à chaque mise a jour. mais j'aime être un pirate alors je joue quand même

i am surprised by the 5.7 average i see from **** of thieves is insanely rich and well done. it has a vast open-world map that does not feel empty (in contrast to many other open-worlds). a **** of missions available, you can spend years playing the game and still find new stuff!it has kind of a steep learning curve, and it is not really intuitive, but once you get thejist you can do a lot.only downside, for me, is that the game loses a lot (and becomes a bit slow or repetitive) for solo-players. a team of 2-3 is ideal but alas, hard to assemble (covid had at least this positive side **** can both play just to have fun for a few hours, or to actually get involved with the lore.. the game is slow, but is intended to be.. and can be punishing and frustrating (pvp).. but again, is intended to be.plus, you get to fight krakens and fish inside storms to get rare ****.. what more do you want?

want to own your own ship, and be your own boss? want to be the best captain on the open seas? here is your chance. the once dead and boring game is now bustling with things to do! buy and decorate your own ship, customize your own character, own a pet, and finally fish to your hearts content. what more could you want? want to become a pirate legend? they got you. want to be a pig and snake trader? they got you. want to be a proud treasure hunter? gosh golly they got you there too!
the game is great it has many things to do and great options to play with friends the only thing is that you can't play in big servers
i had fun with friends but it did get a bit boring after a while. but a fun game, would recommended.

the game visually is a marvel, the sea is very well recreated, the feeling of immersion and exploration is wonderful and you can get lost in its world, so much for the good **** servers are **** ****, they work terrible, there's constant lag, stuttering, ping spikes, people teleporting in pvp fights... it's a **** experience. oh, i forgot, there's also an insane hitreg, 6 out of every 10 shots, the server smokes them, so the fights are an rng **** community ****, it's full of griefers and people who claim to love pvp, but are dedicated to camping newbies and stealing the 4 treasures they have on the ship from new people, they are a despicable community. the worst thing about the game without a doubtif you're selling a pvpve experience, interactions should work, when that doesn't happen, pvp mode has to be optional. once you get the game to work properly, then make pvp mandatory, which i don't see the point of either, the game has no progression so letting people do pve quietly isn't a bad thing for the game either."you generate gold inflation" oh, what a problem. with gold you can only buy **** cosmetics, there is no concept of inflation in a game with no progression, **** alive thanks to gamepass and the lies of their devs selling a pve experience with friends when the game is really a nest of griefers and **** abusing the weak.

the player base for this game remains one of the most toxic and cheat-ridden that i've come across. the devs also remain some of the most aloof and uncaring that i've ever seen. there is no report function, no solo server function, nothing to get away from toxic players except to sink your own ship and hop to a different server - giving the players harassing you all of your loot and wasting your time. nothing has been done to address the rising concerns of non-cheating players. the game is fun, but worthless to those who want to play correctly. you can't enjoy playing the game when you're being killed constantly by players spawning in exploding barrels or shooting you through walls. until these issues are addressed, i would not recommend this game. good points: fun loot system, fun sailing and fishing system, interesting and lore-filled quests. bad points: everything above that's stopping you from enjoying it. do yourself a favor and don't buy this game until the issues have been addressed.
5 horas são o suficientes para enjoar desse jogo. jogabilidade bem complicada e difícil de acostumar. fica muito chato e repetitivo muito breve. muito infantil.
needs pve considering most of the game itself is pve with tall tales and exploring islands and quests etc.

holy peak. rust is one of the greatest games ive ever played. you start off with nothing more than a rock and a torch and from there its pure survival. theres a lot and i mean a lot of grinding, failed base attempts and setbacks, but that’s all part of the experience. every failure teaches you something new and every success feels absolutely earned. the game perfectly captures the balance between chaos and triumph. 10000000/10 definitely recommend. one of the most rewarding survival experiences out there.
genres: Shooter, Action, RPG, Indie, Massively Multiplayer

review_text: игра отлично подходит если у вас обнаружены какие либо психические отклонения, в особенности психопатия, социофобия или анорексия. главный парадокс этой игры найти смысл: как не взять в рот в этой игре? ответ: никак пустота: ум опустел, оставив лишь эхо тщетных усилий. мысли растворились, как сахар в воде, не оставив ни вкуса, ни следа.исчерпанность: все пути исхожены, все методы испробованы. борьба с оковами разума обернулась бесконечным кругом, ведущим никуда.принятие: осознание собственного бессилия. принятие того, что освобождение – это иллюзия, а разум – это тюрьма, из которой нет выхода.спокойствие: в опустошенном разуме воцарилась тишина. утихли бури сомнений и терзаний, оставив лишь безмятежность пустоты.парадокс: осознание "никак" одновременно является и поражением, и освобождением. это отказ от борьбы, но и принятие реальности.
genres: Shooter, Action, RPG, Indie, Massively Multiplayer

review_text: rust's formula is deceptively simple: farm resources, build your base, and survive. but the reality is staying alive is a joke. the fortress i spent all afternoon meticulously building turns into ruins the next day i log in. i have no time to enjoy the beautiful because any second someone's might jump out and turn me into their next **** in all, it's an amazing survival experience. i've lost sleep, my social life, and my sanity… but, at least i've got my 2x1 with a tc and a box full of scrap

review_text: rust may be one of the single most innovative games of its time and in recent times. those complaining about team sizes could just play solo-only servers, those complaining about time investment could play 2 day wipes, and those complaining about toxicity can just mute people! no matter your availability, game preference, or skill ability, there is a server for everyone and a great experience waiting in rust.
genres: Shooter, Action, RPG, Indie, Massively Multiplayer

review_text: rust is a compelling and intense multiplayer survival game developed by facepunch studios, where players must gather resources, build shelters, and engage in pvp combat to survive on a deserted island. starting with nothing, players quickly scavenge for materials to craft tools and weapons, navigating a challenging day-night cycle and constant threats from other players. the game's building and crafting systems are deep and rewarding, allowing for the creation of complex bases and equipment. voice chat enhances social interactions, fostering alliances and rivalries within large servers. despite its brutal and unforgiving nature, rust offers an enriching experience as players outlast competitors and thrive in a hostile environment, making it a must-play for fans of survival games!
genres: Shooter, Action, RPG, Indie, Massively Multiplayer

review_text: mechanics are from 2013, few weapon classes and poor design contribute to a sadistic experience only a true psychopath could enjoy. no story or environmental design is present, the developers clearly had no plan at the beginning, playing rust feels like a middleschooler's idea of a video game, where mechanics from various genres are cobbled together without any underlying rationale or thought. how, anyone could continue to produce such a game without any premeditation is simply stunning. if you meet somebody, and you learn they play rust, avoid them as they are a true psychopath.

it's good just extreme balance isuses toxic players so many gooner skins and frustrating rank system
ніколи не цікавився таким персонажем як єнот ракета, але після цієї ігри я повністю змінив свою думку. тепер це один із моїх улюблених персонажів
cool overwatch clone in the marvel universe. generic graphics, but great regular updates. can quickly become repetitive and there's a lack of willingness to fulfill all roles from other players.

marvel rivals is hands down the best live service game i’ve played in a long time – and honestly, it’s my number one "on going" game! from the very first match, i was completely hooked. the mix of fast-paced action, strategic teamplay, and that unique marvel flair is simply unbeatable.each hero feels distinct and powerful, with their own unique playstyle. the combat system is smooth, dynamic, and super satisfying. the maps are well-designed, and the graphic design shows a real attention to detail.what really stood out to me is the cast – the selection of playable marvel characters is both diverse and perfectly executed, both visually and in terms of gameplay. every marvel fan will find something to love here.i could barely stop playing and i’m already excited for what’s coming next. for me, marvel rivals is more than just a great game – it’s become my personal go-to game.

this is currently one of my favorite games to play right now. the gameplay loop is engaging, the art style is incredibly stunning, and the update cycle keeps this game feeling fresh for months on end. the progression for proficiency feels rewarding with some cool rewards. each character felt very unique with their own set of lines for every other character and ultimate attacks that feel very distinct and fun to use. the developers are extremely committed to giving the game content at a high frequency, but without rushing the skins, updates, and more out the door unfinished. despite all that, i cannot ignore the gaping issues within the game. the matchmaking is atrocious, some of the skins are pretty questionable, and the toxic environment can be very unwelcoming. the rank system can sometimes feel like walking through mud. if these things can be fixed, the game has potential to be one of the best multiplayer games on the market, but for now, it stand as an eight out of ten.
absolute gooner game, that being said i am a man so anything below a seven would be blasphemy

never been a hero shooter kinda guy. played maybe 20 hours of overwatch back in the day. never been much of a marvel guy either but this game. is actually pretty fun. i mostly main iron man or winter solider

marvel rivals brings beloved characters to life, perfectly aligned with what fans love from the mcu. the frenetic gameplay feels like a true evolution of what overwatch started, now faster, flashier, and even more addictive. waifu and husbando material? absolutely — the skin designs are top-tier, and all of it comes in a free-to-play package. for anyone who enjoys multiplayer arena games, this is an easy 10. marvel rivals is here to stay, and with more characters, modes, and skins on the way, it’s only going to get better. massive props to netease.

as someone who has been disinterested in the mcu since iron man 2 and with limited interest in the hero shooter genre, the fantastic art style and solid gameplay loop in this game was able to break through all those past barriers and get me addicted. a fun shooter with a lot of visual splendor.

a simply disgusting game. every update they mess something up, healers do more damage than dps and heal way too much. some dps do a lot of damage but also heal a lot. it seems that the developers of this awful game have no idea how to make a balanced game. there are matches, and unfortunately there are many, where the opposing team simply doesn't die. everyone heals too much and everyone does too much damage. i gave it a 0 rating only because, unfortunately, you can't give a negative number, because this game deserves a -50 rating.
whose idea was it to give ai to predetermined your loses and wins is pretty dumb, since they gave zero f****ks for matchmaking, i'll just give zero f***cks for the review

751.4 hours on this game, feels like i wasted a decade of my life into this game.your time and money is better spent elsewhere, the community is for the lack of a better word decrepit. if you're a casual enjoyer that's fine you hop into quickplay play a couple of games but for a competitive focus game, it ****. the matchmaking, it forces you into a 50% win rate or sometimes lower it is not worth your time and effort to rank up. honestly the game does not deserve any love as the developers only cares to manipulate every outcome of a match. overwatch literally took them years to tear down everything they build, and rivals took them a year to tear everything they so hardly try to build. in conclusion i would have given the game 7 out of 10 at the beginning but as time goes on i'd rather give it a 0. every rival's player who knows and plays this 80 percent of them are miserable.

was a pretty good game, but daredevil ruins it. every daredevil just uses a macro and pushes one button to instantly delete any non-tank from the game. there's no counterplay to him. black panther's running around with macros as well, instantly 180° dashing pixel perfect through the center of an enemy, that is physically impossible for a human to pull off and should get automatically caught by the anti-cheat. spider-man needs a rework. no one likes playing with or against spider-man. jeff is the dev's favorite hero. massive aoe healing for insane amount that also very easily deals damage to enemies at the same time for fairly high damage and can hit around walls. has 100 ammo for some reason and reloads really fast. is low to the ground, but has no issues aiming, unlike rocket who's bullets will hit the floor 90% of the time. has a tiny hitbox. moves really fast. has hitbox issues that have been in the game since launch that the devs for some reason refuse to fix. always has at least 2 or 3 team-up combos. i've provided lots of video proof of cheaters to the devs, with hard aim snap and aim lock, sometimes even doing so through walls, which is very easy to spot in a replay where you can see both team's outlines. no one on the enemy team able to see through walls or able to ping the target for the team to see, so it's insanely obvious that they are cheating, but they don't even look at the video and just claim the cheater isn't cheating. they only seem to ban those who receive x number of reports or are caught cheating on some popular streamer's channel. also, ue5 runs like ****.

i played for 6 hours and this is my idea. the problems of the game: - low frame rate - bad grafic - chaotic game design - opponent and ally are difficult to distinguish - game mode are like to overwatch and paladins but worse. this game on ps4 is unplayable.
i don't know what makes these chinese developers think it's ok to give a player 6 losses in a row with such bad matchmaking. i keep getting the worst player in the room in a row sometimes.

worst matchmaking and balance of any competitive game to exist. terrible devs and awful bug issues with each update. theres also a 2:1 imbalance of dps chars to tanks and healer characters causing horrible team compositions.

this game could’ve easily been one of the most fun releases of the year, but sadly it struggles in a few key areas like performance. the biggest issue, though, is the matchmaking — by far the worst part of the game. you often get paired with random teammates who clearly aren’t interested in playing seriously, and they just end up throwing the match.
i loved it for thelongest time, unfortunately as it is so often, neteasy screwed the pooch as always and took all the funout of the game once again

devs lie about their engagement matchmaking, or eomm, which makes the games a coin flip and either you're getting stomped or you're stomping, there are no equal matches. when you lose, it's people on your team literally running out solo and instantly dying repeatedly, getting zero kills, standing out in the open basically throwing, while the enemy will be celestial level players getting 30 kills. the game also has a rising cheating problem which the devs refuse to even address. troll players in a growing number of matches are using aim, invincibility, and other cheats, and nothing happens to them. it's obvious. people surviving point blank ultimate atacks, being hit by your entire team and their health bar not moving. people just spinning and auto locking you when they didn't even know you were there. the devs will not actually ban anyone from the game. you can use cheats, throw, smurf, call people whatever you want using bigoted language, all they'll do is "limit their competitive matchmaking" for a while. they'll just log out and be back later. all netease cares about is using the marvel brand to sell skins until this dies. they put out 3 or 4 battlepasses to buy, while there is still a battlepass you've already paid for. they put no effort into reverse the garbage "matchmaking" or stopping the cheating and smurfing making the game unplayable for anyone but trolls. this game could be so good, the artists do their job well, as with most games, but the people running the rest don't care about literally anything but making a quick buck off captain america and crew.

a game that plays the gamer rather than the other way around. 0 fun in having constant win or loss streaks. 0 fun in getting into a match to stomp or get stomped. props to netease though, for knowing how to build a matchmaking system to get gamers addicted by letting them get high from win streaks and to always chase that feeling when going on loss streaks.

update september 2025. matchmaking and smurfing made me and literally all of my friends quit this game. the smurfing is absolutely out of control and the matchmaking encourages it. netease seriously cannot design proper matchmaking or protection against repeated smurf accounts. they must salivate at the idea of high rank players creating new accounts to steamroll low rank players, because they basically ask for people to do this. update: it's still absolutely terrible. myself and literally all of my friends who used to play this game have quit because of the abysmal, unfair, toxic matchmaking. good riddance. netease, sorry i won't be spending another penny on your awful game. placement matches. is it so hard to do netease? guess not because 'something something something' money? this game is already horrendously terrible enough with matchmaking with "engagement optimized" matchmaking where it literally puts you with/against higher tier players, but the seasonal rank resets and literally non-existent quickplay matchmaking are the icing on the cake. there's a reason you don't see 'casuals' playing anymore......matchmaking is an absolute joke, you will never ever have a fair match where you feel like you could've made a difference. it was fun in the beginning, but netease scared and chased off all the fun, casual players it had in the beginning. so, all that is left is a shell ****, with only the sweatiest, sweat lords you can imagine. i'd say "it's just me", but i used to play with 4-5 friends, daily, for several months. zero, none, not a single one of those friends play this game anymore because of how toxic and un-fun it has become. do better netease.
awesome game! i played more than 1.200 hours and could've played more if they had more solo content at the time, now it has.

an mmo that takes everything you love from all the other mmos you’ve played and collides them into one amazing free to play game. like pvp? we got that. like collecting? we got that x100. like raids and dungeons, and gear progression? we got that x1000. i don’t have time to finish this review because i must continue grinding my dailies. so, buy the game and stop wasting your time!

an sich ist lost ark ein gelungenes mmorpg, weil es mit freunden richtig spaß machen kann. jupp, die betonung liegt auf "kann" weil, ich finde es gibt viel zu viel an hauptstory und nebensächliches... manchmal verliert man den überblick und da verliert man etwas die lust, am ball zu bleiben. ansonsten wenn man was schönes sehen möchte und trotzdem herausforderung sucht, nimmt man ein buddy mit auf die dungeon quests und wählt ein anderen schwierigkeitsgrad aus. also dafür nur 7 von 10 mayfusion points

where it seems most games are hardly worth the time to play lost ark is the exception. the writers of lore seem to be initiates into some mysteries. even some of the fan base, the way they seem to analyze the goings on in arkesia and petrania (the worlds of lost ark) seem to be of another class. it is in fact similar to other games as far as the story / lore goes, but it’s not just killing demons (although it has a lot of that too !). planets and stars from our own solar system, such as regulus are revered and worshipped, making this game more believable and in turn, immersing the player in the story and game. from the lore, to the soundtrack to the graphics and character design this game excels.i can hardly believe i took a break for 3-4 months only to play other popular games. to get disconnected every day, multiple times a day. to experience graphics bugs and glitches, ui bugs and glitches each and every **** this only helped me to realize how poor alot of these other popular games are and how superior lost ark is. in fact, if i can recall, i dont think ive been disconnected once on lost ark and i dont think ive ever experienced any bugs or glitches .there is alot going on in this game, the ways to improve your character and abilities can be overwhelming at times and honing can seem next to impossible, even to finish the main story. however it is worth sticking with this game.
great mmo, wish it would be ported to mobile. xoxoxxoxoxooxoxoxooxoxoxoxoxxo

also ich würde jedem casual player vom spiel abraten einfach weil der grind im end-/lategame zum weiterspielen der story absolut geisteskrank ist. ihr müsst pro tag mit ca. 6-8h rechnen wenn ihr wirklich einen fortschritt erzielen wollt. dann kommen noch so dinge hinzu wie das der itemshop pay for progress ist und die klassen einen genderlock haben. abgesehen dieser schon sehr gravierenden punkte ist das restliche game einfach der hammer aber wie bereits erwähnt ab einem gewissen punkt für casual spieler unspielbar.

visuellement bien et a de la profondeur. mais, comme les autres disent, très axé sur le payer pour avancer. je n'ai pas de problème à payer pour un jeu. en fait, je trouve ça normal. mais là, c'est abusif et ça peut raidement coûter très cher. le jeu est aussi un peu trop complexe à mon goût. les combats de type mortal combat avec constamment des cris me tombent sur les nerfs. histoire insipide.

it's a good game with horrible p2w systems. pretty much what you would expect from every mmo these days. if you want to rmt or p2w through the store, this game can be really fun. if you want to be a f2p player like i was, you are too late and you will always be behind. go try a newly released mmo instead.

disgusting p2w game of the worst kind. think diablo immoral. has multiple layers of p2w elements designed to force you to pay up, or else you cannot even access the end-game contents. only other option is to grind on 6 characters like it's your 2nd job. oh wait, no, like it's your only job. stay far, far away from this garbage game.

lost ark falls short of its promise as a captivating mmorpg. despite its visually stunning graphics, the game suffers from repetitive quests and a lackluster storyline that fails to engage players. the combat, while initially exciting, quickly becomes monotonous and lacks depth. additionally, the game's monetization practices heavily favor pay-to-win mechanics, creating an unfair advantage for those willing to spend real money.

be warned about this game. they will issue bans if you don't play. many players got the game for free on steam, realized it wasn't the game for them, and quit playing. now the developers have issued gamewide bans for inactive players, which shows up as a red mark on you steam profile. further more, there are a number of other steam games that won't let you play if you have a ban. if you have a old steam account with thousands of hours and dollars invested, do not get this game unless you are prepared for a ban.

dota 2 is not just a game; it's an experience—a challenging, sometimes infuriating, but ultimately rewarding journey. for those unfamiliar, dota 2 is a highly complex multiplayer online battle arena (moba) game that demands strategy, skill, and ****’s be honest: dota 2 is hard. the steep learning curve can make it feel overwhelming, especially for newcomers. the intricacies of the game mechanics, the vast pool of heroes, and the ever-changing meta can leave even seasoned players scratching their heads. it's not uncommon to feel frustrated, to the point where you might consider breaking your keyboard or mouse after a tough **** that's also what makes dota 2 the perfect game. the intense emotions it evokes—from the highs of pulling off an incredible play to the lows of a devastating defeat—create memories that last a lifetime. every game is different, every match a new story.beyond the gameplay itself, dota 2 has a way of bringing people together. whether you're teaming up with old friends or meeting new ones from around the world, the bonds formed through shared victories (and defeats) are strong. many players find themselves making lasting friendships through the **** conclusion, dota 2 is a demanding but deeply fulfilling game. it challenges you, pushes you to your limits, but also rewards you with some of the most unforgettable gaming moments. if you're willing to invest the time and effort, you'll find that dota 2 is not just a game—it's a community, a passion, and a source of endless joy (and maybe a bit of rage too).
jogo desde o lançamento e nunca deixo de jogar, sempre inovam nos mapas e personagens
i always come back to play this game, i started playing since dota 1 and dota 2 did not disappoint.

no, it is not free the price is your soul your time and your whole being will make you suffer more than the death of a loved one and in time you will stop feeling pleasure when winning you will only feel something when you lose i guess i recommend it 10/10

добрая гульня, але даволі таксічнае кам’юніці і амаль поўная адсутнасць магчымасці гуляць у сваё задавальненне, не хвалюючыся пра рэйтынг. найбольш падабаецца шматслойнайсць гульні, бо кожная механіка не такая простая, як здаецца на першы погляд. золата дзеліцца на надзейнае і не найдзенае. урон дзеліцца на фізічны, магічны, ды чысты. і так з кожнай механікай, заўсёды ёсць другое дно.

the game itself is very beautiful and what a wonderful strategy. but the behavior evaluation system is the meanest and most unfair of all online games on earth. it was created so that players playing dota 2 were always nervous and aggressive. it is easy to ask any healthy person one question: if the game has the ability to block or mute a player, then why was the option to report a player for unsatisfactory behavior in the game created? if i do not want to listen to a player, i can muted a player and why should i report him. no, gaben and in particular the developers of valva created a special system to disrupt the nervous system of children and develop snitching. this is simply terrible, because it is so intellectually dull and mean.

game was fantastic in the early days, i used to spend 100, 200 usd monthly in cosmetics, amazing experience... till they changed mmr, from a sudden facing all sorts of awful players. now the patch 7.33 it's the final nail in dota 2 coffin.

ah, dota 2, that shining beacon of strategic perfection in the online gaming world, where each match is like a musical symphony of plans and tactics. indeed, it is a game that immensely delights me, melting in the mouth like the culinary creation of a michelin-starred chef. and the ai incorporated into it? well, i must admit, its sophistication always astounds me when it pairs me and my "certainly" english-speaking teammates **** is quite astonishing that in this era of technological marvel, which dota 2 undeniably represents, artificial intelligence has still not found a way to interpret the "western europe" and "english" filters so that the outcome matches these settings. as i nobly select these options, i expect to immerse myself in an english-speaking utopia, where each match becomes an oasis of british etiquette and shakespearean exchange of courtesies. instead, i often find myself as an unintended guest at a cyrillic party, where communication is composed of mysterious runes and enigmatic pictograms.i cannot help but wonder if my client is inadvertently a window for the expansion of russian influence, where every keyboard, regardless of chosen language preferences, is secretly programmed to convert everything into the letters of the cyrillic alphabet. and i think to myself, oh, how charming, how insightful of valve to provide me with cultural enrichment without my explicit consent. indeed, how far can free education go?what an amazing school of patience and interpersonal skills, when this game guides me to mumble phrases in russian that i've learned amidst the waves of "cyka blyat". dota 2 is not just a game, but also a language course and a social experiment that broadens my horizons far beyond the usual limits. in its boundless kindness and education, valve continuously contributes to my personal development. and for that, my endless gratitude.

last update - dislike you deprive the players of interaction! 6000 - to write to the chat, 8000 - to talk - it's too much! players on a low rating throw reports just for fun - and as a result, people simply do not have the opportunity to raise decency! together with the introduction of such a system, it was necessary to at least reset the decency indicator! my decency is 5700 - although i am not a toxic player and try to play normally. you're just killing the game on a low rating and a mid-level rating. terrible update! fat dislike! it kills the desire to play! a few of my friends have drop dota 2 after this patch. back to mute by default, so that the player decides - unlock teammate or not!

warframe is existing for over 12 years now. it has grown incredibly good. the game and its dev team had quite the journey in all this time and they did a lot for their community. they are a prime example of how a dev team should approach the development of their game/product. personally, i've never seen any game developer that poured so much heart and soul into his product, worked so well with everybody else and their community and did overall so incredibly much to stay alive. warframe offers: one of the friendliest communities in all of gaming, a deep, emotional lore, a huge variety of approaches for the gameplay itself, tons of missions, endless customizations, earnable in-game currency (you don't have to invest a single dime!), a huge variety of systems and content within the game.) and much more. and all that: for free! it is an experience! warframe is a big mile stone and a well kept secret. believe in the game and you won't be dissappointed. stay safe, tenno.

the illusion of pay to win misleads many to believe its the only way to advance but the truth of it is that the platinum currency tbh no one actually buys and just trades in market or chat for it.. i have all the "pay to win" stuff with out having to fork out a single dime

the game is good, the rating is terrible because of ratings from 2014, 11 years ago. new ratings that are low are because they're are not invested into the super helpful community that is making the game easier for new players. extra information, "the new war" now has no barrier, it has been removed. it's not a distant memory.

this game is fantastic. the biggest flaw being that all the good content is at the end of the game. take your time with the main quests and you won't regret it! the more you play, the better the story becomes. currently, the latest quests are amazing. i started to play this game in 2025 because i found out about 1999 hex quest and on-lyne band. it's aaa content. you can even romance one of the characters, and the characters are superbly written. i am actually wondering how is it possible for this studio to come up with such brilliant content, which i would never expect from a f2p shooter.

great game highly reccomend to anyone looking for a powerfantasy of ninjas in space. the community is great and welcoming so if as a new player you feel lost or over whelmed there will always be some one willing to help out. gunplay feels amazing, movement is smooth and fluid. game is not pay to win in game currencies can be obtained with real money but can also be just as easily obtained by playing the game.

after a certain point of progression in the game it almost seems like the content is endless. it certainly is a hidden gem for players who are just familiar with it. it does have some loose ends though, but pushing a through some time and learning it becomes a real reward. warframe lacks in beginner introduction to its game mechanics specifically being the upgrade system and where and how to acquire gear/items. it also lacks in early game story to flesh out the universe and onboard players into the world. the microtransactions are completely avoidable as players can trade premium currency for in game items.

we could be looking at one of the best f2p in the history of video games. warframe is a game that mixes fast-paced action action with the precision of a third-person shooter and a great parkour system. warframe offers a vast arsenal to suit all playstyles, with over 60 characters with their own unique identities and abilities and a versatile and intuitive build system. this game will offer you months of fun and content, whether you're playing alone or with friends. and if you ever run out of content, don't worry, warframe receives new content every few months, expanding its world and possibilities. the current warframe is unrecognizable from its version of 11 years ago, many reviews from the time don't do justice to the current state of the game, so don't be intimidated by the old reviews of professional critics.

with well over a thousand hours, i can say this is probably the best free to play games i've ever played. i can't get tired of it. the story is awesome, and the gameplay is very dynamic with hundreds of weapons and mods to improve them. and the community isn't even toxic, unlike other games. the developers listen to it and bring regular updates with new content. a shame the score in here is barely 65-70, when it should be above 85 because of people who most likely haven't experienced every single aspect of the game before becoming a self-proclaimed critique.
very good game, lots of updates with a lot of added content. game still alive after 11 years of existence. despite efforts to make the game accessible to new players, this remains a weak point.

apex legends is one of ea’s most notable titles, a battle royale game that continues to captivate players around the world even after several seasons. since its launch, the game has managed to maintain an impressive relevance, not looking its age, thanks to regular updates and the introduction of new content. one of the main reasons for apex legends’ continued success is its competitive and accessible development. the game is structured in a way that is friendly to new players, with a gentle learning curve that allows newcomers to quickly adapt to the game’s mechanics. at the same time, the game offers enough strategic depth to keep veteran players challenged and engaged, with a constantly evolving meta and a variety of characters, each with unique abilities. ea has managed to find an effective formula to keep players engaged season after season. the introduction of new characters, game modes, seasonal events, and map updates keep the gameplay experience fresh and exciting. this constant stream of new features and improvements keeps players coming back regularly, avoiding the stagnation that can plague other games in the genre. despite its success, it’s inevitable that some players have dropped out of the game over time. however, apex legends’ player base remains robust, with only a small portion of the original audience having left the game permanently. this is a testament to ea’s ability to keep the game engaging and relevant, ensuring that the majority of players continue to find reasons to stick around and explore the dynamic world of apex legends.

path of exile is nothing short of a masterpiece in the action rpg genre, offering players an unparalleled experience that combines depth, complexity, and engagement. the game excels with its vast character customization options, particularly through the intricate passive skill tree and the unique skill gem system, allowing players to create truly personalized builds that cater to their playstyle. the dark, immersive world of wraeclast is rich with lore and filled with challenging enemies and epic loot, making exploration feel rewarding and exhilarating. the frequent updates and expansions demonstrate the developers' commitment to constantly evolving the game, introducing new mechanics, leagues, and content that keep the community excited and engaged. additionally, the game’s free-to-play model is executed flawlessly, offering a fair experience without pay-to-win elements, making it accessible for everyone. overall, path of exile stands as a benchmark for what an online rpg can achieve, combining deep mechanics, a thriving community, and an expansive world into a consistently rewarding adventure that sets a high standard in the genre.

the only downside of poe is the barrier of entry for new players. being such a complex game, with years of deep complex, and meaningful systems accumulated, the game can be quite intimidating for new players. but i can guarantee that if you like the genre and keep playing past the initial learning curve, you will not be disappointed. the character progression and build creation potential are honestly almost endless, and this paired with a solid campaign and an amazing (and almost a bit addictive) endgame array of options, makes this my all-time favourite game to play continuously.

i’ve now played poe 2 for over 90 hours, and i’m completely disappointed. the only aspects that make the game remotely interesting are the graphics and the skill tree. the regular mobs on the maps are generally no challenge at all. bosses simply spam countless aoe attacks and throw trash mobs at you. there’s no noteworthy mechanic or significant challenge behind the boss fights. they just deal massive damage and have an endless health pool. when it’s supposed to be “especially difficult,” the boss room is artificially shrunk until you’re forced to fight an aoe-spamming boss in a tiny square, or they use damage types against which it’s nearly impossible to have sufficient **** 1 is far more entertaining and enjoyable to play. in this case, it feels like they tried to create a dark souls **** my opinion, poe 2 doesn’t deserve any attention, and the price for early access to a free-to-play game is outrageous, especially since you’re not really getting anything special for it. sure, let the test players pay for the privilege of being test **** sum up poe 2 in bullet points:boring mapsabsurdly stupid boss fightszero innovationextremely long farming due to almost no useful gear dropsmindless grindacceptable graphics but poor performancethe game isn’t worth a single cent! if you’re considering buying it, i can only advise against it. wait until it’s free to play.

poe fanboys will defend this shiny, polished turd to the death. fact of the matter is this game is badly designed in so many ways, that ggg should strongly consider firing whoever came up with some of this. the skill tree is a disaster and needs to be completely reworked. map bosses need fixed. loot system needs fixed. endgame needs a total overhaul. endgame has no viable builds, you are gridlocked into one of the "templated" builds because experimentation does not work. overall, these types of games are supposed to enforce risk and reward- this game has no reward. they tried to copy the dark souls formula and dropped the ball. poe fanboys will say "ph well i had no problem sinking 12 hours of my day into getting a weapon that does 4-12 more dmg than my current one" as if that's anything but bad game design. skip this one.

it's an insult (especially in the age of overwatch 2) to call this game a clone, especially if you're aware of the development cycle and timeline of both games. but i do feel that i have to mention that first, due to the image the game has and how much that oversimplification has harmed the game's reputation. this game honestly feels infinitely more balanced than ow foundationally. ow forces you to play certain team comps, on certain maps, with each character usually having a single viable playstyle with little room to budge. paladins offers tons of playstyles for each character through options like talents, in-game store abilities (think mobas, not actual cash stores), and even a loadout system using deckbuilding to sway your characters skills to your playstyle, optimizing exactly how you play. overwatch is such a frustrating experience because of how thin its meta is and how you're forced into certain playstyles and comps. if you don't follow them, you're going to get steamrolled. if you play support or tank and don't have reliable teammates, you're going to get steamrolled since you can't manage enough to defend yourself. paladins gives you the option to play your role and hold your own when you need. this game is not an overwatch clone, it is better. you have options, you're not limited in how you can play characters, and while you probably aren't going to win without solid teamwork, you can at least have more freedom to sway the game in your direction and keep yourself alive by fighting back. also horses so it doesn't take 7 years to get to the objective, zenyatta could certainly use one lmao

destiny 2 started off shaky, however the latest release (witch queen) provides much needed updates to various systems including revamping the old specs, and new weapon forging system. legendary mode is a nice challenge solo or with friends. if you are on the fence, i’d say check it out you wont be sorry!

*destiny 2* is a sequel that expands and refines the experience of the original game, taking players on an epic journey across the galaxy to save humanity. the main story is more cinematic and accessible, with a plot that sees the guardians facing dominus ghaul and the red legion, an army threatening to destroy earth and the light of the traveler. the campaign is well-structured, offering a clearer narrative arc than the original, with engaging cutscenes and memorable moments that enhance players' understanding of the *destiny* **** gameplay in *destiny 2* retains the series' signature fluidity and responsiveness, with precise shooting mechanics and unique abilities for each class. the three main classes—titan, hunter, and warlock—return, each with new subclasses that bring variety and strategic options to combat. pve content has expanded significantly, with missions, new explorable planets, and activities like adventures and lost sectors that add depth to exploration. raids remain a highlight of the endgame experience, featuring complex mechanics that demand strong player **** the pvp front, *destiny 2* offers a wide range of modes, with a 4v4 structure that creates a tighter, more competitive pace. however, the initial progression system faced criticism for a lack of rewards and incentives, which bungie has improved over time with updates and new expansions.visually, *destiny 2* is stunning, with breathtaking environments and rich artistic detail. each planet has a unique and distinctive aesthetic, and the attention to visual details further elevates immersion. the soundtrack, featuring epic orchestral compositions, adds emotional depth to the game’s key **** essence, *destiny 2* provides a visually and narratively richer experience, blending polished gameplay with expansive content, making it a standout continuation of the *destiny* saga.
