хороший бесплатный шутер, да разрабы поступили стандартно, игра бесплатная есть донат и платные dlc. но это игру не портит, ведь донат даёт только красивый транспорт или корабль на который большинству игроков плевать. dlc тоже не дают какого-то особого преимущества над другим игроками только премиум валюта, дополнительные битвы локации и собственно дополнительная сюжетная линия которая не так и важна для прохождения основной. так что можно смело скачивать. и да тут есть сюжет в отличии от других подобных многопользовательских шутеров. к сожалению отключить мультиплеер нельзя но никто не будет вам мешать сюжет вы проходите один и только один, игру я ещё не прошел но оставить отзыв обязан хоть и поиграл относительно мало. но этого опыта достаточно чтобы понять стоит играть в эту игру дальше или нет. лично я рекомендую!что могу отметить из хорошего и плохого?хорошее:*мультиплеер не бесит(тупые игроки не могут помешать вам проходить сюжет и квесты)*за хорошую оптимизацию контроллера для шутера отдельный респект такое встречаю не часто*no pay to win тоже плюс, хотя по поводу dlc тут можно поспорить*русская озвучка*нет тупой системы лутинга, ты не умрёшь из-за того что у тебя слишком слабое снаряжениеи плохое:*когда текстура одежды багается когда вы садитесь на спэрроу не вся но большинство.но не смотря на всё это игра хорошая. стоит попробовать!

destiny 2 is a game in a rather rough shape followin (date 12/11/2023) heavy layoffs and the posticipation of the final expansion (which lorewhise was meant to be like marvel's endgame in a place where its infinity war didnt deliver well). playing this game on its fullest requires roughly an ammount of 180 euros if you want the full fleshed out experience, in a place where doing endgame activities requires a group of people (3 in total for dungeons, 6 for raids), thats rather hard to find in a community that on one side calls the experts elitists with massive egos and one the other views helping new players out a rather big waste of time. is destiny 2 worth playing? yes (on pc expecially) despite the downsides a new player has a lot to work with, improving, finding a team/clan and testing themselves on normal and hard versions of interesting raids and (for the more masochist) testing themselves in trials on a pvp ruled by meta ability spam of certain characters, exotics and damn smgs with qa rather **** balancing. (it aint worth it trust me). on a run for normal and adept loot with specific rolls. storywhise you have to put a lot of hope on how the story of the final shape expansion delivers, hoping that the season "battle pass" ceazes to exist with the following episodes that will be later introduces. the previous ones were mostly mediocre (apart from the witch queen). play this game (which possesses beautiful qualities) only if you ae aware of the risks...

destiny 2 is the best game i have played in years. an mmo with a great single player campaign. customization out the ying yang. graphics are just incredible on my nvidia 1060 3gb, believe it or not. runs perfectly and bungie has created a masterpiece here. i absolutely do not understand the hate for this game. i have only 6 hours in and have barely scratched the beginning. controls are simple and no tutorial needed. get this game!

the game doesn't work as a whole, and the tapir error appears. at the same time, the content was not withdrawn on general grounds. the game is not working, the paid content is unavailable because the developers have decided to block the cis region. in other words, they took the money, but restricted access to the content based on regional and national characteristics. i can't continue using the paid content or the game in general. those who continue to play in other regions, think about it. the same thing may happen to you one day.

do not buy edge of fate. this is one of the most blatant examples of anti-consumer design i’ve seen in destiny 2. bungie removed over half of the activities from the previous season, replaced them with shallow, recycled content, and have been asking players to grind the exact same things on repeat as if that’s “new content.” it got old really quick and that isn’t game design—it’s a cash grab. the focus isn’t on creating a rich, engaging experience for players anymore, it’s on squeezing every cent out of the community. bungie has shown they don’t value their players’ time, only their wallets.with sony’s acquisition, there’s hope for change—but right now, destiny 2 is running on a rinse-and-repeat formula that insults loyal players who’ve supported the game for years. don’t reward this behavior. spend your money elsewhere until bungie shows real respect for its community.
the game gates all the gear behind absolutely horrific jump puzzles. i went 2 hours without firing my gun a single time.
bungie is actively blocking destiny 2 to be playable on steamdeck and linux. well, then bungie, we are done, you won't get anything good from me.

i like it. i love realistic shooters, such as tarkov or insurgency. but in this game, it's like "arcade-ly" realistic. you die instantly when you get a head shot, which is good, but in the next moment you recovered from a grenade that just exploded besides you? and you hold your gun in the perfect aim position after running 50m? arcade or a "realistic" shooter? but that's of course not a really bad thing. the game itself is fun and with the right team and mods (open mod support), the game can be really fun. especially during role-play or intense fighting areas.

i assume the game is at its final stage of its life cycle. and to be fair if livewire is its last update i wouldn't be that sad, the game is in good place. i would say missing only a competitive mode. gameplay is solid and dare i say better than cod mwf 2022. punchy sound and lovely non woke cosmetics that fits the theme of the game mostly. performance has come along way. sure the player base is not that huge. but u will have no issue finding a match. 83/100.
there is a stark difference between the base game and the ismc mod. do not play without ismc. period. 7/10 for base game, 10/10 for ismc mod.

j'ai eu une mauvaise expérience avec helldivers 2, mais ils sont majoritairement dûs à l'affreux portage pc qui a de nombreux problèmes très irritants. le jeu en lui-même est fun entre amis, mais je ne me verrais jamais jouer seul, c'est simplement, car il est très répétitif dans le fond, mais spectaculaire dans la forme. jouer avec des amis nous fait oublier que c'est la même chose en boucle due au chaos environnant et des moments drôles. malheureusement, le portage pc apporte des problèmes qui m'ont fait mettre le jeu de côté pendant 1 an. je n'ai pas une bonne connexion et si le jeu ne détecte plus votre connexion pendant un court instant, il vous déconnectera instantanément voir même ferra crash le jeu. et si on combine ça avec le fait que les touches clavier sont réinitialisées à chaque lancement, ça devient rapidement insupportable. cependant, ces problèmes ont été résolus depuis donc je ne peut que le recommander si vous comptez jouer avec des amis.
es el juego que no sabía que necesitaba. soy un fan de starship troopers. y este juego le hace honor. ha tenido momentos malos, pero ahora está muy equilibrado. es muy divertido.

o jogo é otimo!, mas vamos lá a analise, o jogo não vale 150 reais, pra mim nenhum jogo vale esse preço, no maximo 80 , mas caso vc queira comprar, saiba q vc ta pagando mais pela marca do playstation do q pelo jogo em si, pontos negativos que encontro, o jogo só tem 3 diferentes espécies de inimigo, tendo como base passes para liberação de equipamento ( q ou vc vai demorar mt pra liberar eles ou vc paga e consegue mais rapido, porém da pra conseguir gratuitamente) , o jogo e seu sistema de nivel acho bem rapido, com vc chegando ao nv 25 e ja conseguindo tudo do melhor do jogo ( onde pra mim seria mais divertido dar mais dificuldade na liberação dos mesmos, por ex em vez de 25 ser um 50 ) , lados positivos, sua comunidade é incrivel ! , sendo de fato uma das melhores comunidades q ja fiz parte , grafico perfeito, ambientação ainda mais, gameplay extremamente divertida e dificil quando vc põe na dificuldade 10 , seu hormonio de serotonina vai subir absurdamente kkkkk, e por esse motivo recomendo o jogo, mas sendo franco também com seus pontos negativos, minha nota seria um 8 /10 pro mesmo , vale apena

absolutely fantastic game. the gameplay is incredibly fun and satisfying. the overall style of the game, the parody that is super earth, the power the game gives each player etc. i definitely recommend this game. however, it does have a decent amount of glitches and bugs, some breaking the game you're in.

buen juego roguelike, sobre todo para pasártelo con amigos. una cantidad de objetos abrumante y el hecho de que se puedan acumular hace que puedas llegar a unos niveles de poder increíbles donde eres básicamente una maquina de matar inmortal. en este juego vas a morir mucho, muchísimo, pero esa es la gracia. lo único que le echaría en cara es la variedad de ciertos enemigos según el nivel y el hecho de que, una vez que te lo pasas, solo te queda rejugar para desbloquear algún personaje.

review_text: campaign makes it finally worth buying. epic combat, great teamplay, great for fans of ro2. only downside is outdated ue3 engine.
genres: Action, Strategy, Simulation, Indie, Massively Multiplayer

review_text: i have played many shooters. there is an appealing fear factor with rs2. a complete novice can get the drop on you, no matter how experienced you, are as a player. the weapons have real-world recoil and sound. you feel the tracers whiz past your head. my only disagreement with other reviews is that, the commander is not the most important role. squad leader is the most important, as you are on the front, in the trenches with your men, capturing points and painting targets for the commander...while under fire. also responsible for digging tunnels for spawning purposes. without the squad leaders, the commanders have no drops. in my opinion, this is one of the hottest shooters to date. even with its age, you still have no problem finding a 64/64 brimming with death and destruction. i luv it!
genres: Action, Strategy, Simulation, Indie, Massively Multiplayer

review_text: неплохая игра про вьетнам. куча карт и видов оружия. геймплей похож на оркестр, только теперь все с автоматами бегают. 4 режима, все в основном на 1 играют. несколько классов бойцов, у некоторых разные оружия. техника в виде вертолетов, за гуков туннели и мины. оптимизация слабая и графон так себе. для 800 графон очень слабый (2011) год. куча багов. еще с убийством и попаданием в врага проблемы. вышел на челика 5 пуль попал с каллаша, а он выживает и убивает тебя (интересно как). преготовтесь к тому что вы будете жить меньше минуты т.к постоянные артобстрелы, гранаты, и просто челы из какой нибудь жопы вас убьют. игру могу посоветовать только любителям вьетнама и реализма (мазохисты). и лучше дождитесь скидок, я ее за 270 рублей взял. фулл прайс она не стоит это точно
genres: Action, Strategy, Simulation, Indie, Massively Multiplayer

review_text: absolute joy to play. simple premise anyone can pick up: run as fast a possible and shoot everything in sight while listening to the fast-paced music that perfectly accompanies the surreal visuals. you die, you start over. the rooms seem to be randomly generated, so starting over doesn’t ever feel like a chore. definitely the best indie shooter i’ve played in a long while.

i won't say much but this is a must play for doom and old fps shooters enthusiasts , great gameplay and environment style, good movements, a generous selection of enemies, and to top it all, banger music. try it out, it is a lot of fun.

the chainsaw leg mechanic is one of the best mechanics i have ever seen in a video game. sliding around chopping enemies up at mach 10 with your chainsaw leg never gets boring. the game itself is excellent, from the incredibly solid shooting to the level design and music that pumps you up during different arenas. my only big gripe is that the bosses are kinda of bad and made redundant with the turbo time ability which makes every single boss in the game a piece of cake. other than that it's an incredible game
very fun game with a great aesthetic. fast and slick combat. it goes on for too long (in particular the ending) and the story is not especially well-written, but overall very enjoyable

this is one of the best fps games ever made. absolute goat of the retro shooter genre, in my humble opinion, and i would even argue one of the best games in the fps genre at all. if you love quake, this game takes a lot of inspiration from that, but has increased weapon and enemy variety. the level design can be downright inspired, and i don't think there's a bad level in the entire game. do yourself a favor and play this game.

one of the best boomer shooters out there. imagine the original doom modernized, and cranked the action and horror to 11, and add half-life 2 physics. the weapons are pretty good and you use all of them pretty frequently and the enemies are very creative and fun to fight against, and the levels constantly innovate on the previous one to keep it fresh. the boss fights are the only part of the game that i wish was better

everything was put together really well, but... episode 1 is great, episode 2 is fine, episode is mostly good. levels are either the size of a stadium or a mcdonald's playplace. gunfights are fun, that grenade launcher weapon is awkward to use. i believe a 7/10 is good, but metacritic doesn't.

this game is pretty cool and pretty sick. feel free to save like you would in skyrim, or to bump the difficulty down, it's going for that frantic quake/doom combat, and sometimes it can get quite tuff. sometimes it has meme or meme-like humor instead of taking itself seriously, and there is often cheesy metal playing, i would have liked less of that. the overall art style is fantastic, the wendigo enemies are one of my favorite designs in any videogame, and it also features some great ambient tracks.
this is to even out the reviews cuz 3.8 is way to low it should be like a 8 or 7

i went in expecting an already great game, but it blew me away on how amazing it was. the fast-paced action shooter went way above my expectations. while i can say that you can beat most stages with decent practice, it is still a spectacular experience that any player should immerse themselves in. the graphics are reminiscent of old shooter games, such as doom. overall, great game if you like shooters, and there is quite a bit of lore as well. therefore, i say 10/10.

this game is cracked out of its **** mind, it gets to the point were you can't even tell what the **** is going on, but it's so good, all the weapons and enemies, all the combos just feel so fluent and good. well done newblood you really know what your doing.

the best game i've played this year. the movement is amazing, the combat is incredible and the visuals are great! superb work, especially coming from an indie company. if you're a fan of first person shooters, do yourself a favour and play ultrakill
i **** love this game, it's just too perfect to be true. it's a dopamine burst, it's gameplay is so **** polished. i have no words to describe this masterpiece, just buy it.

prodeus is an old school classic fps which takes inspiration from both the doom and quake series. it is a pretty good game and a satisfying shooter though is not perfect by a long shot in my opinion. what is best about it is the shooting and the sound design especially when it comes to gunfire sound effects. the level design through a decent amount of missions it provides is almost superb at its best to almost quite **** at its worst. the guns are pretty amazing overall and they are extremely fun to use with some being even better than others. visually is alright even with the retro thingy that is going for but still i wouldn't exactly say it's anything spectacular. what keeps it down for the most part in my eyes it's a lack of viriety in general whether it's the enemies, the environments, the textures etc. there is not much of any of that really. what annoyed me personally is the respawn system after death which is something similar to bioshock, i could explain why but i will just say that it just doesn't work for me. and the final thing which is not exactly a problem but maybe is worth mentioning is that the game is pretty short, it can get 10 hours give or take to do most things in the game.

short review: i have three main issues. i noticed after 10 hours of playing that i had never died from an enemy, the difficulty is in finding the ores and the exploration/platforming more than the enemies themselves unlike in doom where both are difficult. secondly, i find that finding these ores is incredibly difficult, to the point where i often need to look online for their locations. even getting the map doesn't help much, as it lacks clarity and is convoluted. the issue is that the store is an integral part of the game, and not getting ores holds you back gameplay-wise. finally its a little bit repetitive, but i guess this is an inherent/vestigial trait of this sort of old school fps-style game. nevertheless, the game is still fun, and the sound design, style, and sfx are great and helps set prodeus apart from the rest. shooting feels great too. finally i like the amount of content there is, and the community maps is a great feature that adds a creative aspect and more replay-ability. it's a simple, fun game to briefly play daily. 76/100.
doomy goodness. really good level design and weapons that truly feels like a part of the series they are trying to emulate.

this might be my favorite boomer shooter of all time! and believe me, i played them all :) i grew up on doom, quake etc. but prodeus is so much more. the levels are cleverly designed and full of secrets. the weapons: there's 16 of them, and most of them are cool, clever (again) and really satisfying to shoot.
the game is great, but the missions are a bit annoying and there is no sound of footsteps

superhot stands out as an independent game offering a unique shooting experience. the game's distinctive feature is the manipulation of time, where time only progresses when the player moves. this grants the player the ability to slow down time when enemies are shooting or launching attacks.graphics and design:graphically, superhot adopts a minimalist style. enemies and the environment are highlighted with red accents on a white background. this design choice enhances the player's focus and strategic thinking.gameplay:the game allows players to progress through challenging levels filled with formidable enemies. however, thanks to the time-slowing mechanic, players can carefully plan each move and foresee dangerous situations. this provides a different and thought-provoking experience compared to traditional first-person shooter games.story:superhot's story transports players into a mysterious virtual reality world. as players attempt to complete a game within this world, they uncover secrets embedded within the game. the story keeps players engaged in an immersive narrative.shortcomings:some players might find the short story mode less satisfying, but this is compensated by additional content that enhances the game's replayability.conclusion:superhot is a standout game with its unconventional gameplay, impressive design, and challenging levels. the time manipulation mechanic encourages tactical thinking, providing players with a unique shooting experience. if you're looking for a different fps experience, superhot is definitely a game worth considering.
amazing game .

пробовал эту игру. вот мой опыт. я играл где-то месяц, делал регулярно каждый день ежедневные задания, копил внутриигровые ресурсы. потом случилось так, что я тупо забыл зайти в эту игру и сделать ежедневки. ну или банально не нашел времени. а потом вдруг я задался вопросом. а нафига я захожу в эту игру делать ежедневные задания и трачу от полчаса до нескольких часов в день, если игра мне особо и не нравится, ну не тянет опять играть. и тут я решил притормозить. начал играть лишь по одной причине - положительные отзывы из-за ее f2p дружелюбности. возможно, так и есть, я просто в игре слабо разобрался. ну вот не хочется в нее играть снова и снова. игровой процесс утомляет. игра имеет еще и мобильную версию. я играл только на пк, но мне кажется, что для смартфона эта игра очень даже ничего. сложно представить современного человека без смартфона с интернетом, вы можете играть в lor в любом месте, как вам надо будет убить время, доставать смартфон и запускать эту игру, а пк использовать для других игр

i recently started playing hearthstone until i realised after a short while the matchmaking was completely fixed and no matter what you did climbing ranked is next to impossible unless you spend money, so i uninstalled. then i started playing lor and guess what the exact same thing. gaming has died, the game developers of this world are greedy and corrupt just like the rest of it.

another pay to win card game in the same vein as hearthstone and gwent. if you like hearthstone but would rather play a card game set in the league of legends universe then this game is worth checking out. be forewarned though, just as with hearthstone, you'll either have to spend a lot of money up front or spend a copious amount of time playing the game over the coming months to be able to build a competitive deck. matchmaking is abysmal and deck balance doesn't exist. the game seems generous at first with rewards, but you quickly learn that the rewards aren't the powerful cards you really need to compete. and if you decide you do want to spend money, then i hope you have plenty of cash to burn because it will cost quite a bit to build a competitive deck or two with how the shop is structured. card balance and mana costs need a lot of tuning, which is surprising since i would have assumed they would have gotten this more balanced before going live. some champions are absolutely broken, tryndemere springs to mind. he's insanely powerful and once he's on the field it's a guaranteed win. doesn't require any set up or intricate card combinations to pull off, just play him and you win 95% of the time. that's not well balanced, and that's just one example. stay away from this game unless you plan on spending a lot of money, or don't plan on having a competitive deck for several months, because it will take at least that long to build with the reward system currently in place. riot also employs bots in ranked play.

i haven't seen anything like it in years. it's an extraordinary game, a masterpiece in every aspect: design, art, dialogue, gameplay, graphics, characters, etc. game of the year, without a doubt. it's the best example of how much can be achieved with very little. studios lack the talent and time to create these works of art. i think it's the game of the decade.
this game literally changed my life. it made me think of things i have never even thought of. something so impeccable that i can not even explain it.

clair obscur: expedition 33 transcends the medium and delivers on every single front. games time and time again try and fail as they expand in scope - this isn't a diss on any production, but it's more so the reality of development. there is so much to do right, leaving many avenues to invariably mess up on. expedition 33 manages to nail every single thing it attempts to deliver on. its storytelling is masterful: a shockingly emotionally profound journey woven in the backdrop of grief, love, and family. the soundtrack is just... wow. visuals are stunning, gameplay is addictive and well polished (a singular inconsequential bug during my entire playthrough). truly a generational experience. i implore anyone, irrespective of whatever games are their typical go-tos, to dive headfirst into it. and this is the studio's first game?? bravo

absolute video game! this game takes everything you know about video games, throws it in the trash, and presents an unbelievable experience that elevates the rpg experience to a level that no other studio will reach anytime soon. for me, it is the game of the decade until now (november 2025).
one of the best rpg's i have played. story, combat, quests, everything about it was good. will definitely replay it in a while.

2h is the time it takes to create my character, and it was so worth it. one of the best stories ever made. even with the gameplay that i really don't like, i can't hate this game. it's so well done, and the god-damn amount of choice you have made your character feel like its own character. you have to try

as a huge fan of divinity original sin 1 & 2, i had pretty high expectations and i must say i wasn't disappointed. every aspect of this game shows a level of care that is very rare even in productions of this scope, and i think this is one of the best crpgs i've ever played.
beautiful retelling of cthonic lore through a modern, yet respectful lens. gameplay loop never gets boring, although i wish each run was a bit more randomized

almost 50 hours of playtime, in which 90% (or potentially more) of gameplay is basically just dialogue. if it sounds boring or you just don't like reading (though there is voice acting) i'd still strongly suggest giving it a shot. the writing in this game is beyond impressive. close to perfection. a masterpiece which is best to explore as blindly as possible. if you are planning to play it anyway, dont look up anything,experience it yourself. its baffling to me how captivating the story is and how the "gameplay" just flows. multiple times during the first playthrough i found myself sitting there for hours basically just talking to people. an entire dialogue can take up to 20-30 minutes even and at the end of each conversation it leaves you with clue or an idea which you wanna find out more about. if you're up for an epic, incredibly humorous, adventure in this detective role playing game with incredible storytelling, characters, worldbuilding, soundtrack and art direction i beg you, at the very least, give it a try.
una obra de arte en el apartado narrativo, siento que la mecánica de que la ropa afecte a las tiradas le quita un poco de gracia, pero hace sentido, la ropa expresa nuestra identidad.

like chained echoes, sea of stars is a beautifully crafted throwback to the 90s rpg era, complete with all the quality of life improvements that we’d expect in the 2020s. no more random battles, painful level grinding and scattered save points; and as for the old-school ways of turn-based combat, it’s been given some clever twists, including a puzzle-lock system that gives you a chance to stop your opponent’s attack with the right spells. where chained echoes goes for a very elaborate and epic story full of plot twists, though, sea of stars goes for a more intimate and cozy tale of friendship and loyalty between three childhood friends who have a clear enemy to defeat. and whereas chained echoes had some fairly sprawling level environments, sea of stars has a more compact approach to dungeons, with tight puzzles to solve and pretty varied themes. i would say overall i preferred sea of stars for its moment-to-moment gameplay and chained echoes for its story. both have pacing issues and neither quite manages to reach classic status; still, i enjoyed both a lot and hope their developers will put out even better follow-ups.

destined to be an indie classic. i played this game on a whim on gamepass and i loved it. at a glance the graphics look really poor but this game truly rises above it and delivers on all fronts. the story and characters are compelling and sos has a lot of heart with some genuinely funny and emotional moments - just give it a try

lindo juego, lo puse en dificil es desafiante en serio. la historia es muy buena tambien y deja todo preparado para una secuela que esperemos que llegue pronto. mas o menos me tomo 24 hs de juego, no hice el post game que son unas 5 horas mas aprox

ter a experiência de um rpg de turnos totalmente inspirado em clássicos como *chrono trigger*, *breath of fire* e os três primeiros *final fantasy* é algo incrível, mas frequentemente negligenciado em prol de jogos grandiosos com gráficos realistas.*sea of stars* brilha na construção de seus personagens e entrega um enredo envolvente, sem deixar a desejar nesse aspecto. no entanto, em alguns momentos, o ritmo se alonga demais, fazendo com que a vontade de avançar por certas partes se torne maior do que o prazer em explorá-las. ainda assim, é um jogo que me marcou profundamente. minha nota final é 8.

doesn't crash or feel like its gonna brick my computer like hd2

seems more stable than hd2, and is a good fun bird eye view game to get away from the still on going engine issues with hd2. but hey they used the same engine. but what would i know, i just play games and research.....

basically alien swarm but not as frustrating and a cool wargame mechanic. that's pretty much all i can say. should you play it? yes. is it anything like the second game? no. it's a completely different game all together. will you like it if you played hd2? maybe. depends on what you played for. like i said, it plays a lot like alien swarm, utilizing similar mechanics from hd2 as obviously hd2's mechanics came from this game so... yeah. everything is radically different, including weapon customization. you get a few upgrades and can use research points to buy them. each upgrade varies in price. you get rp by leveling up and collecting samples. armor doesn't have passives, instead it's purely cosmetic, and all the armors look pretty good. the liberator has a bayonet upgrade. all in all a solid top-down shooter with fun gunplay and strategems to use. also actually in a playable state unlike hd2 so if you need that itch scratched but cannot stand the state of the second game definitely give this one a shot. it's also a great way to get acquanted with the upcoming units that are being brought over from this game to the sequel, even tho they will play differently than in hd1 it's still a neat sneak peak into what's coming next. 9/10, solid game, great soundtrack just like hd2, fun mechanics, and can actually run smoothly on any platform lmao.
a great game in its genre. the rpg style adds a lot to it! paradox really made one of their best game with that opus.

i bought a new alienware desktop computer to play this game, after watching footage of people playing it on **** and playing crusader kings ii, which is free on steam. it is up there with civilization 6.
maybe too small sometimes, maybe story is not toogreat. 10/10 anyway and much better than second game.

one of the advantages of wait to buy this game is that now (2019) when bought it, i get two different experiences. i get the classic version and a enchanted version. it may not seem significant, but it is. they are two distinct experiences of the same fantastic game. i have not finished the game yet, because it is an immense and challenging game, but honestly i think i will not going to finish it for now, at least on this classic version of the game. little more than 20 hours of playtrough in the classic version i think i have a good feeling of what the classic version have to offer and going to do the same with the enchanted... but back to the game, it is simply incredible. visually, mechanically. a pure role playing game experience, where the roots of the genre were transposed to the maximum. fighting for me is the most interesting and challenging element and it is necessary to use the head and the elements that surround us against the enemy. it is a game of elements where fire, earth, water and air annihilate each other in a perfect circle. its a game where an "area of effect spell" reaches not only the enemy but the ally in that area. and it's so perfectly done every single way, every moment on every fight. those small details are also huge and make this game unique. for me it is a masterpiece of the genre, that i strongly recommend.

ok i initially gave it 9/10 but closer to the end game becomes ridiculous with its quests. the door to the final boss is locked and i need to find 17 star stones in order to get through. every star stone is kinda a secret in the game, you don't get them that easily. so i'm 90 hours in to the game and now i need to shovel-through the whole 5 areas again in search for these bloody stones. devs, really!!?? wtf. it's just fckn ridiculous...

tried game for one hour. the combat is insipid, slow, and thoughtless. combat is turn based. if this game played like dungeon siege, it would have been awesome, but, it does not. the good graphics does not save this game. as a hero, you feel pretty weak and the characters are fragile compared to the enemies. the combat is painfully slow, it takes 10-15 minutes to fight 3 -6 skeletons! your spells and abilities seem only to pinch the enemies and the enemies heal 2 turns worth of your attacks in one turn. the enemies are also very spread out so you are walking around a lot with nothing to look at except the map. this game absolutely is a chore to play, and is not fun. don't listen to the hype, this game ****.

хорошая игра для любителей серии по гарри поттеру. сюжет средний, саид квесты главных персонажей нормальные. а вот доп квесты вообще интереса не вызывали, за исключения одного квеста. боёвка раскрывается только на позднем этапе, когда все заклинания уже выучены. музыка хорошая. мировая карта однообразная, её вообще не интересно изучать. вивари и выручай комнату интересно изучать и делать всякие постройки и разводить всяких животных, жаль что их так мало.

diese spiel gibt einen tollen einblick in den schulaltag der schüler*innen von hogwarts, es ist äuserst schon gestaltet und hat viel kleine deteils und anspillungen auf die welt von harry potter. allerdings ist es sehr nervig am nachdem man den endboss besiegt hat weitere 6 level zu farmen um die letzte mission freizuschalten, das klingt zwar nach nicht viel ist aber totstem sehr nervig vorallen da man nach der letzten hauptmission trotzdem noch weiter spielen- und somit das spiel auf 100% bringen kann. das wäre sogar gut und nicht schlecht wenn man nicht nach dem endboss noch mindestens 10 stunden leveln müste. das ist vörallem nervig wenn man nach dem endboss das spiel einfach nur noch beennden möchte, das geht sogar so weit das zumindestens ich am ende unr noch genärft da sahs und einfach nur dieses level ereichen wollte und das sollte ja auch nicht sinn der sache sein. empfehlen würde ich es trotstem da mir die zeit vor und werdend des endbosses äuserst gut gefallen haben.

25hours - really good game but the performance is really bad, specially the big bosses. i had to lower the graphics settings to the lowest just for the final boss to be playable, and even still there were stutters on every move the boss made. the world, combat and story are 9/10s.

it is a beauty, it seems that you are playing in a diorama the art is simply beautiful, each story makes you feel that you connect with each character and each ending is convincing and leaves a good taste in your mouth and invites you when you finish it to continue exploring its world, a must buy.

de lo mejor del 2018 que por suerte lo podemos jugar en pc desde el año pasado, lo jugue en su momento en la switch y ahora tiene una magnifica oferta del 50% en steam y pensar poderlo jugar a **** demasiada la tentacion, compra obligatoria en la plataforma que sea para los amantes del genero.

an underrated game that needs more attention, the return of classic turn based jrpg is the best, the characters are amazing, their specific skills are great and useful in situations then you just relate to them one way or another. the soundtrack in this is one of the best, the art style is amazing! i might buy it on the switch for portable playing!
you need check game out one the best game and lot action game and excellent graphic and good music and amazing story and good day

just wonderful, little gem that i recommend to anyone! it is very reminiscent of the final fantasy of the 90s, excellent for those who have not lived through those times and excellent for those who are nostalgic for that type of work, i think it should not be missed.

a significant improvement to the original and a perfect example that stunning graphics aren't all that a video game needs (although the stylization of this game will love a timeless vibe). if you aren't a fan a traditional jprgs, than they may not be the game for you. however, if you grew up on final fantasy games before they reach their double digits there is a wonderful adventure to find here. although its emulates it's older jrpg predecessors too much sometimes (this script needs and editor) the strong gameplay and soundtrack of the octopath series continues to shine. i have my gripes with the game, such as the story to gameplay ratio at times, however this is still a 10/10 for me. as a long time jrpg fan from the 80s & 90s, i look forward to asano's next creations as a creator who doesn't make perfect products, but makes products perfect for my niche.
jogo bom pra caralho. me ajudou a copar com situações semelhantes na vida real. a beleza desse jogo é absurda. existem momentos que você simplesmente para e pensa: "puta que pariu".
ein sehr schönes, aber sehr kurzes spiel mit nur maximal 3h spielzeit, wenn man es das erste mal durchspielt. artistisch sehr gelungen und die message kommt auch sehr gut durch.

diante de tanta beleza e sentimento, não tem como reconhecer o grande mérito por trás de toda a direção artística e musical. me tirou em mais de uma vez calafrios, porém, poderia ser algo muito maior. senti como se fosse uma demo de um futuro projeto, e isso me deixou um pouco decepcionado, algo muito parecido com o que é o jogo: sky children of the light.
excelente juego de plataformas. muy intuitivo. los puzzles no son imposibles aunque si te llevan un tiempo. la banda sonorame parece impresionante.

n'étant pas fan de la série des yakuza, je suis allé vers ce dernier volet sans avis favorable. le jeu s'avère très prenant et très riche dans les possibilités que l'on a de s'occuper (une floppée de mini jeux en tout genre, allant même jusqu'à intégrer un jeu de kart et de gestion d'entreprise ). les personnages et l'histoire sont plutôt prenant bien que parfois les scènes trainent en longueur (le gnan-gnan japonais dans toute sa splendeur). les combats sont plutôt faciles et répétitifs, sauf les derniers boss qui donnent enfin du fil à retordre. le jeu reste une très bonne expérience, rien que pour la balade dans ce japon citadin et contemporain.

wegen gametwo habe ich mir mein erstes yakuza game geholt und es war absolut witzig und hatte eine herausragende story, enorm viel humor, aber auch sehr ernst und emotional. man kann hier eine echt klasse gemachte spielwelt, super szenen und nicht vorhersehbare & schockierende storywendungen erleben!kasuga ist mir als etwas auf dem schlauch stehender und extrem gutmütiger ex-yakuza einfach enorm ans herz gewachsen und ich freue mich deswegen schon sehr auf infinite wealth und hoffe auch viele weitere like a dragon teile!die teammitglieder sind auch klasse und es wird viel auf sie eingegangen, sie haben ihre eigenen persönlichen momente in der story und abseits davon eine art charakterstory freispielbar, die nochmal etwas vertiefter ins persönliche **** gameplay ist dynamischer als andere games dieser art, nach einigen hundert kämpfen dann aber iwann doch zu viel, ich konnte auch mabutchi nicht besiegen, obwohl ich immer alle nebenquests und heldenaufträge gemacht habe, bevor ich den nächste storyschritt angegangen bin. das level-grinden sehe ich als einzige schwachstelle des spiels!

gioco che merita parecchio,ottima storia anche se sembra troppo diluita soprattutto alcuni dialoghi secondari, ottimo il **** principale cosi come quelli secondari, ci sono tantissime attività secondario che non annoiano (tranne la gestione dell'azienda) il combattimento a turni potrebbe infastidire i vecchi fan della serie yakuza, gioco divertentissimo pieno di battute e scene surreali gioco che merita

i had reservations about yakuza no longer being a story-based brawler, but this is honestly one of the best japanese role-playing games i've played in years. there's a fun job system, reminiscent of the ones you'd find in the older dragon quest games. tongue-in-cheek callbacks to other popular jrpgs are everywhere, from direct references to dragon quest to more subtle nods like the "new age hippie" that was one of the sillier enemies in earthbound. the story is just about what you'd expect from yakuza; the main plot is a somewhat more serious crime drama, while the subplots are every bit as zany as the ones in kazuma kiryu's adventures in the previous games. one of the best modern rpgs i've had the pleasure of playing.

i remember when this game came out and all world play it. i remember many streamers play it and others continued to play it a long time after its released. by seen it on streams i never got why it was so popular. some things in the game mighty confuse you when you see it such: the hack system game play or the air gameplay with the robot. the time past and i play games like "final fantasy online" which was the best mmorpg i ever tried and the time for "nier automata" has come for me even a bit late. the game is probably the most beautiful game i have ever played and one of the most emotional. literally the game reach the perfection on any part such: gameplay, story, soundtrack, artwork, characters, boss fighting. all touch the perfection for me and in every city i discovering it was a real expierence for me. all it was so beautiful and the game has something to put you inside. how you move the char and you feel it. is like you really you are inside in this place and feel all these things around you. i never expected to play and saw such a game and taste such perfection.this game has many things to offer and is one of the few games out there that is for everyone. every person can play it and admire it as it deserves. i wish i can put higher ratings for such a masterpiece
nier's story is a masterpiece when you get to the true ending

personally, my expectation from an rpg game is definitely having combo mechanics in combat. in my opinion, this was one of the biggest shortcomings of nier. when we look at other rpg games like devil may cry or final fantasy, we see that they do this very well. we experience combat at its peak with dozens of combo mechanics. nier, on the other hand, only offers us 2 different attack options and doesn't really showcase the combo differences between weapons. for example, i didn't see much animation difference between swords. i don't know. nier disappointed me in this regard, although the combat animations are quite nice. the second issue is the insufficient variety of enemies. i don't call the same robot with some metal scraps added on top and its level increased a different type of enemy. another issue is the environment design; i really didn't expect it to be this weak. if you want to understand what i mean, just look at the abandoned city map. that's all i have to say. this game, which has the potential to be much better and to enter the top 10 of the greatest rpg games, has been left in the lurch. it's sad that it is so little known even with 2b's influence. when i ask anyone around me, i hear that the only reason they play this game is 2b. it actually explains a lot...

not your casual masterpiece. this game is mind breaking, multiple endings,amazing philosophy, great combat mechanics and to top it all an eargasm of a music. this game is not just a games its a masterpiece of an art.
the discount they did with this game makes me feel democracy wanted me to have this also for super earth
fun to play when helldivers 2 doesnt work
wonderful gameplay and very democratic community. although there are a few exceptions. nevertheless, this game is a good way to spread enforced liberty even if one doesn't want to buy hd2.

tam bir başyapıt. oyunun gittikçe derinleşen çok iyi de bir hikayesi var. oyunu oynarken sıkılma ihtimaliniz çok düşük. bazı bölümleri çözmekte çok uğraşabilirsiniz ama çözdükten sonraki o mutluluk tarif edilemez. en önemlisiyse portal 1 e nazaran steam atölyesinde ana oyun kadar iyi dizayn edilmiş harita ve bulmacaların olması.

man this game, its got it all. ****' portals, killer robots, not so killer robots, potatoes and space. -1 tho for the weird cube-bot freaks wheatly puts together. 10/10 masterpiece, like a slice of a well baked cake!

this game is timeless, as in 2025 it still holds the title of the best puzzle game and is recognized one of the greatest games ever. it even holds up well graphically, as it feels every aspect of this game has aged like wine. some of the best characters, worldbuilding, and writing a video game has ever seen, and an unbelievably amazing experience. play
10 - masterpiece 9 - amazing 8 - great 7 - good 6 - okay 5 - mediocre 4 - bad 3 - awful 2 - painful 1 - unbearable

don't starve is a survival video game developed by klei entertainment. the game follows a scientist named wilson who finds himself in a dark, dreary parallel world known as the constant and must survive as long as possible. to this end, the player must keep wilson alive, fed, and mentally stable as he avoids a variety of surreal and supernatural enemies that will try to kill and devour him. the game's adventure mode adds depth to the sparse plot and pits wilson against the game's supposed antagonist, maxwell.
the art design is awesome. it's a lot of fun with its survival mechanics and variety of characters.

assume the role of wilson, an intrepid gentleman scientist who has been trapped by a demon and transported to a mysterious wilderness world. wilson must learn to utilize his environment and its inhabi

completé el 78% del juego en un total de 30 horas y 58 minutos sin mirar guías ni nada. estuvo muy divertido. lo que más me gustó del juego fue el movimiento por el mapa, es bastante fluido al igual que su combate.

no geral o jogo é bom mas tem partes meio chatas como o diário do caçador e fazer 100% no modo alma de aço mas no geral ele é bom fora a historia maravilhosa arte legal mas não afeta (os gráficos a historia é no máximo um ponto forte) e sua dificuldade é balanceada ou media até com uma exploração magnífica essa é a minha review

hollow knight es un 10/10 absoluto. un metroidvania con una jugabilidad precisa y desafiante, una banda sonora que se queda grabada en la memoria y una atmósfera inolvidable, reforzada por un diseño artístico fenomenal. team cherry creó una obra maestra que no solo redefinió el género metroidvania, sino que también se consolidó como un referente indiscutible, ganándose un lugar entre los mejores videojuegos de todos los tiempos.

una reseña no es suficiente para describir lo que este juego ha hecho por los metroidvania, belleza de juego por donde lo mires, el movimiento esta pensado al minimo detalle, como una escultura griega, ningún otro juego se le compara a lo que hizo team cherry el momento en el que se les cruzo por la mente crear semejante juego y no, no es glazing, bueno un poco si la verdad

a truly unique indie rpg with good music, interesting combat and a story that will keep you guessing with its creepy, funny and interesting moments. avoid story spoilers at all costs! if you like rpg maker games, classic nes/snes jrpgs, and games that take you to fantastical locations go play omori!

enchanting world. beautiful music and artistic direction that fit the themes. this game would be a 10 if the combat gameplay were better. sure it makes sense thematically and it's clever in the way that abilities are used to give insight in the characters, but in practice it ends up being tedious. i still had some challenging and fun fights though!

feelings! if feelings and heartache is what you look for, omori is the game to play. amazingly well done, many layers of meaning and extra stuff to find. the gameplay is nice enough: turnbased like. altough, evidently, the battle system is not the core aspect of the game.. it is preety good, you have reasons to change your buils, select which skills to equip and make up your strategy.. it is not meant to be challenging, but is not naive either! i like it for this. the world is really nice and the design s amazing..only downside, and that is a great downside.. is that the main quests are really dispersive and often you wish that there were more main quests but shorter (because you end up losing interest). but that is the only negative aspect of the game. that being said, play the game to feel it not to rush it, experience it and it will talk to you
absolute masterpiece, made me cry, i don't any words other than "masterpiece" to describe this piece of art
the story is phenomenal. this game made me think about what i really want in life. its tear-jerking and eye-opening experience

the game is truly amazing, there is some slight flaws about the blinking mechanic when using the camera, but just here and there if you follow the guide on how to set it up correctly. the story is incredible for a game like this, truly eye opening and emotional. 100% recomend to anyone who is reading the reviews to just buy the game and play it without knowing anything about the story.

there aren’t words to describe how beautifully crafted this game is. everything from the storyline, to the animation, to the background music is perfect. the story is heart wrenching from the very beginning, and the twist is absolutely ****. though there’s only about an hour to ninety minutes of play time, it’s well worth downloading. would definitely recommend to anyone, although caution to anyone who cry’s easily, i spent literally the whole time crying. if i had to think of one issue i had with the game it would be the eye tracking, sometimes it was a little too sensitive and would sense a blink when i moved my mouth or hand, overall i’d like to underline that i really did love this game
a game that makes you say 'i can speedrun' the mechanics are very clever. the game draws you in more and more.

neon white is quite possibly the single most replayable game of all time. the movement is absolutely fantastic, the skips and new strategies you can take to improve your time is addicting. i genuinely cannot recommend this game enough to anybody. unfortunately, the dialog really is a massive downside for me. it completely takes me out of the admittedly pretty decent story. it doesn't hurt the game that much, since the game clearly isn't focused on the story.

such a perfect game! (except for the story, it's kinda cringe) the platforming and shooting feels so satisfying and the grasp for making a new personal best is enormous. the soundtrack from machine girl fits great while you slay down some demons. it's very unique and fun!

its definitely a unique and fun experience, but it didn’t fully manage to pull me in. the way it combines speedrun, platforming, and shooter mechanics is impressive. however, the weapon usage and level design felt a bit underwhelming. the story were mid, but the corny dialogues were surprisingly funny.

life is strange es un juego de estilo novela grafica, quizá algo mas evolucionada. a nivel de historia es muy bueno, casi impresionante con escenas para el recuerdo. el arte y la musica no se quedan atrás, bastante buenos. cuando lo jugué en su año de lanzamiento recuerdo que me impacto bastante y ahora que lo revisito me parece simplemente fenomenal, con esos aires de innovación (aunque ya no tanto) que hacen comprender por que es tan valorado en la comunidad. una maravilla en el cual su punto fuerte es la historia. el punto menos fuerte seria su jugabilidad, que se siente muy pesada para el desplazamiento, aun cuando la versión remastered según es mas rápido el desplazamiento, a mi se me hace demasiado lento, mas de lo que el juego requiere.
every moment of this game made me feel good and comfortable. every time i played it, i tried to play one episode per day so i could fully enjoy it and make it last longer. i love this game!
9 años después sigue siendo un juegazo. me hizo sentir varias emociones. lo recomiendo mucho.

here was something relaxing about the whole game, i am a **** for small american towns in movies and series, mix that with the state of colorado and you get a beautiful setting. while i thought the plot twist was pretty lame and could be seen a mile away, i somehow liked the characters. i had some great evenings with this game and found some cool tracks through it on youtube music. it… expand

this game is really underrated. i thought the story was amazing and because of the interactions i focused even more then i would whilst watching tv which made it even better. i really loved all the characters and found them all interesting. the game can be slow at times but even during them moments i never lost interest because the story still was moving forward at a good pace. a couple of things that i didn't like was that the game was way to easy. i know it focusing on story telling but still would have been nice if on the odd occasion something challenged you like qtes (quick time events) or some harder puzzles. a couple missions were kind of detective sort of thing but they were mostly self explanatory. another thing that was frustrating but not really an issue with the actual gameplay. for some reason when i 1st installed the game it kept crashing after completing chapter 1 and loading chapter 2. i tried verifying files (xbox app) and that didn't fix the issue. when i reinstalled it was fine thou. mite have been a corrupt file or something. it was saying something about a ue4 siren but no error code. another thing to note was that throughout the hole game i was getting random screen tearing during cutscenes. i tried messing about with video settings but nothing solved the problem. apparently it is just an issue with the game. its annoying thou cos the game has been out half a year and this should be fixed. overall the game is amazing and i really enjoyed it. if you enjoy slow pace story games then you should give it a go!
muito bom isso aí simplesmente sensacional bom do começo ao fim, tem uma partes parada mas outra q por serem bem carregada emocionalmente prendem sua atenção de uma forma sem igual

i liked most of the characters from true colors from the start. even if one or the other cliché was served here, i found the characters written interesting and i enjoyed following their stories. the main story itself is neither particularly innovative nor offers many surprises. still, i liked the way the story was told and it makes you think about it even after you've finished. it changes from sad to happy situations without exaggerating them. unfortunately, there are hardly any decision-making options and if there are any, they have little effect, but that didn't bother me personally. as usual in life is strange, you spend most of your time walking around, talking to other people and listening to monologues about things. the last one could have been shortened to a more bearable level for my taste. at least it gives you a bit more context sometimes. if you don't like games like this, which focus very much on the story and offer hardly any gameplay, you won't be happy with true colors. otherwise, i can highly recommend the game because it was a wonderful gaming experience for me, which deals with difficult topics in an unobtrusive way and still leaves you with hope and a good feeling.
dentre todos os lis esse é definitivamente o melhor. história e desenvolvimento dos personagens excepcional!
amazing story and game!! for sure better than first part!! this game must be a movie or series soon!!

highly recommend this one as well. the sequel to lis 1 in my opinion is just as good taking you on a journey between two brothers and surviving together with exciting twists and turns, a great art style, and improved graphics. choices actually do matter and it makes you genuinely feel like an older brother and that your guidance has a serious effect on how daniel turns out. the story can be brutally sad at points though so don't say i didn't warn you. the only complaint were some of the political topics covered especially in episode 4 and 5 can be a little on-the-nose and cheesy rather than impactful. the message i understand, but perhaps wasn;t delivered with great care.

very fun, got this after helldivers 2. i like how fast paced it is and the guns feel and sound awesome like they do actual damage. friendly people as well. the music is amazing (cyborgs difficulty 9+ my love) very good first time for me into the twin-stick shooter games
hope to get hand on las-13 trident in hd 2 soon
so dope! paid 4.99 and might be the best 5 i ever spent!
i wish i knew about this game years ago. its pretty fun and i'm currently on a quest for 100% achievement completion. it'll be a while since some achievements are hard and require the community.

if you're coming from helldivers 2 and wondering if the first is any good... don't bother. it's crazy to me how annoying this game is. i simply wanted to get in and practice a few games... well the terminids (my preferred enemy from 2) weren't available at all and trying to play a couple games solo was a massive mistake. the patrols of enemies spawn around you constantly. by the time i reload my gun another group of enemies is walking up on me... including cyborg dogs that outrun you and knock you over if they hit you. keep in mind this is on easy, from someone who has well over 100 hours in 2. you literally cannot go 5 seconds without an enemy showing up out of nowhere. god forbid you die, the game will just put you right in the middle of all the enemies - which, yeah, can happen in 2, but not consistently and i swear you get a couple seconds of lee-way before the enemies react. now, i'm sure that with more people, and with progression, the game could be fun... but holy shit the hour and a half i played was one of the most frustrating experiences i've ever had in a game, and frankly i can't be fucked to find out, i'll just play something i like.
pretending it's local co op in online play sucks

no fun on keyboard and mouse. the reticle to aim is nearly invisible so you are just running around blind. apparently other people have the same issue and frustration and from what i have read it has fallen on deaf ears.. how is there not a setting to change the color and/or just make it not camouflaged with the environment? thoroughly enjoyed playing the second game but little things like this ruin the game and make me frustrated rather than having fun.

i'm an indie boy playing indie games, really good game absolutely adore the dialogue and also love how you can interrupt people and if you maybe don't choose a response in time people will just naturally go forward with the conversation, the plot was good as well
the story is ok, its not really clear how the desicion you made will affect the content. has good graphics and the end changes based on the decisions you made.
loved it! amazing characters, lovely graphic and thrillng story. such an inspiring game : )
really good game! i'm not a big gaming guy but i gave it a shot and it really impressed me, it's super fun to play and the story is also really cute great "first" game to play like this
an extremely fun and cute little adventure. very fun mechanics and tools to aid in exploration. a perfect like package.

such a beautiful, precious gem ****. both cute and creepy. the development team consists of just 2 people - husband and wife, it's crazy how much of a wonder they managed to do on their own, there should be more studios like that to make niche, artistic, author story-driven games. for those who share my love for the game, there's actually a 2d game (which is technically the 1st) from this developers - "fran bow". 2 games share a universe and you will see some recurring characters, so definitely check it out, if you liked this one.
incredible game with an interesting plot and amazing graphics! i liked every single part of this game.

pretty interesting, wacky game. it was kinda slow at parts and the final explanation for everything wasn't as satisfying as it could've been, but this game really shines in terms of the characters and the voice acting.
un hermoso juego, excelentes voces, excelentes personajes, excelente arte, sinceramente un juego maravillos
extremely addictive game, and its roguelike. relaxed and stressing in some moment.

overall quite addictive, but i can't see how it got nominated for got. it has it's flaws, some blind bosses are insanely easy, while some are a bit over the top, the needle for example feels a bit much for most builds.
great rouge-like but might get boring after 50 hours. better to play on mobile than pc but still overall a great game. i prefer slay the spire personally

after 4 hours of playing balatro, i think i've shaped up a reasonable opinion;yes, i could see why this game took the world by storm. it's incredibly intuitive in user interface design and combat mechanics. the soundtrack is cool, the visuals are okay, and the gameplay in general is addicting. but for me, that's when it ends.i absolutely have a certain bias against this game and i'll admit that. when i see reviews on steam and metacritic, i feel like people are praising this game just for the sake of it. they're mentioning these, very very basic structures and spices for any rogue-like game entry. "no two balatro match is truly the same", "the game's deep mechanics deserves so much love", as if those two things aren't always the standard of a rogue-like game???maybe my bias is; i'm a very seasoned rogue-like player. hades, inscryption, slay the spire, risk of rain 2, dead cells etc. all of these games shaped up my expectation of a rogue-like entry. while i'm not taking away the fun that people are having with balatro (i'm absolutely having fun with the game too!), i feel like these things that people give balatro so much credit for, aren't anything but the genre's standard for me.this game is amazing, i won't deny that. it's a great value for anyone into the rogue-like genre, but i feel like the praises this game gets are a little overblown. compared to slay the spire, and inscryption, this game stands tall as a deck builer rogue-like with a fun & charming poker game aesthetic. presentation-wise, balatro isn't the most interesting thing out there, not even in my gaming library. however, an amazing game is an amazing game. i won't try to deny that. 9/10.

the very first chapter is amazing and although the game mechanics are not perfect as a strategy card game, the fun is in everything else and the card mechanics are still good enough make you use your brain

quero começar essa review com uma frase:"que porra foi essa?!"que jogo bom, jogo de carta delicioso e desafiador, cheio de estratégias e muitas maneiras de conseguir fechar o **** começo o jogo parece ser algo simples, mas conforme você vai jogando ele, muitas coisas vão acontecendo, um mistério maior começa a se formar, e quando você finalmente consegue, tudo vira de cabeça pra baixo e vira uma loucura. transformando o jogo em algo completamente diferente e inovando em **** amei esse jogo, teve um carinho enorme na hora da produção dele.recomendo a todos que joguem esse jogo sem ver nada dele antes, foi muito foda.e não se preocupe se você não conseguir vencer fácil, ele é difícil mas uma hora vai

a dark, and beautiful game about games, showcasing how your life for something can also become your own obsession, your own prison, your life, and your death. insryption evolves brilliantly as you play and subverts your expectations of what a video game even is. 10/10 gamepla,10/10 music, 10/10 visuals/atmosphere, and 100/10 ending. not only is this game a must play, but it is also a must beat.

que tanto estas dispuesto a perder con tal de ganar una partida de cartas a un viejo? inscryption no pierde el tiempo en atraer al jugador, pues apenas al abrir el juego, su estetica y musica obscura te hacen saber que lo que estas a punto de jugar no es tan simple como parece, lleno de misterio por donde lo veas, la historia va desenmascarando la verdadera naturaleza del juego inscryption, la mecanica es simple, gana una partida de cartas al viejo leshy, el principal antagonista del juego, con reglas creadas por el mismo, avanzas por varios mapas en forma de pergamino obteniendo cartas o mejoras para estas, dependiendo que recorrido quieras hacer, pues las cartas tienen varias estadisticas como costo, vida, daño y habilidades que se pueden ir mejorando mientras avanzas en la partida, creando oportunidades de crear un mazo que se ajuste a tu estilo de juego e incluso poder romper el juego, el gameplay es divertido, adictivo y, que mas podria haber en un juego de cartas tipo terror y obscuro como inscryption?. sin hacer spoiler te recomiendo este juego si eres nuevo en el genero y buscas algo fresco e innovardor.
gameplay: great. graphic: good. story: good. music/sound: good. dialogue/voice acting: na.

iconic game. 300+ hours played and still playing occasionally. lots of possibilities, many possible builds, at the same time it takes itself seriously and memes itself. 4 playable characters with extremely different gameplays, and little ecamotages that could make literally countless possibilities. nothing else much to say, it is what it means to be.. a dungeon crawler made for quick and pausable runs. only downside for me, but unimportant, i would have love a bit more lore
superb fun, enjoyable in short sessions with a nice ability to exit and save. very, very replayable! nice unlocks, and it just works. easy to see why everyone loves playing it so much!

this is the best rogue like game and it is not even close in my opinion the strategy involved to pick your cards right picking to many of a attack card can be a huge detriment to your build because you lack defensive options or certain build types could be really bad against certain bosses and i havent even talked about the diffrent classes in the game ironclad, the silent, the defect and the watcher are all great additions to this game with all extremly diffrent gameplay styles witch is what makes the replaybility of this game so amazing, but if i had a con for this game it would be the animations they dont look alive at all and they look like they were animated by a kid.

the game is solid, fun, and the format is finally fair (idk how much is gonna last do), but konami is giving almost no support to this game, there are almost no tournaments, no interesting new things etc. i'm gonna say making decks and opening box is rewarding and its really not pay to win. also the game is very luck based being a best of 1 with no side deck, players hate this and konami refuse to give us best of 3. also its just not that interesting to play the ocg meta of 1 years ago because that is what the master duel format always is, they need to support the current tcg and ocg more instead of making more and more alternative formats that nobody likes. there are free simulators which are better than master duel, keep that in mind.

i'm sorry, but the people complaining on here about how other people are playing are just plain bad at the game lol. choosing to play a bad deck will net you a bad experience, that's just how things work. the game itself is a lot of fun. great visuals, good resource system and a lot of fun to grind mostly. gems dry up quick and the fact it's months behind the real card game kind of ****. the best of one format is annoying but playable and it would be really nice if they implemented a banlist to follow that, but oh well. all in all, master duel is a lot of fun, so don't listen to the people whining that they lost to a combo deck that took a three minute turn because they wanted to play 57 card 1900 attacker beats. give it an honest shot and it'll be blast!

it's yugioh except you don't need to spend thousands of dollars if you want to compete competitively. crafting system and starting gems give you enough to make a viable deck to climb ranked from which, you have a steady income of gems to build more decks. presentation and music is amazing. just a really well done yugioh game. it's honestly an 8/10 but there are too many 0/10s complaining about losing to a "broken meta deck" only to describe a janky gimmick rogue deck.
it still has a lot to improve in terms of the ability to interact with the opponent to finish being a multiplayer. however it is a fun filled experience for any fan of the card game.

komoney destroying their own game!, this game turned into a lucky pay to win game. no strategy at all. coin flip simulator, you going first, 85% of victory. the algorith is tr4sh! so terrible that it trolls you, no kidding. boring and repetitive game, you duel against the same decks over and over again, and it will get worst, thats why they have lost over 70% of players, shame on you komoney edit: after almost 1 year, is the same terrible game, now we have a ftk meta deck in the ranked games...

a konami simplesmente não liga para as suas franquias. o card game é e sempre será divertido, porém já faz tempo que a konami não faz um game a altura. resumindo, para um jogo lançado em 2022, parece que tudo foi feito com pressa e apenas para cumprir tabela. não me leve a mal, mas toda a diversão que você vai ter nesse game é proveniente do próprio card game, e não do jogo "master duel", que poderia fazer muito mais do que fez. o modo solo é simplesmente esquecível. se você esperava alguma atenção para modos de jogo não competitivos, esqueça, o jogo simplesmente não te recompensa se você não buscar o competitivo. e pior, o competitivo também é largado, com uma ranqueada sem novidades ou recompensas relevantes, eventos feitos esporadicamente e também sem um sistema de recompensa legal. o jogo também te trava de várias formas claramente artificiais, pra não te dar recompensas. exemplos: pacote de cartas legado (recompensa pelos duelos ranqueados), só te dão 2 cartas por pacote, além de dar cartas irrelevantes e que não podem virar recurso pra fazer novas cartas; gema pela subida de nível na ranqueada (uma das melhores formas de juntar gemas, mas, a cada nova season você não vai voltar da ranqueada do zero, isso pra te travar de obter recursos de subida de nível) e por ai vai. no geral, você começa sendo bombardeado de recursos, mas depois o negócio simplesmente desanda de uma maneira que estraga a experiência, parece que o jogo não quer mais que você jogue. enfim, a konami deveria ter vergonha na cara e fazer um game realmente relevante para o formato, que merece cada centavo do investimento que eles não fazem.

the game (digital or in paper) is frustrating and not fun. basically you need to go first and play a broken deck that you are supposed to copy card to card, just to have a chance of winning. anyone can go first and checkmate the opponent even before they had a chance to play. the days when we used to brew decks and have fun are long gone by the money hungry machine of konami, the current game is a soulless shell that being kept and used by a company that only cares about money. yu-gi-oh was my first card game, fortunately there many other card games that have learned from the creator of yu-gi-oh the true meaning behind card games
it' was not fun for me
every aspect of this game is trash, just play the sequel
poor control system & physics. lack of precise script running.
terrible game. bad balance and weird ui.
fantastic narrative driven deckbuilder rpg with roguelike elements. very smoothe and polished. great art and character design. very good writing. love this game!

a good deck builder needs good variety. this is where griftlands falls short, core gameplay is simply unsatisfying long term and gets stale too quickly. slay the spire or monster train are much more engaging in this element. the main thing griftlands does get right is the story elements. the heists are and jobs are rather engaging and there is some variety that makes you want to do at least one more run. but once i had the perfect genocide and pacifist runs, i lost all interest in rerunning the game.

a seriously complex and interesting game. each playthrough takes between 2-4 hours (depending on how much side content you decide to do), and each of the 3 characters has easily 2-3 playthroughs worth of differentiated storyline to choose from. the game is well written and fun to play once you get the hang of it. theres a fairly steep learning curve; i don't think i would recommend the game for someone who hadn't played something more simplistic like slay the spire (not that the games are that similar, but if this is your first deck builder you may find yourself a bit lost early on).
this one and trial of fire are the best deck builder roguelike games i ever played...
hikayeyi sallamadım ama parkur aktı. müzikler ve görsellikte güzel. zorlu saf parkur oyunu arıyorsanız kaçmaz.
emotionally resonant and mechanically tight, but the punishing difficulty curve sometimes overshadows its narrative heart.

très bon jeu de plates-formes avec un style graphique particulier mais tellement réussi. bonne histoire, différentes ambiances mais surtout des musiques incroyables. mécaniques de saut satisfaisantes et speedrun intéressant.

celeste features some of the most fluid and responsive movement mechanics i’ve ever experienced in a platformer. the game's design encourages mastery through repetition, and as you grow more familiar with its simple yet nuanced controls, every challenge becomes a deeply rewarding test of skill. the more you play, the more satisfying it becomes, turning difficult obstacles into moments of triumph through precision and perseverance.

me encantó. amo los juegos de plataformas y "run and go". a la noche cuando quería dormir, cerraba los ojos e imaginaba bosses inexistentes, totalmente enfermo me dejó el videojuego. le cambié los controles. la barra espaciadora la usé para saltar (como en cualquier juego) y la tecla "d" para hacer el dash porque sino era incomodo como venían.
this game is incredible, a great animation and a beautiful backgrounds. the bosses are very god,it's very dificult

what is there to say about this game that hasn't already been said. the charming artstyle, the incredible music (seriously, i listen to it during my day to day life), the fun gameplay and the unique bosses all make this game a must have for anyone with a device that can run it. haven't played the dlc yet, but even the base game alone can keep you entertained for hours and hours on end.

i think the controls were a bit messy at the start, after changing the controls it was awesome. bosses were great, aiming for the achievements was also great, stopped playing at june of 2024 and probably will stop after no more updates, but the noise update was awesome. it is challenging but not to hard nor easy, and it's easy to beat a normal level where you don't have to restart like 10 minutes when first playing of work. i only died twice do to time the entire playthrough.

look, this might sound weird but this is probably one of my favourite video games of all time. this game has made me 100% all of my saveslots. even after finishing it this game is still one of the greatest things i've discovered in my life!

another idie game that blows the aaa competition out of the water. this should be the bar for indie games. everything about it is great. it's funny, and stylistic. it's engaging and infinitely replayable. everything from the in depth movement, to the bosses, and level design. additionally if you enjoy games like neon white, doom, celeste, or any other form of speed runner games, you should play this. not to mention that it does it well. another idie game that felt like it could be spedrun is rollerdrome. super fun game, but it forced you to get a certain rank before progressing.i felt it made the game worse. pizza tower does it the right way and encourages you to get an s/p rank, but doesn't require it.

while not the worst twinstick shooter ever made, helldivers 1 does [i]not[/i] hold up well to modern standards. the atmosphere (especially voice acting) is underwhelming, the combat is clunkier than its successor, and the game as a whole lacks the polish that is present in its successor. the atmosphere, in particular, is worth singling out above all other flaws present in hd1; while the core gameplay is passable, the atmosphere simply [i]is not there[/i] compared to hd2. comparing the intro cinematics between the two games is enough to summarize the difference, especially as that difference in quality persists long after the intro ends. only try this if you can live with a much more underwhelming atmosphere and gameplay is the only trait you're looking for.

to our american friends, if you see this message, please consider acquiring this ridiculous game company. love from eos. this should have been a historic moment in gaming — players from all over the world united for a last stand, a glorious comeback. but arrow turned its back on everyone who believed in them. all our efforts were in vain. we poured countless hours into this, and all of it was for nothing.

the camera being shared by the whole squad is god awful. it means you'll get jerked around as the squad moves to the boundaries. it's also way too close to the characters making everything feel claustrophobic. i get these are design choices but they're baffling.
